job_description:
About the job
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.



Job Description

Lead, execute and deliver data science engagements for Indonesia clients

Define detailed scope and methodology, design and create solutions, execute on frameworks leveraging appropriate tools and techniques

Prepare and deliver presentations to clients, effectively communicating insights, recommendations, and the value of data science solutions

Build strong relationships with Visa partners and clients, and corresponding data science/analytics teams to drive collaboration and implementation of Visa recommendations, track impact

Ensure consistency, standards & quality control of data science work, with all project documentation up to date

Actively seek out opportunities to innovate by using Visa‚Äôs data, client‚Äôs data and non-traditional data fit for purpose to the needs of our clients

Enhance existing data science techniques by promoting new methodologies and best practices in the field

Promote thought leadership in the data science domain and build intellectual property through innovation

Effectively interact with clients and manage internal/external stakeholder communication

Mentor, guide and supervise data scientists in the project team

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Degree (Masters or Ph.D. would be an advantage) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience
Preferred Qualifications

Minimum 8 years of professional work experience preferably in banking, payments, fintech, or a related industry. 
Hands-on experience with data analytics/programming tools such as Python, R and advanced skills in querying using SQL or other query languages. 
Hands-on experience working in Big Data ecosystems such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Kafka, GCP, AWS, and Azure. Experience with both on-prem and cloud environments is a plus. 
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Power BI and Tableau. 
Proficiency in statistical techniques such as Neural Networks, Gradient Boosting, Linear & Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Markov Chains, Support Vector Machines, Clustering, Principal Component Analysis, Factor analysis, etc. 
Demonstrated experience in planning, organizing, and managing multiple and concurrent analytics projects with diverse cross-functional stakeholders
Strong internal team and external client stakeholder management with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Able to work effectively in a matrixed organization
Excellent presentation and storytelling skills, including strong oral and written capabilities
Storyboarding and data storytelling including strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
In-market experience and/or knowledge of local language, culture as well as industry regulations

Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

About the job
Partnership Sales Manager

External Title: Partnership Sales Director

Internal Title: Partnership Sales Manager

Are you ready to lead the charge and be at the forefront of our ambitious global expansion? Is hunting, pitching and prospecting second nature to you? Can you confidently agree high-value commercial deals with building owners? Is business development in your blood? And are you relentless in your pursuit of delivering results, with the determination and resilience to change the world of work?

If yes, we need to talk.

What We Can Do For You

You‚Äôre reading the right ad if you‚Äôre looking for:

The most exciting growth opportunity in the world, where you‚Äôll be challenged every day
Excellent training, development and promotion opportunities
A fantastic incentive scheme which can see you earn great commission and prizes.


We know we can only succeed if we give all our people every opportunity to shine. It‚Äôs why so many of our most senior leaders started their careers in our centres. And it‚Äôs what made IWG the dominant global leader in the flexible-workspace industry.

About IWG

IWG is the world‚Äôs leading flexible workspace provider - with the world‚Äôs most ambitious growth programme to open 30,000+ new centres over the next decade to complement our international network of 4,000+ tech-enabled, sustainable and inspiring flexible work centres. Across our multiple brands, including Regus, Spaces, HQ and Signature, we‚Äôre provide world-beating workplace solutions to over 80% of Fortune 500 companies, including Netflix, EY, Amazon and Uber, as well as to local small start-ups, entrepreneurs and emerging businesses.

About You

You‚Äôll need to be passionate about working in a high-growth sector and ready to play a leading role in disrupting the commercial real-estate industry. You‚Äôll excel at growing your network rapidly and taking our proposition to them. And you‚Äôll thrive on initiating and closing multiple high-value deals at pace driven by your tenacity and expertise.

Whether pursuing your own leads or following up on centrally-driven enquiries, you‚Äôll highlight what makes an IWG partnership so special. By ensuring prospective partners fully understand the value of our proposition, you‚Äôll be doing much more than simply meeting sales targets. And thanks to your outstanding communications skills - primarily in your local language but also with a good level of English - you‚Äôll be able to present a truly compelling narrative to large and small audiences alike.

Most importantly though, you‚Äôll have the right, can-do mindset: passion, curiosity, pride, drive and ownership. We‚Äôll look after the rest.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Join our team of over 200 Partnerships Sales Leaders and you‚Äôll get to harness your entrepreneurial mindset, strong business and financial acumen, and commitment to achieving outstanding business development results as we add to the over 1,000 deals in 50+ countries closed in the past year alone.

From one day to the next, you‚Äôll get the chance to:

Agree high-value deals to deliver inspiring new partner locations, leveraging your expertise to expand the IWG network in every town and city
Hunt out exciting opportunities in commercial buildings of all types across your region, pitch for new partnership opportunities, convince partners to invest anywhere from ¬£250k to ¬£1m+ to develop a new IWG branded centre and close out deals quickly & effectively
Showcase the value of the IWG partnership proposition to your network of B2B connections
Source ambitious partners who match our growth goals and can help drive our rapid growth through building conversions, new development locations or competitor conversions
Employ a dynamic and versatile approach to business development, tailoring it to our partners‚Äô varying commercial needs and requirements
Actively manage your pipeline of opportunities to drive each opportunity from initial contact, through detailed commercial negotiations, all the way to a signed commercial agreement.


Carbon Neutral Workplaces

IWG‚Äôs purpose is to help everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet. We are proud to supply all our customers with carbon-neutral workplaces, and have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.

Leading Employer Award

IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in 2022, 2023 and 2024. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.

Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

About the job
Placement : WFO at TB Simatupang, South Jakarta

Job Description:
Monitor and analyze changes in both internal and external attack surfaces.
Identify vulnerabilities, exposed assets, and security anomalies from various sources (web surface, deep web, dark web, and social media).
Follow up on findings from external Attack Surface Discovery (ASD) and Digital Risk Protection Services (DRPS) platforms.
Manage external incidents such as data leaks, domain abuse, phishing, and digital fraud.
Conduct domain/account takedowns in collaboration with internal and external parties.
Provide mitigation recommendations and support the Blue Team in responding to digital threats.
Perform third-party risk assessments related to digital asset exposure by partners or contractors.
Analyze digital threat trends to support strategic decision-making.

Qualifications:
Minimum of 4 years of experience in cybersecurity, including at least 2 years in penetration testing, red teaming, or digital risk protection.
Strong understanding of CVEs and common vulnerabilities.
Experienced with ASD platforms (e.g., Tenable.io, SentinelOne, Mandiant) and DRPS platforms (e.g., Group-IB, Brandefense, Cyble Vision, SOCRadar, CybelAngel, Digital Shadows).
Proficient in brand protection, domain abuse mitigation, and third-party risk management.
Skilled in incident reporting and takedown processes.
Excellent communication skills and ability to coordinate effectively with internal and external teams.

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Back End Developer akan bertanggung jawab dalam membangun dan memelihara fondasi utama platform digital perusahaan. Fokus utama peran ini adalah mengembangkan aplikasi sisi server yang efisien, aman, dan mudah di-scale untuk mendukung kebutuhan operasional bisnis.

Posisi ini akan banyak bekerja sama dengan tim front-end dan tim teknis lainnya untuk memastikan stabilitas sistem, performa optimal, serta integrasi yang lancar antar layanan dan aplikasi yang digunakan.

Key Responsibilities

Merancang, mengembangkan, dan memelihara logika sisi server serta basis data
Membangun dan mengelola RESTful API serta melakukan integrasi dengan sistem internal dan eksternal.
Mengoptimalkan performa aplikasi dan memastikan keandalan sistem.
Berkolaborasi dengan tim lintas divisi untuk merancang dan mengimplementasikan fitur baru.
Melakukan troubleshooting, debugging, dan penyelesaian masalah pada sistem secara tepat waktu.
Menjaga kualitas kode melalui dokumentasi yang baik, pengujian, serta review berkala.

Requirements

Pengalaman minimal 2 tahun sebagai Back-End Developer atau posisi serupa.
Menguasai Node.js dan PHP.
Terbiasa dengan containerization menggunakan Docker (pengalaman dengan Kubernetes menjadi nilai tambah).
Memahami proses CI/CD dan memiliki pengalaman dengan Jenkins.
Kemampuan kuat dalam MySQL, terutama dalam perancangan skema basis data.
Memahami konsep RESTful API design dan integrasinya.
Teliti, logis, dan mampu memecahkan masalah dengan cepat.
Dapat bekerja secara kolaboratif dalam lingkungan kerja yang dinamis dan cepat.
Pemahaman terhadap Golang dan message queuing (RabbitMQ) menjadi nilai tambah.

Seluruh proses rekrutmen di Traders Family tidak memungut biaya apapun.

Desired Skills and Experience
Node.js, MySQL, MariaDB, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, PHP, Go / Golang

About the job
Deskripsi Peran 
Ini adalah peran General Manager Operations FnB penuh waktu di lokasi Jakarta. General Manager Operations FnB akan mengawasi operasi bisnis sehari-hari, memastikan fungsi berjalan lancar dan efisiensi operasional.

Tugas dan tanggung jawab mencakup:
Penyusunan anggaran (budgeting).
Memastikan kepuasan pelanggan.
Mengembangkan rencana strategis untuk meningkatkan proses.
Mengkoordinasikan dengan berbagai departemen.
Menyelesaikan setiap masalah operasional.
Memastikan perusahaan mencapai target kinerjanya.
Mengelola performa operasional outlet dan area bisnis, termasuk sales, COGS, food cost, dan efisiensi manpower untuk mencapai target KPI operasional dan profitabilitas (P&L) sesuai target.
Menjamin konsistensi kualitas produk, layanan, dan pengalaman pelanggan (customer experience) di seluruh outlet untuk menjaga standar QSC (Quality, Service, Cleanliness) dan Tingkat kepuasan pelanggan yang tinggi.
Mengembangkan inovasi produk dan konsep menu bersama tim PDV dan Marketing sesuai tren pasar dan positioning brand untuk menghasilkan produk baru yang relevan, menguntungkan, dan memperkuat citra brand.

Kualifikasi
Mahir dalam keterampilan General Manager dan Operation Manager.
Berpengalaman di bidang Customer Service dan Team Management.
Keterampilan yang kuat dalam Budgeting dan pengawasan keuangan.
Keterampilan kepemimpinan dan komunikasi yang sangat baik.
Kemampuan untuk bekerja secara efektif di lingkungan yang serba cepat.
Gelar Sarjana (S1) di bidang Administrasi Bisnis, Manajemen, atau bidang terkait.
Pengalaman di industri restoran atau perhotelan merupakan nilai tambah.

About the job
Medical Advisor Medilink
We are actively developing Southeast Asia's top TPA, which makes it easier for consumers to obtain insurance. To achieve our objectives, we therefore require talent with great potential, like you, to join our expanding organization, acquire the necessary skills, and also form outstanding teams.

Responsibilities:
Provide expert medical advice and consultation to internal teams and external clients.
Conduct comprehensive reviews and analyses of medical data, claims, and utilization patterns.
Collaborate with healthcare providers to ensure appropriate care delivery and utilization management.
Develop and deliver educational materials and presentations on medical and healthcare topics.
Assist in the evaluation and selection of healthcare networks and providers.

Qualifications:
Medical degree (MD or equivalent) with an active medical license.
Minimum of 1-2 years of TPA/Insurance experience.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex medical information effectively.
Knowledge of health insurance industry practices, policies, and regulations.
Proficiency in the use of medical software and technology for data analysis and reporting.

About MEDILINK DIGITAL MEDIKA
PT Medilink Digital Medika has established a strategic and technological collaboration with Medilink-Global Asia Pte Ltd. Through this collaboration, the company shall enjoy the exclusive rights of use of the bespoke Electronic Claims Clearing System (ECCS 5.0), a time-tested and proven solutions which have been implemented successfully and are functioning effectively at insurance companies and TPAs in several countries. The collaboration also allows the company to gain immediate access to Medilink-Global‚Äôs international network of health care providers.

Our vision is to be the Preferred Employee Benefit And Health Insurance Management Portal in Indonesia, offering anytime-anywhere Medical Claims Management Tools that connect the Payors, Healthcare Providers and Members.

Our mission is we provide connected Digital Solution for Insurance Companies and Corporates. Enabling them to offer their Members Seamless Access to Quality & Equitable Healthcare at Domestic and Regional Health Facilities.

Medilink is committed not only to make insurance easily available for everyone but also to spread awareness about the importance of having financial plans and protection through insurance.

About the job
Our portfolio company is a fast-growing FMCG brand specializing in innovative food and snack products. We are looking for a CEO Office to work closely with senior management in driving key strategic and operational initiatives that directly impact business growth and performance.

About the job

About the role:

As a Sales Associate at Berca Sportindo (League), you will play a vital role in delivering an excellent customer experience and driving-increasing sales in our bustling retail stores in Jakarta and BSD Area. This full-time position will see you working on the front lines, interacting with customers, and showcasing our high-quality range of Footwear, Sporting goods and apparel.

What you'll be doing:
1. Do Hard Selling, Soft Selling, Up Selling, Cross Selling, and Close Selling to achieve the Sales Target

2. Demonstrating and promoting our products to customers, ensuring they have all the information needed to make informed purchasing decisions

3. Providing exceptional customer service and building strong relationships with customers

4. Regularly reach out to customers listed in personal phone contacts to drive sales and achieve sales targets 

5. Handling cash and card transactions efficiently and accurately

6. Maintaining a clean, well-organised and visually appealing store environment

7. Assisting with inventory management and stock replenishment as needed

8. Collaborating with the retail team to achieve and exceed sales targets

What we're looking for:

1. Previous experience in a customer-facing retail or sales role, preferably within the sporting goods industry

2. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with customers and provide a friendly, helpful service

3. Strong product knowledge and a passion for sports and fitness

4. Enthusiasm, energy and a positive attitude to deliver an outstanding customer experience

5. Ability to work collaboratively as part of a team and contribute to the overall success of the store

6. Flexibility to work a range of shifts, including evenings and weekends, as required

What we offer:

At Berca Sportindo (League), we are committed to supporting the growth and development of our employees. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop your sales and customer service skills, as well as learn about the latest trends and technologies in the sporting goods industry. We offer competitive remuneration, a range of employee discounts.

About us

League entered Indonesia's footwear industry in 2004 and quickly gained a reputation as a premium brand for its quality footwear, apparel and accessories for men and women, everyday athletes to active-lifestyle enthusiasts.

We have more than 20 years of design, manufacturing and retail experience behind us, including working with some of the world's most valuable sports brands such as Nike and Puma. The core of our products lies within our stylish yet functional footwear line, which includes a fantastic collection of running, futsal, basketball and lifestyle shoes. We also sponsor prestigious national and international sporting and lifestyle events. The highlight was in 2012, when we proudly sponsored the Indonesian national team at the London Olympics.

As we continue to expand our presence across the country, we are seeking talented individuals to join our dynamic team and contribute to our ongoing success.

Apply now to become part of the Berca Sportindo (League) family!

About the job
Partnership Sales Manager

Are you ready to lead the charge and be at the forefront of our ambitious global expansion? Is hunting, pitching and prospecting second nature to you? Can you confidently agree high-value commercial deals with building owners? Is business development in your blood? And are you relentless in your pursuit of delivering results, with the determination and resilience to change the world of work?

If yes, we need to talk.

What We Can Do For You

You‚Äôre reading the right ad if you‚Äôre looking for:

The most exciting growth opportunity in the world, where you‚Äôll be challenged every day
Excellent training, development and promotion opportunities
A fantastic incentive scheme which can see you earn great commission and prizes.


We know we can only succeed if we give all our people every opportunity to shine. It‚Äôs why so many of our most senior leaders started their careers in our centres. And it‚Äôs what made IWG the dominant global leader in the flexible-workspace industry.

About IWG

IWG is the world‚Äôs leading flexible workspace provider - with the world‚Äôs most ambitious growth programme to open 30,000+ new centres over the next decade to complement our international network of 4,000+ tech-enabled, sustainable and inspiring flexible work centres. Across our multiple brands, including Regus, Spaces, HQ and Signature, we‚Äôre provide world-beating workplace solutions to over 80% of Fortune 500 companies, including Netflix, EY, Amazon and Uber, as well as to local small start-ups, entrepreneurs and emerging businesses.

About You

You‚Äôll need to be passionate about working in a high-growth sector and ready to play a leading role in disrupting the commercial real-estate industry. You‚Äôll excel at growing your network rapidly and taking our proposition to them. And you‚Äôll thrive on initiating and closing multiple high-value deals at pace driven by your tenacity and expertise.

Whether pursuing your own leads or following up on centrally-driven enquiries, you‚Äôll highlight what makes an IWG partnership so special. By ensuring prospective partners fully understand the value of our proposition, you‚Äôll be doing much more than simply meeting sales targets. And thanks to your outstanding communications skills - primarily in your local language but also with a good level of English - you‚Äôll be able to present a truly compelling narrative to large and small audiences alike.

Most importantly though, you‚Äôll have the right, can-do mindset: passion, curiosity, pride, drive and ownership. We‚Äôll look after the rest.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Join our team of over 200 Partnerships Sales Leaders and you‚Äôll get to harness your entrepreneurial mindset, strong business and financial acumen, and commitment to achieving outstanding business development results as we add to the over 1,000 deals in 50+ countries closed in the past year alone.

From one day to the next, you‚Äôll get the chance to:

Agree high-value deals to deliver inspiring new partner locations, leveraging your expertise to expand the IWG network in every town and city
Hunt out exciting opportunities in commercial buildings of all types across your region, pitch for new partnership opportunities, convince partners to invest anywhere from ¬£250k to ¬£1m+ to develop a new IWG branded centre and close out deals quickly & effectively
Showcase the value of the IWG partnership proposition to your network of B2B connections
Source ambitious partners who match our growth goals and can help drive our rapid growth through building conversions, new development locations or competitor conversions
Employ a dynamic and versatile approach to business development, tailoring it to our partners‚Äô varying commercial needs and requirements
Actively manage your pipeline of opportunities to drive each opportunity from initial contact, through detailed commercial negotiations, all the way to a signed commercial agreement.


Carbon Neutral Workplaces

IWG‚Äôs purpose is to help everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet. We are proud to supply all our customers with carbon-neutral workplaces, and have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.

Leading Employer Award

IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in 2022, 2023 and 2024. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.

Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

Anda akan bertanggung jawab untuk memastikan setiap proses rekrutmen berjalan efisien, objektif, dan sesuai standar kualitas.
Tanggung Jawab Utama:
Mengidentifikasi kebutuhan tenaga kerja dari berbagai divisi atau klien.
Menyusun dan mempublikasikan iklan lowongan pekerjaan di berbagai platform (online maupun offline).
Melakukan proses pencarian dan seleksi kandidat melalui database, media sosial, dan kanal rekrutmen lainnya.
Melakukan screening CV, wawancara awal, dan asesmen kandidat secara mendalam.
Menyusun laporan evaluasi kandidat dan memberikan rekomendasi kepada user atau klien.
Menjaga komunikasi yang efektif dengan kandidat dan memastikan pengalaman kandidat yang positif.
Berkoordinasi dengan tim HR dan user terkait penjadwalan interview dan proses onboarding.
Memastikan seluruh proses rekrutmen berjalan sesuai SOP dan tenggat waktu yang ditetapkan.
Kualifikasi:
Pendidikan minimal S1 Psikologi, Manajemen SDM, atau bidang terkait.
Pengalaman minimal 1‚Äì3 tahun di bidang rekrutmen, khususnya di perusahaan outsourcing, headhunter, atau agensi SDM (nilai tambah).
Memahami teknik wawancara berbasis kompetensi dan metode asesmen kandidat.
Terbiasa menggunakan platform job portal, LinkedIn, dan media sosial untuk sourcing kandidat.
Komunikatif, memiliki interpersonal skills yang baik, dan berorientasi pada target.
Mampu bekerja secara individu maupun tim dalam lingkungan yang dinamis.
Memiliki kemampuan administrasi dan dokumentasi yang baik.

Experience in handling multinational crew operations and working with ship management companies.

Multilingual skills (preferred for global crew interactions).

About the job
Department: Creative
Location: Jakarta, ID

Who are we?

Tripledot Studios is on track to become one of the largest independent mobile games companies in the world.

We are a multi-award-winning organisation, and following our recent acquisition announcement, we‚Äôre preparing to grow into a global 2,500+ strong team across 12 studios.

Tripledot‚Äôs guiding principle remains the same: when people love what they do, what they do will be loved by others.

We‚Äôre building a company we‚Äôre proud of ‚Äì one filled with driven, incredibly smart & detail-oriented people, who LOVE making games.

Our ambition is to become the most successful games company in the world, and we‚Äôre just getting started.

Take a look at our games: iOS Store + Google Play

Role Overview & Key Responsibilities

As a Senior UI Artist, you will work closely with the Art Director to develop the user interface for our games and collaborate with other UI team members to create new designs for our upcoming titles.

This position is ideal for someone who excels in UI design, has the ability to translate concepts from UX flows into final designs, with a solid understanding of the casual mobile gaming market. Create the UI with UX best practices in mind

job_title: Request for Proposal (RfP): Policy Recommendations on Green Cooperatives
job_description:
About the job
Background and Context
Rumah Energi is seeking proposals from qualified individual consultants or consulting firms to develop a Policy Paper ‚ÄúGreen Cooperatives in Building a Renewable Energy Cooperative Ecosystem as a Strategy for Climate Crisis Mitigation in Indonesia‚Äù. This activity is part of the Green Cooperative Policy Readiness Project (GERCEP) aiming to strengthen the role of cooperatives as key actors in driving community-based clean energy transition and the green economy.

Objective
To produce an integrated and actionable policy recommendation that supports the role of Green Cooperatives in accelerating renewable energy‚Äìbased cooperatives as part of Indonesia‚Äôs national climate crisis mitigation strategy.

Scope of Work
Review and analyze existing cooperative and renewable energy regulations.
Identify regulatory gaps and propose new or updated policy options.
Formulate actionable recommendations and a roadmap for implementing renewable energy cooperatives.
Develop a comprehensive Policy Paper and presentation materials summarizing key findings and recommendations.

üìÖ Proposal submission deadline: November 10, 2025 ‚Äî 17:00 WIB
üìß Send proposals to: info@rumahenergi.org (cc: j.irene@rumahenergi.org)

About the Program
The Green Cooperative Program by Rumah Energi has supported over 150 cooperatives across Indonesia in integrating Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles into their governance and business practices. Through the GERCEP project, Rumah Energi advocates for national-level renewable energy cooperative policies to strengthen community ownership and participation in Indonesia‚Äôs climate resilience efforts.

Job Title: Senior Accountant
Department: Finance, Accounting & Tax
Working Arrangement: On-site

Information About The Role
We are looking for a Senior Accountant who will play a key role in maintaining the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of our financial records across the company and its subsidiaries. This position involves overseeing complex accounting activities, preparing consolidated financial reports, managing audits, and supporting the Accounting Manager in ensuring that all financial operations comply with internal policies and external regulations.

Key Responsibility
Execute and manage month-end closing procedures, ensuring timely and accurate reconciliation of all Balance Sheet and P&L accounts.
Manage and reconcile intercompany transactions, balances, and eliminations.
Prepare and summarize monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements (P&L, BS, Cash Flow) for management review.
Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and provide actionable management insights.
Serve as the main contact for internal and external audits, ensuring timely and complete submission of required data and documentation.
Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff to ensure operational accuracy and compliance.
Support process improvements, system enhancements, and ad-hoc financial analyses.

Requirement
Minimum 2 years of experience in accounting or financial reporting, ideally within a group or consolidated reporting environment.
Experience in a Public Accounting Firm (KAP) is strongly preferred.
Solid understanding of accounting principles (PSAK/IFRS).
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets and accounting systems (preferably Xero).
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving ability.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Why You'll Love Working Here?
Growth Opportunities: We support your learning and development aspirations, both within and outside our organization, aiming to nurture an entrepreneurial spirit in our team.
Unique Work Environment: Experience the unique blend of a mission-driven digital company with the innovative mindset of a start-up, enriched by our presence since 2012.
Engagement Department: Get involved to refresh your mind with exciting activities outside the work to do.
Celebrate With Us: We love to celebrate work anniversaries and birthdays
We promote vertical and lateral movement. It‚Äôs not uncommon for Tayo (that‚Äôs what we call our team) to move divisions two or three times throughout their career. We want people to learn new stuff that excites them.
Sincere teamwork.
 This word isn‚Äôt officially in our values, but when I asked new joiners about what value they really feel at Tada that‚Äôs not stated on our wall, many mentioned that Tayo is really helpful, and they can feel the ‚Äòteamwork‚Äô atmosphere
Think and act like an owner is our value, but the truth is, we don't want you to act like an owner; we want you to be a real owner. So, for our top performers, we'd love to lure you into our stock options program

What We Do Not Promise
We do not promise fixed working hours. Sometimes, projects and deadlines may require additional hours or flexibility.
We do not promise unlimited resources or budgets. We may have to operate with limited resources and manage priorities carefully.
We do not promise a pressure-free environment. There are often high demands and significant expectations for growth and success.

If you're ready for a challenge and eager to make a real impact and be the Leading Loyalty & Rewards Platform in the region, take the leap and help us shape the future of loyalty and rewards! üöÄüåü

About the job
Employment Type: Permanent

Contract Duration

At IATA, we speak for the airlines of the world, serving and supporting over 300 of them across all continents. We are passionate and knowledgeable about the aviation industry, and we strive to make it safer, smarter, more sustainable and more inclusive. We celebrate diversity and inclusion in our workforce, and we respect and value the different backgrounds, perspectives and skills of our employees. We also care about our employees‚Äô wellbeing, and we provide flexible work arrangements, travel benefits, family-friendly policies, equal pay and a day off on your birthday. We believe in giving back to the community and encourage our staff to participate in volunteering activities that support causes they care about. We encourage you to join our global community of aviation enthusiasts, and we will do our best to make you feel comfortable during the interview process. IATA is more than a trade association; it is a vision of a better future for air travel.

About The Team You Are Joining

Reporting to the Country Manager Indonesia, the incumbent will support IATA‚Äôs activities in Indonesia, including aiding the delivery of IATA‚Äôs agenda and the country‚Äôs set objectives.

What Your Day Would Be Like

 Support the delivery of IATA‚Äôs agenda in Indonesia; 
 Assist the building and maintenance of pro-active, professional and top management level relationships with member airlines and other industry stakeholders, as well as with politicians and government officials, in all relevant parts of the host government; 
 Aid the promotion of IATA‚Äôs policies, positions, objectives, and activities amongst airlines, governments, regional organisations and other industry stakeholders, and coordinate with the Country Manager Indonesia regarding the local implementation of global projects, programmes and campaigns; 
 Support the monitoring of aero-political and economic developments in the country, assisting, as requested, with actions which are consistent with IATA‚Äôs policies and objectives, including maintaining a database of air transport regulatory and policy initiatives, as well as of contacts amongst government representatives, airline representatives and all other relevant agencies; 
 Given local market legislation, develop an understanding of local ISS governance matters, including effective risk management techniques for members‚Äô funds and the forecasting of ISS market trends and risks; 
 Assist good media relationships in support of IATA‚Äôs objectives, programmes and policy positions, whilst helping to coordinate marketplace communications, especially those related to the defaults of either agents or airlines, as requested; 
 Support the organisation of IATA‚Äôs events in Indonesia, whilst providing any necessary assistance at local and regional industry events, as well as for the visits of IATA‚Äôs Senior Managers and/or Subject Matter Experts; 
 Support corporate fiscal, legal and regulatory compliance in Indonesia, assist with any relevant administrative matters and fulfil any central reporting requirements, as requested; and 
 Any other responsibilities, as determined by the Country Manager Indonesia. 

We would love to hear from you if

 You have a University degree in Business Administration, Political Science, or any other relevant discipline. An advanced University degree would be an asset. 
 Minimum of eight years of professional experience with at least three years of experience in a similar role. Proven experience in leading teams with exceptional talents for building relationships and managing projects. 
 Experience in the airline industry, with a focus on settlement processes, reporting, and overseeing BSP and CASS operations. 
 Experience in managing relationships with travel agencies, ensuring effective collaboration and long-term partnerships. 
 Well-developed negotiation and lobbying skills, and possessing a high level of cultural intelligence. 
 Sound knowledge of information technology systems and their applications, particularly the MS Office suite, MS Project and a CRM tool such as Salesforce. 
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 
 Fluency in English and Indonesian is essential whilst knowledge of other languages, would constitute an advantage. 

Travel Required: N

 Learn more about IATA‚Äôs role in the industry, our benefits, and the team at iata/careers/ . We are looking forward to hearing from you!

About the job
Deskripsi pekerjaan

Halo teman-teman, bagaimana kabar kalian hari ini? Apakah sedang mencari peluang karir yang menarik? Jika iya, ada kabar baik nih! PT LEITER Indonesia sedang membuka lowongan pekerjaan untuk posisi Sales Engineer di Alam Sutera Tanggerang. Jika kamu memiliki passion dalam bidang sales dan suka berinteraksi dengan orang lain, posisi ini mungkin cocok untukmu. Yuk, simak informasi selengkapnya di bawah ini!

Sebagai Sales Engineer di PT LEITER Indonesia, kamu akan bertanggung jawab dalam memperluas jaringan bisnis perusahaan dan meningkatkan penjualan produk filtration yang ditawarkan. Kamu akan bekerja secara langsung dengan tim penjualan dan teknis untuk memberikan solusi terbaik kepada pelanggan. Selain itu, kamu juga akan terlibat dalam proses presentasi produk, negosiasi harga, dan pelayanan purna jual kepada pelanggan. Jadi, bagi kamu yang suka tantangan dan ingin terus berkembang dalam karir sales, inilah kesempatan yang tepat!

Tidak hanya itu, bekerja di PT LEITER Indonesia juga memberikan berbagai kesempatan untuk pengembangan diri. Kamu akan memiliki akses ke berbagai pelatihan dan workshop yang akan meningkatkan kemampuanmu dalam bidang filtrasi dan penjualan. Selain itu, kamu juga akan bekerja dengan tim yang solid dan penuh semangat, sehingga kamu akan merasa seperti bekerja bersama keluarga. Jadi, tunggu apa lagi? Segera kirimkan lamaranmu sekarang dan bergabunglah dengan kami untuk meraih kesuksesan bersama!


Kualifikasi

- Memiliki pendidikan minimal S1 
- Berpengalaman minimal 1 tahun di bidang sales
- Memiliki kemampuan komunikasi yang baik dan mampu berinteraksi dengan berbagai jenis orang
- Mampu bekerja secara mandiri maupun dalam tim
- Memiliki pengetahuan yang baik mengenai produk dan layanan yang ditawarkan perusahaan
- Memiliki kemampuan negosiasi yang baik dan mampu mencapai target penjualan yang ditentukan
- Memiliki kemampuan analisis untuk memahami kebutuhan dan masalah pelanggan
- Memiliki kemampuan presentasi yang baik untuk memperkenalkan produk kepada calon pelanggan
- Memiliki kemampuan bahasa Inggris yang baik, baik secara lisan maupun tulisan
- Memiliki motivasi tinggi dan orientasi pada hasil
- Bersedia bekerja dengan target dan under pressure
- Dapat bekerja dengan deadline yang ketat dan mampu mengatur waktu dengan baik
- Memiliki integritas yang tinggi dan dapat dipercaya
- Bersedia untuk menjalani proses seleksi yang ketat dan tes keterampilan yang diperlukan
- Dapat bekerja dengan fleksibel dan siap untuk belajar hal-hal baru
- Memiliki jiwa kepemimpinan dan dapat memotivasi tim penjualan
- Bersedia untuk bekerja dalam lingkungan yang dinamis dan kompetitif
- Memiliki kemampuan problem solving yang baik dan dapat menyelesaikan masalah dengan cepat
- Memiliki kemampuan adaptasi yang baik dalam situasi yang berubah-ubah

job_title: Business Development Representative (AU & UK Market) - Remote
job_description:
About the job
Are you a sharp B2B sales pro in Indonesia, ready to level up your career with a global, remote-first company? Join Influx.com, a fast-scaling company that‚Äôs disrupting the traditional customer experience and talent industries. We help global companies build flexible, high-performing teams, and we need your talent to drive our growth.

This is your chance to build a commercial career in Indonesia while selling into high-value AU and UK markets!

üéØ What You'll Be Doing
As our remote Business Development Representative, you'll be the engine that drives our qualified deal flow for fast-moving, digital-first clients. You'll play a key role in lead generation and be responsible for bringing in real business from inbound conversations.
Own the Pipeline: Engage with warm inbound leads and manage early-stage deal flow in collaboration with our closers.
Generate Business: Drive both inbound and outbound prospecting and lead generation to build a high-quality B2B pipeline.
Keep Momentum: Nurture deals and ensure consistent follow-ups to keep the sales process moving.

‚úÖ What We're Looking For
We're looking for an ambitious professional with at least 3-5 years of proven success in a B2B sales environment. You'll need to be a smart, fast learner who can thrive in a high-autonomy, remote-first role.
Strong English Communication: You must have business-level English proficiency (verbal and written) to confidently operate and thrive in conversations with AU/UK stakeholders, decision-makers, and influencers.
Startup/Fast-Growth Experience: You're comfortable navigating fast-growth, high-change sales environments. Experience working in a startup or a similarly rapid scaling environment is a huge plus.
B2B Sales Experience: You have a proven track record in B2B sales, ideally with some full-cycle experience.
Industry Knowledge is Key: Experience working within the outsourcing, BPO, or CX-as-a-Service industry is highly desirable. You understand how to sell services or solutions in a client-facing environment similar to Influx.
Tech Savvy: Comfortable using HubSpot (or a similar CRM) to manage tasks and deal flow.

üåç Why Join Influx?
Global Exposure: Work remotely from Indonesia while getting global exposure.
Autonomy & Support: Enjoy huge autonomy with continuous support from senior sellers and consultants.
Clear Growth: We're a fast-scaling team with clear opportunities for career growth.

Ready to disrupt the industry and build your global sales career? Apply now!

(Please note: Influx will never ask candidates for payment during the recruitment process. Successful candidates will be contacted only through email ending with @influx.com.)

About the job
FedEx IGNITE Internship: Fuel Your Future!

Location: Jakarta, Indonesia

Intake: June 2025

Duration: 12 Weeks

About IGNITE (Inspire Growth, Nurture Interns, Transform Excellence)

The IGNITE Internship Program is a 12-week internship at FedEx, offering high-potential youth the opportunity to gain hands-on experience, mentorship from industry experts, and practical skills to jumpstart their careers. Whether your interests lie in Sort Operations, Pick up and Delivery Operations, Clearance Operations, Global Services Provider, Operations Excellence Management, this structured program is designed to help you learn, grow, and make a real impact from day one.

What You‚Äôll Gain

Real-World Experience ‚Äì Work on meaningful projects that drive business impact and learn best practices by shadowing experienced professionals. 
Mentorship & Learning ‚Äì Receive mentorship from industry professionals to accelerate your growth. 
Collaboration & Innovation ‚Äì Engage with cross-functional teams and like-minded peers. 
Professional Development ‚Äì Build industry-relevant skills and enhance your employability through programs and workshops. 
Networking Opportunities ‚Äì Connect with peers and professionals in different countries. 

Internship Opportunities by Function

Explore our available internship functions below. You may select your preferred internship function and indicate it in your application.

Global Services Provider

Supporting key projects that contribute to building a best-in-class clearance experience
Assist in updating the operating procedures
Assisting with the go-to-market launch of new products and features
Revamping the marketing intelligence framework to drive strategic decision-making and market growth

Preferred background: Business/Management, Supply Chain Management, Engineering & Economics.

Operations Pick up and Delivery

Assist administration on listing scrap shipment
Assist administration on listing the asset
To support customers data base review and creation to support bad debt reduction project

Preferred background: Business/Management, Finance/Accounting, Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, Information Technology.

Operations Clearance

To improve the efficiency in Clearance Operations Flow
Assist in project trial before launched

Preferred background: Engineering

Operations Sort

To support current project
To improve Domestic Line Haul for improving Customer Experience by supporting Export team to identify process improvement opportunities

Preferred background: Engineering, Information Technology, Supply Chain Management.

Operations Excellence

Develop Dashboards for Indonesia Service Performance
Develop subtask dashboard for easier analysis of clearance issues
Optimize the meeting cadences to improve service performance

Preferred background: Supply Chain Management, Computer Science ,Information Technology, Engineering, Business/Management.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We welcome students or recent graduates from diverse academic backgrounds who are:

Available to join us in June 2025 
Curious and eager to learn 
Proactive and adaptable in a fast-paced environment 
Team-oriented with strong communication skills 
Equipped with critical thinking and problem-solving abilities 

Application Process

Submit your application online

1:1 Interview ‚Äì Shortlisted candidates will be going through an interview.

Offer & Onboarding ‚Äì Successful candidates will join the program in June.

Who we are 

At FedEx, moving the world doesn‚Äôt only mean delivering for our customers around the globe. Moving the world is also about creating what‚Äôs next. We are Team FedEx and we are 500,000+ people strong around the world. The work we all do comes down to one purpose: to provide our customers with outstanding experiences as we connect the world to what‚Äôs next. 

 

This isn‚Äôt a place to get just a job. Here, you get a career for life. It‚Äôs a place to enjoy constant change, growth, and progress in your career. Our willingness to innovate and transform is what keeps us at the forefront of our industry. With curiosity, inventiveness, and entrepreneurial spirit, we keep finding new and better ways to deliver results ‚Äì for our customers, for our people and for the planet. 

 

Here, you will have the flexibility and empowerment to reimagine the new, spread your wings and see your impact. By doing so, we are motivated to be better together. And together, we will continue to drive and deliver excellence. 

 

Our Values 

We take pride in being a people-first company, where our employees feel safe, valued and respected. Our culture values empower us to deliver great results.

With one FedEx culture, we: 

Take care of each other | Commit to do good | Own outstanding | Drive business results | Create what‚Äôs next 

 

Awards 

FedEx has consistently ranked among the top 20 in the ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Most Admired Companies‚Äù report, published in FORTUNE magazine, since 2001 
Ethisphere named FedEx as one of World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies¬Æ in 2023 

Our Commitment to Equal Opportunities

Our greatest asset at FedEx is our people. We are committed to building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workforce, and offer equal opportunities, fairness and respect to all regardless of who you are. We encourage you to apply even if you feel your experience does not align with all the aspects in the job description as you could be exactly who we need for this or another opportunity.

We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, age, genetic information, citizenship, disability, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under national, state or local laws. We will reasonably accommodate team members and third parties with physical and mental disabilities.

Interested to join Team FedEx?

Everyone at FedEx has a part to play. It‚Äôs about coming up with smart solutions, remaining resilient in the face of setbacks, and going above and beyond to get the job done. And whether you‚Äôre a business leader or delivery driver, you‚Äôll be empowered to take responsibility and overcome each challenge in your own way.

If this role and working environment sound like a place you can thrive in, apply today and let‚Äôs create what‚Äôs next together.

FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce in which we enforce fair treatment, and provide growth opportunities for everyone.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, color, national origin, genetics, religion, gender, marital status, pregnancy (including childbirth or a related medical condition), physical or mental disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Our Company

FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.

Our Philosophy

The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy, or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.

Our Culture

Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions, and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970‚Äôs. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure, and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today‚Äôs global marketplace.

About the job
Job Title: Data AI Engineer (3‚Äì5 Years of Experience)
Location: Central Jakarta (Full WFO)
Department: Data & Technology
Employment Type: Contract (6 months, extendable)

About the Role
We are seeking a skilled Data AI Engineer to strengthen our data-driven decision-making, model development, and AI implementation initiatives across business units. This role will focus on developing, training, and deploying production-grade machine learning models that support the company‚Äôs digital transformation roadmap, including AI automation, recommendation systems, and predictive analytics.

Responsibilities
Collect, clean, and preprocess large structured and unstructured datasets.
Develop, validate, and deploy machine learning and AI models for prediction, classification, clustering, and recommendation purposes.
Collaborate with engineering and business teams to translate requirements into data-driven insights and AI solutions.
Monitor, optimize, and maintain deployed models to ensure performance and reliability.
Build and manage data pipelines and feature stores for production models.
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.
Document methodologies and present analytical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Support the development of the company‚Äôs AI strategy and contribute to innovation initiatives.

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree (S1) in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (mandatory).
Minimum 3 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.
Excellent command of Python, SQL, and key data libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch).
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, model evaluation, and feature engineering.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Plotly, or Matplotlib/Seaborn.
Working knowledge of cloud-based AI platforms (AWS SageMaker, GCP Vertex AI, or Azure ML).
Familiarity with ETL processes, data pipelines, and MLOps concepts (Docker, Airflow, MLflow, CI/CD for ML).
Knowledge of big data frameworks (Spark, Databricks, etc.) is a plus.
Solid understanding of data governance, security, and privacy compliance.
Training or certification in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, or Data Engineering preferred.
Proficiency in both Indonesian and English (spoken and written).

About the job
About Company
At Ennovi we harness the power of two megatrends - electrification and AI - to help industries innovate at speed, operate smarter, and achieve sustainable growth. By combining these transformative forces with our global reach and best talent, we empower our customers to lead their markets and drive sustainable progress. 
From automotive to aerospace, consumer electronics, data storage, industrial, and medical markets, we help our customers achieve these megatrends by creating smarter, safer, and more sustainable solutions. 
We excel in developing high-performance, custom solutions that meet diverse technical needs, solve unique challenges, optimize performance, and adapt to evolving market demands. 
Our mission is to get customers to the future faster, from anywhere. Headquartered in Singapore, ENNOVI has a global presence across North America, Europe, SEA and China, where all its activities are socially responsible, with minimal environmental impact. Learn more at www.ennovi.com.


Why Join Us
At Ennovi, we envision a future of electrification and innovation and strive to create an inspiring workplace where our employees are integral to shaping that future. We offer a dynamic, collaborative and inclusive culture that encourages continuous learning, professional growth, and a sense of purpose. As a part of the Ennovi team, employees experience the excitement of being at the forefront of cutting-edge technologies and contributing to a sustainable future.
Our commitment to the transformation is epitomized by our five pillars: Speed, Innovation, Best Talent, Global Reach, and Sustainability. This entails navigating exponential market changes through agile structures, fostering innovation across all aspects of our business, strategically expanding our global footprint, championing sustainability initiatives and nurturing a winning team.


Privacy Policy
Ennovi is an equal opportunity employer in conformance with all applicable laws and regulations to individuals who are qualified to perform job requirements. The Company administers its personnel policies, programs, and practices in a non-discriminatory manner in all aspects of the employment relationship, including recruitment, hiring, work assignment, promotion, transfer, termination, wage and salary administration, and selection for training.

By applying to this job posting, you agree with and acknowledge our privacy policy.

About the job
Role Overview
The Quality Assurance Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of
software products across web, mobile, and API platforms. The role involves both manual and
automation testing, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality
software in a fast-paced Agile environment.
Key Responsibilities
ÔÇ∑ Analyze business and technical requirements to design detailed and comprehensive test
scenarios.
ÔÇ∑ Create, maintain, and execute manual test cases for functional, regression, smoke, and
exploratory testing across web and mobile applications.
ÔÇ∑ Identify, document, and track defects with clear and complete information.
ÔÇ∑ Design, implement, and maintain automation scripts for:
o Web: Selenium, Playwright, or similar frameworks
o Mobile: Appium or equivalent tools
o API: Postman, Rest Assured, or equivalent frameworks
ÔÇ∑ Contribute to the integration of automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub
Actions, Jenkins).
ÔÇ∑ Manage test data, validate test environments, and perform end-to-end testing across
multiple components.
ÔÇ∑ Maintain and update test artifacts using TestRail, JIRA, or Confluence.
ÔÇ∑ Collaborate with product, development, and release teams to ensure full test coverage and
sign-offs.
ÔÇ∑ Participate in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives) and
share testing updates regularly.
ÔÇ∑ Continuously improve QA practices, automation efficiency, and test coverage across
projects.
Required Skills & Qualifications
ÔÇ∑ Strong manual testing expertise across web, iOS, and Android platforms.
ÔÇ∑ Hands-on experience with test automation frameworks and scripting.
ÔÇ∑ Good understanding of SDLC, QA lifecycle, and Agile methodology.
ÔÇ∑ Working knowledge of Git, test management, and defect tracking tools.
ÔÇ∑ Strong analytical, documentation, and communication skills.
Technical Requirements
ÔÇ∑ Manual Testing: Skilled in creating and executing detailed test cases, identifying edge
cases, and performing exploratory and regression testing.
ÔÇ∑ Web Testing: Experience testing responsive web applications across browsers and
devices.
ÔÇ∑ Mobile Testing: Proficient in testing both iOS and Android apps, including devicespecific validations and usability checks.
ÔÇ∑ API Testing: Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, with experience using Postman or
Rest Assured for functional and contract testing.
Automation Expertise:
ÔÇ∑ Web: Selenium, Playwright, or equivalent frameworks.
ÔÇ∑ Mobile: Appium or similar tools.
ÔÇ∑ API: Scripted validations using Postman Collections, JavaScript, or Java-based
frameworks.
ÔÇ∑ Scripting Languages: Proficiency in Java, JavaScript, or Python for writing
automation scripts.
ÔÇ∑ CI/CD: Familiar with Git, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins for test integration.
ÔÇ∑ Test Management Tools: Experience with TestRail, JIRA, Zephyr, or equivalent.
ÔÇ∑ Environment Management: Knowledge of feature flagging, test data setup, and preproduction validations.
Nice to Have
ÔÇ∑ Experience with accessibility, localization, or performance testing.
ÔÇ∑ Exposure to cloud-based testing platforms such as BrowserStack or Sauce Labs.

About the job

About the job
The role

We‚Äôre looking for someone to join our application support team to help with getting our customers on board and helping them use our products to the best effect.

Our managed financial systems aggregation platform offers up services as RESTful APIs, embeddable web components, and a user portal, so you‚Äôll need to be able to work with integration engineers and business users alike.

You are ‚Ä¶

You are energetic and customer-centric. You have likely worked in a high-energy, high-velocity environment and loved it. You are excited by the opportunity to create something that you can be proud of and challenge yourself every day.

Whilst you may have worked within the enterprise space you are not a corporate stalwart but someone who can blend with any business. You love working with smart people and you get excited about solving big problems for customers.

Your Ticket To Success

Be an advocate. For Frankie, for the product, for our people and for our values.
Customer-focused. Working with customers to help identify and capture issues and drive the resolution process to completion
Team player. Working with third-party developers to help them integrate into our platform, and provide feedback on how best to use our service. Working as part of the implementation team to help onboard new customers and ensure they‚Äôre set up correctly.
Problem solver. Create and enhance existing playbooks for your colleagues, both current and future, on how to trace and solve problems. Work with the engineering team to help identify and address common problems for customers and yourself - you will have real input to the product and our roadmap.

In a Previous Life You Have

An aptitude for digging into complex technical problems, working through processes, logs, and code to get to that ‚ÄúAha! Gotcha!‚Äù moment.
Acted as the first point of escalation for technical incidents, providing clear technical analysis and resolution plans.
Explained to a room of developers and product managers how to implement something.
Collaborated with Development, QA, and Support teams to ensure efficient issue resolution and deployment processes.
Participated in on-call rotations if required and assisted with incident response and post-mortem reviews.

Role Purpose

The Head of Business Unit plays a key role in leading the overall growth of mGanik Nutrition, overseeing the end-to-end business from product development, supply and distribution, to marketing and sales performance.
This role combines strategic direction and hands-on execution to ensure strong business growth, profitability, and brand performance in a fast-paced digital environment.
The Head of Business Unit is expected to have a strong understanding of digital marketing strategy, performance management, and data-driven decision-making, to effectively lead mGanik‚Äôs marketing and sales ecosystem.
 This position reports directly to the CEO/Founder and works closely with cross-functional teams to drive alignment and deliver sustainable business results.

About the job
Location: Remote
Reports to: Head of Engineering

The Role
We're looking for a Machine Learning Quality Specialist to own the quality and performance of Tapi's AI-powered invoice extraction system. You'll create, test, and maintain the prompts that enable our AI to accurately extract critical information from invoices, ensuring our customers get reliable data every time.
This role sits at the intersection of AI operations, quality assurance, and customer success. You'll combine analytical thinking with strong communication skills, working closely with our AI engineering team to optimise extraction accuracy and with customer success to resolve issues quickly.
You'll be part of our platform team, directly impacting the quality and reliability of a core product feature that thousands of customers depend on daily.

About Tapi
Tapi is an AI-native SaaS platform reimagining how property maintenance is done. We bring property managers, tenants, and trades into one seamless experience, using AI to reduce admin, speed up workflows, and create better outcomes for everyone.
We already support more than 450,000 properties across New Zealand and Australia, and we're just getting started. With global expansion ahead of us and an ambitious roadmap in front, this is a pivotal time to join.

What You'll Do
Create and refine AI prompts for new invoice types and data extraction requirements across different suppliers and formats.
Test prompt variations against real invoices to validate accuracy and identify edge cases before deployment.
Monitor extraction quality through dashboards, identifying patterns in errors and opportunities for improvement.
Maintain and update existing prompts, responding to customer issues and changing invoice formats.
Triage customer issues related to invoice extraction, determining whether they require prompt updates, data fixes, or engineering support.
Be available to work between 14:00 and 22:00 NZDT.
Build and maintain monitoring dashboards that track extraction accuracy, error rates, and system performance.
Use data analysis tools to investigate extraction issues and measure the impact of prompt changes.
Document prompt changes, test results, and quality metrics to inform continuous improvement.

What You'll Bring
Excellent command of written English with strong attention to detail and nuance.
Analytical mindset with the ability to spot patterns, diagnose issues, and test hypotheses.
Natural curiosity and eagerness to learn emergent AI technologies and best practices.
Strong organisational skills with ability to manage multiple priorities and customer issues simultaneously.
Clear communicator who can explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Comfortable working with data and metrics to drive decisions.
Experience with SQL for data analysis (highly desirable but not required).
Familiarity with observability and monitoring tools (highly desirable but not required).

What Great Looks Like
Focus Area
Measure of Success
Extraction Quality - High accuracy rates maintained across all invoice types and suppliers
Issue Resolution - Customer extraction issues resolved within agreed timeframes
Proactive Monitoring - Issues identified and addressed before customers report them
Prompt Performance - Regular testing and optimisation showing measurable improvements
System Reliability - Dashboards and monitors maintained, alerts configured and responsive
Knowledge Growth - Demonstrable upskilling in AI/ML technologies and prompt engineering techniques

A 10/10 Candidate Will
Take full ownership of extraction quality, treating every inaccuracy as an opportunity to improve.
Be naturally curious, staying ahead of AI developments and bringing new ideas to the team.
Think like a detective, methodically investigating issues and testing solutions.
Communicate clearly with engineering and customer success, keeping everyone informed.
Balance speed and quality, knowing when to iterate quickly and when to test thoroughly.
Champion the customer experience, understanding that extraction accuracy directly impacts their workflows.

Why Join Tapi
Be part of a SaaS company reinventing property maintenance.
Work with a talented, supportive team that moves fast and values ownership.
Work remotely with flexibility and autonomy.
Make a real impact by ensuring the quality of AI features that thousands of customers rely on daily.

About the Role

About the job
Company Description
YOUR! (formerly known as Yourpay) is a neobank focused on empowering and transforming the lives of underbanked mothers and families in rural areas of Indonesia. We provide a secure, affordable, and user-friendly platform for Indonesian migrant workers worldwide to make payments, transfers, and soon offer lending and savings services.

Our comprehensive infrastructure covers five pillars of financial transactions: payment, lending, insurance, investment, and saving. With over 2 million transactions and 60,000 active users across various countries, including Indonesia, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, and soon Korea, Malaysia and Saudi Arabia, we aim to enable migrant workers and their families to access proper financial services and take control of their earnings.

Role Description
We are seeking a Product Designer for creating and improving the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) of digital products to ensure they are intuitive, visually appealing, and meet user needs effectively. Their role combines creativity with user research and technical knowledge to design functional and user-friendly digital experiences.

Responsibilities
User Research: Conduct in-depth user research through interviews, surveys, usability tests, and data analysis to gather insights about the target audience. Use this information to understand user needs, preferences, pain points, and behavior patterns, which will guide design decisions and ensure that the product is user-centered.
Wireframing and Prototyping: Create wireframes, which are basic, low-fidelity representations of the product layout, to map out the structure and flow of content. Develop interactive prototypes that allow stakeholders and users to visualize and interact with key elements and functionalities of the product. Prototypes are used to test ideas and gather feedback before moving into full-scale design.
Information Architecture: Organize and structure content in a way that is intuitive and logical for users. Define how information is grouped, labeled, and accessed within the product to ensure that users can easily find the information they need. This includes creating site maps, user flows, and navigation systems that guide users through the product efficiently.
Visual Design: Design appealing and consistent visual elements such as buttons, icons, typography, and color schemes that enhance the product‚Äôs aesthetics. Ensure that the UI reflects the brand‚Äôs identity and is consistent across all platforms. This involves attention to detail in layout, spacing, and responsiveness, making sure that the product looks and feels polished on various devices.
Interaction Design: Focus on how users will interact with the product by designing intuitive and engaging user interactions. This includes creating animations, transitions, and feedback responses (e.g., hover effects, button clicks) that make the interface feel responsive and smooth. These elements enhance the overall user experience by making the product more dynamic and engaging.
Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders throughout the design and development process. Ensure that designs are aligned with business objectives and technical constraints. Act as a liaison between design and development teams to ensure smooth handoffs and that the final product stays true to the original design vision.
Design Systems and Standards: Develop and maintain a consistent design system that includes reusable UI components, style guides, and design principles. This helps ensure uniformity across different parts of the product and across teams. Design systems allow for efficient collaboration, scalability, and quicker development cycles while maintaining a cohesive user experience.

Requirements
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Design, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or Related Field
Experience: 2+ years of experience in UI/UX design or product design.
Design Skills:
Proficiency with Design Tools: Figma
Prototyping and Wireframing Skills: Ability to create wireframes and interactive prototypes using tools such as Figma, or Whimsical.
Visual Design Skills: Strong understanding of typography, color theory, layout, and composition to create visually appealing interfaces that are aligned with brand guidelines.
User-Centered Design Knowledge:
Understanding of UX Principles: Knowledge of user-centered design principles, including how to create designs that are intuitive, user-friendly, and meet the needs of the target audience.
Information Architecture (IA): Ability to organize content logically and create clear navigation structures, sitemaps, and user flows.
Understanding of Front-End Development (Preferred):
Basic HTML/CSS/JavaScript Knowledge (Optional): Familiarity with front-end technologies to better communicate with developers and understand the limitations and possibilities of design implementations.
Adaptability and Continuous Learning:
Up-to-date with Industry Trends: Willingness to stay current with evolving UI/UX design trends, tools, and best practices.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing requirements and user needs.
Portfolio of Work:
Impressive Design Portfolio: A strong portfolio showcasing previous UI/UX projects, detailing the design process, wireframes, prototypes, final designs, and how user feedback was incorporated to improve the product.
Collaboration and Communication Skills: Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Please submit your CV to recruitment@yourpay.co.id with email SUBJECT: Product Designer - Name

About the job
The Senior Advisor is the primary responsible executive for the success of the Alliance to End Plastic Waste (AEPW) program in-country. This role is accountable for delivering the full scope of the country program in alignment with AEPW Strategy 2030, ensuring that projects are designed and executed as part of a system-change agenda rather than isolated interventions. The Senior Advisor manages all in-country stakeholders‚Äîincluding government entities, DFIs, industry partners, and implementing organizations‚Äîand oversees AEPW staff, consultants, and contractors to ensure programs are delivered safely, efficiently, compliantly, and with measurable impact.

The Senior Advisor is both a strategic representative of AEPW to external stakeholders and an operational manager ensuring contract compliance, impact reporting, and staff performance.

Key Responsibilities

1. Program Strategy & Alignment
Develop, maintain, and execute a comprehensive country strategy aligned with AEPW‚Äôs global Strategy 2030.
Ensure that 80‚Äì90% of projects drive system-level transformation (e.g., integrated waste infrastructure, EPR alignment, circular economy enablers) with the remaining 10‚Äì20% focused on pilots for learning, impact generation, or stakeholder engagement.
Identify opportunities for replication and scaling across the country and region.
Anticipate regulatory, political, and market shifts that may affect the program; adapt strategy proactively

2. Stakeholder Engagement & Representation
Work very closely with AEPW Members, and facilitate all PAG, pre-PAG, and Member engagement relative to the Country Program Implementation.
Serve as AEPW‚Äôs senior representative in-country, maintaining strong relationships with: a) Local and national government ministries, regulators, and municipalities; b) DFIs and co-funding partners active in waste and circular economy infrastructure; c) Industry stakeholders including brands, recyclers, and waste operators; and d) Civil society groups, NGOs, and academic institutions.
Represent AEPW in policy dialogues, conferences, and industry roundtables, ensuring the organization is seen as a co-creator of solutions.
Work with the Central PA team to ensure alignment of government relations.
Act as primary escalation point for all stakeholder issues arising within the program.

3. Project Development & Execution Oversight
Guide development of new projects to ensure alignment with program objectives and system-change principles.
Review and approve project proposals prior to submission to the Portfolio Management Committee / Governing Council.
Oversee in-country execution teams and implementing partners to ensure adherence to AEPW‚Äôs global standards.
Ensure strict compliance with AEPW‚Äôs E2E Program Implementation process, safeguard requirements, and contractual obligations.
Conduct regular site visits, milestone reviews, and partner performance evaluations.
Collaborate with Circular Solutions Centre to ensure technical due diligence and innovation pilots are rigorously assessed.

4. Contract Compliance & Risk Management
Ensure all projects adhere to the terms of their contracts, including milestones, disbursement conditions, reporting obligations, and safeguard actions.
Work closely with Central Legal / Contracts to enforce compliance and resolve disputes.
Maintain a country-level risk register and escalate risks (financial, operational, reputational, HSE) to the Central Risk team.
Ensure world-class HSE standards are embedded in all project activities, in line with AEPW expectations and international best practices.

5. Financial Structuring & Oversight
Collaborate with Impact Finance to co-structure deals with DFIs, private investors, and corporate co-funders.
Monitor financial performance of all projects (grants, loans, blended finance) including repayment obligations.
Ensure transparent and timely financial reporting for donors, DFIs, and AEPW central finance.

6. Impact Measurement & Reporting
Ensure all projects deliver on AEPW‚Äôs impact metrics: plastic waste collected, sorted, and valorized; access to waste management; jobs created; safety performance, etc..
Work with Global Support to provide accurate and timely reporting for impact metrics, Portfolio Management Committee / Governing council, donor, and member communications.
Facilitate external audits, evaluations, and lessons-learned reviews.

7. People Leadership & Team Development
Lead, mentor, and manage all AEPW employees and consultants in-country.
Ensure teams operate safely, efficiently, and productively with clear accountability.
Foster a culture of compliance, transparency, and impact delivery.
Build local capacity by coaching and developing staff and ensuring knowledge transfer across teams.
Ensure strong collaboration across functions (Execution, CSC, Support, Finance, Legal, PA and Strategy/Planning).

Requirements / Qualifications
Advanced degree in business, engineering, public policy, or a related field.
Minimum 20+ years‚Äô experience in senior leadership roles within infrastructure, development, or circular economy sectors.
Proven experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder programs with government, DFIs, corporates, and NGOs.
Strong contract management, compliance, and risk oversight skills.
Demonstrated financial acumen in structuring and monitoring large-scale projects.
Experience working in international development, public-private partnerships, or donor-funded projects highly preferred.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and diplomatic skills.
High integrity, resilience under pressure, and ability to balance strategic leadership with hands-on operational management.
