About the job
Role Overview
The Quality Assurance Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of
software products across web, mobile, and API platforms. The role involves both manual and
automation testing, working closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality
software in a fast-paced Agile environment.
Key Responsibilities
ÔÇ∑ Analyze business and technical requirements to design detailed and comprehensive test
scenarios.
ÔÇ∑ Create, maintain, and execute manual test cases for functional, regression, smoke, and
exploratory testing across web and mobile applications.
ÔÇ∑ Identify, document, and track defects with clear and complete information.
ÔÇ∑ Design, implement, and maintain automation scripts for:
o Web: Selenium, Playwright, or similar frameworks
o Mobile: Appium or equivalent tools
o API: Postman, Rest Assured, or equivalent frameworks
ÔÇ∑ Contribute to the integration of automated tests into CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub
Actions, Jenkins).
ÔÇ∑ Manage test data, validate test environments, and perform end-to-end testing across
multiple components.
ÔÇ∑ Maintain and update test artifacts using TestRail, JIRA, or Confluence.
ÔÇ∑ Collaborate with product, development, and release teams to ensure full test coverage and
sign-offs.
ÔÇ∑ Participate in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives) and
share testing updates regularly.
ÔÇ∑ Continuously improve QA practices, automation efficiency, and test coverage across
projects.
Required Skills & Qualifications
ÔÇ∑ Strong manual testing expertise across web, iOS, and Android platforms.
ÔÇ∑ Hands-on experience with test automation frameworks and scripting.
ÔÇ∑ Good understanding of SDLC, QA lifecycle, and Agile methodology.
ÔÇ∑ Working knowledge of Git, test management, and defect tracking tools.
ÔÇ∑ Strong analytical, documentation, and communication skills.
Technical Requirements
ÔÇ∑ Manual Testing: Skilled in creating and executing detailed test cases, identifying edge
cases, and performing exploratory and regression testing.
ÔÇ∑ Web Testing: Experience testing responsive web applications across browsers and
devices.
ÔÇ∑ Mobile Testing: Proficient in testing both iOS and Android apps, including devicespecific validations and usability checks.
ÔÇ∑ API Testing: Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, with experience using Postman or
Rest Assured for functional and contract testing.
Automation Expertise:
ÔÇ∑ Web: Selenium, Playwright, or equivalent frameworks.
ÔÇ∑ Mobile: Appium or similar tools.
ÔÇ∑ API: Scripted validations using Postman Collections, JavaScript, or Java-based
frameworks.
ÔÇ∑ Scripting Languages: Proficiency in Java, JavaScript, or Python for writing
automation scripts.
ÔÇ∑ CI/CD: Familiar with Git, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins for test integration.

About the job
WHO WE ARE
Arches connects strategic consulting firms, Private Equity firms, and Hedge Funds with the expertise they need to make better decisions.
Since 2019, we've grown from a startup to a global team of 170+ professionals across Asia, secured $6 million in funding, and become a trusted partner for the world's leading firms.
Our experts support critical business decisions through Commercial Due Diligence, Market Research, Value Creation strategies, and more.
We're now expanding to Colombia in 2025 to better serve our US clients. This new office will be our key hub for the Americas, creating exciting opportunities for talented professionals who want to grow with us.
Learn more about us: Arches on LinkedIn

INDUSTRY OVERVIEW
The Expert Network Services (ENS) industry connects our clients (consulting and investment firms) with specialized insights from top experts. With a strong focus on the Asia-Pacific region, our team is fluent in the languages across the area and has unmatched recruitment capabilities to find experts from any industry or niche.

ROLE OVERVIEW
As a Global Expert Recruitment (Expert Matching Team), you'll play a crucial role in recruiting the right experts to consult on our clients' projects. This role requires strong communication and problem-solving skills, along with the ability to identify suitable expert candidates and employ creative sourcing strategies.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Project Understanding and Ideal Expert Profile Identification
Gain a thorough understanding of client project needs based on main topics and client characteristics.
Identify the best-fit expert profile based on key project requirements, including industry focus, target companies, relevant departments, seniority level, and specific expertise.

Recruiting Expert Candidates (Main Focus)
Source ideal expert profiles across multiple platforms (LinkedIn, local recruitment platforms, internal databases, professional networks).
Reach out to experts through phone, email, LinkedIn, and other channels to invite them to consult for clients on specific topics.
Screen and vet expert candidates to assess their expertise and experience before connecting them with our clients.
Manage scheduling for client-expert interviews and build relationships with experts for future collaborations.

REQUIREMENTS
Background
Undergraduate degree
1-3 years of professional experience in sales, recruitment, client service, or related fields
Fluency in English and Bahasa Indonesia (both verbal and written) ‚Äì Able to communicate confidently with a diverse network of experts across APAC
Additional language skills are a plus!

Competencies
Adaptability in a fast-paced environment
Goal-oriented and KPI-driven ‚Äì Committed to achieving targets, with a proactive approach to growth and success.
Results-focused ‚Äì Consistently track, measure, and improve to meet and exceed goals.
Problem-solving mindset ‚Äì Skilled at identifying and addressing gaps between goals and outcomes.
Collaborative approach ‚Äì Open to seeking support and working with the team to achieve the best results.

Working Location
During probation: Based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam for the first 3 months with relocation support covering visa, flights, and accommodations.
After probation: Hybrid work arrangement between Vietnam and your home country.

BENEFITS
Compensation & Benefits
Competitive base salary with performance reviews every 6 months
Monthly performance-based incentive up to $900
Annual Bonus ‚Äì 1-month gross salary
Paid Leave ‚Äì 12 days of annual leave, plus additional paid leave for significant life events and 8 days of sick leave
Private Medical Insurance ‚Äì Includes dental coverage
Self-learning Budget ‚Äì Up to $1000 per year
Relocation Support (Visa, flights, accommodation)

Career Growth
Rapid Career Advancement ‚Äì Tackle challenging problems for top startups and gain skills for the global stage, with opportunities for swift promotions.
Build a High-Caliber Network ‚Äì Collaborate with and learn from top industry leaders and decision-makers, expanding valuable connections for career growth.

Engagement
Enjoy a vibrant work environment with team activities, quarterly dinners, company trips, social gatherings, and office snacks and drinks. Support for employee well-being also includes sports clubs (badminton, golf, football, etc.).
Flexible Work Arrangements

Arches is more than a company‚Äîit's a movement to democratize expertise. We're building a future where knowledge is accessible to all, and you can be a driving force in this transformation. Join our team of passionate professionals, backed by visionary investors, and make your mark on the global stage!

Strong culinary skills in Chinese cuisine and across various international cuisines.
Experience cooking non-halal dishes is an advantage.
Experience serving high-profile individuals or families is a plus point.
Knowledge of nutrition and dietary planning is a plus point.
Fluent in English (spoken and written).
High attention to detail, confidentiality, and professionalism.
Excellent time management and organizational abilities.
Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and during special events as needed.
Work Location: South Jakarta
Employment Type: Hired under personal capacity.

If you have a passion for culinary excellence and enjoy creating memorable dining experiences, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Only qualified candidates will be contacted for further selection process and will be required to undergo a one-week cooking trial.

About the job
Employment Type: Permanent

Contract Duration

At IATA, we speak for the airlines of the world, serving and supporting over 300 of them across all continents. We are passionate and knowledgeable about the aviation industry, and we strive to make it safer, smarter, more sustainable and more inclusive. We celebrate diversity and inclusion in our workforce, and we respect and value the different backgrounds, perspectives and skills of our employees. We also care about our employees‚Äô wellbeing, and we provide flexible work arrangements, travel benefits, family-friendly policies, equal pay and a day off on your birthday. We believe in giving back to the community and encourage our staff to participate in volunteering activities that support causes they care about. We encourage you to join our global community of aviation enthusiasts, and we will do our best to make you feel comfortable during the interview process. IATA is more than a trade association; it is a vision of a better future for air travel.

About The Team You Are Joining

Reporting to the Country Manager Indonesia, the incumbent will support IATA‚Äôs activities in Indonesia, including aiding the delivery of IATA‚Äôs agenda and the country‚Äôs set objectives.

What Your Day Would Be Like

 Support the delivery of IATA‚Äôs agenda in Indonesia; 
 Assist the building and maintenance of pro-active, professional and top management level relationships with member airlines and other industry stakeholders, as well as with politicians and government officials, in all relevant parts of the host government; 
 Aid the promotion of IATA‚Äôs policies, positions, objectives, and activities amongst airlines, governments, regional organisations and other industry stakeholders, and coordinate with the Country Manager Indonesia regarding the local implementation of global projects, programmes and campaigns; 
 Support the monitoring of aero-political and economic developments in the country, assisting, as requested, with actions which are consistent with IATA‚Äôs policies and objectives, including maintaining a database of air transport regulatory and policy initiatives, as well as of contacts amongst government representatives, airline representatives and all other relevant agencies; 
 Given local market legislation, develop an understanding of local ISS governance matters, including effective risk management techniques for members‚Äô funds and the forecasting of ISS market trends and risks; 
 Assist good media relationships in support of IATA‚Äôs objectives, programmes and policy positions, whilst helping to coordinate marketplace communications, especially those related to the defaults of either agents or airlines, as requested; 
 Support the organisation of IATA‚Äôs events in Indonesia, whilst providing any necessary assistance at local and regional industry events, as well as for the visits of IATA‚Äôs Senior Managers and/or Subject Matter Experts; 
 Support corporate fiscal, legal and regulatory compliance in Indonesia, assist with any relevant administrative matters and fulfil any central reporting requirements, as requested; and 
 Any other responsibilities, as determined by the Country Manager Indonesia. 

We would love to hear from you if

 You have a University degree in Business Administration, Political Science, or any other relevant discipline. An advanced University degree would be an asset. 
 Minimum of eight years of professional experience with at least three years of experience in a similar role. Proven experience in leading teams with exceptional talents for building relationships and managing projects. 
 Experience in the airline industry, with a focus on settlement processes, reporting, and overseeing BSP and CASS operations. 
 Experience in managing relationships with travel agencies, ensuring effective collaboration and long-term partnerships. 
 Well-developed negotiation and lobbying skills, and possessing a high level of cultural intelligence. 
 Sound knowledge of information technology systems and their applications, particularly the MS Office suite, MS Project and a CRM tool such as Salesforce. 
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 
 Fluency in English and Indonesian is essential whilst knowledge of other languages, would constitute an advantage. 

Travel Required: N

 Learn more about IATA‚Äôs role in the industry, our benefits, and the team at iata/careers/ . We are looking forward to hearing from you!

About the job

About the job
AI-Driven Loyalty & Rewards Solutions!
Who Are We?

Tada is a B2B2C loyalty and rewards platform that helps businesses improve channel partner, customer, and employee retention, build loyalty, and drive growth. Founded in 2012, Tada offers unified solutions that create engaging and rewarding experiences.

As an Indonesian SaaS company with a global footprint, Tada has assisted 400+ local and international brands across various industries. Our game-changing loyalty solutions have also garnered numerous awards, solidifying our reputation as a leader in the sector.

Job Opportunities
Job Title: Senior Accountant
Department: Finance, Accounting & Tax
Working Arrangement: On-site

Information About The Role
We are looking for a Senior Accountant who will play a key role in maintaining the accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of our financial records across the company and its subsidiaries. This position involves overseeing complex accounting activities, preparing consolidated financial reports, managing audits, and supporting the Accounting Manager in ensuring that all financial operations comply with internal policies and external regulations.

Key Responsibility
Execute and manage month-end closing procedures, ensuring timely and accurate reconciliation of all Balance Sheet and P&L accounts.
Manage and reconcile intercompany transactions, balances, and eliminations.
Prepare and summarize monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements (P&L, BS, Cash Flow) for management review.
Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and provide actionable management insights.
Serve as the main contact for internal and external audits, ensuring timely and complete submission of required data and documentation.
Supervise and mentor junior accounting staff to ensure operational accuracy and compliance.
Support process improvements, system enhancements, and ad-hoc financial analyses.

Requirement
Minimum 2 years of experience in accounting or financial reporting, ideally within a group or consolidated reporting environment.
Experience in a Public Accounting Firm (KAP) is strongly preferred.
Solid understanding of accounting principles (PSAK/IFRS).
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets and accounting systems (preferably Xero).
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and problem-solving ability.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Why You'll Love Working Here?
Growth Opportunities: We support your learning and development aspirations, both within and outside our organization, aiming to nurture an entrepreneurial spirit in our team.
Unique Work Environment: Experience the unique blend of a mission-driven digital company with the innovative mindset of a start-up, enriched by our presence since 2012.
Engagement Department: Get involved to refresh your mind with exciting activities outside the work to do.
Celebrate With Us: We love to celebrate work anniversaries and birthdays
We promote vertical and lateral movement. It‚Äôs not uncommon for Tayo (that‚Äôs what we call our team) to move divisions two or three times throughout their career. We want people to learn new stuff that excites them.
Sincere teamwork.
 This word isn‚Äôt officially in our values, but when I asked new joiners about what value they really feel at Tada that‚Äôs not stated on our wall, many mentioned that Tayo is really helpful, and they can feel the ‚Äòteamwork‚Äô atmosphere
Think and act like an owner is our value, but the truth is, we don't want you to act like an owner; we want you to be a real owner. So, for our top performers, we'd love to lure you into our stock options program

What We Do Not Promise
We do not promise fixed working hours. Sometimes, projects and deadlines may require additional hours or flexibility.
We do not promise unlimited resources or budgets. We may have to operate with limited resources and manage priorities carefully.
We do not promise a pressure-free environment. There are often high demands and significant expectations for growth and success.

If you're ready for a challenge and eager to make a real impact and be the Leading Loyalty & Rewards Platform in the region, take the leap and help us shape the future of loyalty and rewards! üöÄüåü

job_title: BI Analyst (Supply Analytics, Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity: 

As a BI Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:

Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‚Äòright questions‚Äô, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business.
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply.
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence.
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

At least 2-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) 
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement.
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources.

It‚Äôs Great if you Have: 

MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience.
Asian market experience.
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience.

About the job
Location: Jakarta
Department: R&D / Product Development
Reporting to: CEO & RD Lead
Required experience: Minimum of 2 years

Job Summary
Packaging Development Specialist plays a key role in designing, testing, and optimizing packaging solutions for pharmaceutical products, ensuring compliance with GMP and regulatory requirements. This role is responsible for conducting packaging trials, supporting scale-up and technology transfer processes, and ensuring all packaging materials consistently meet quality, safety, and performance standards. The position also collaborates closely with cross-functional teams to drive innovation, enhance packaging efficiency, and ensure seamless integration of new products into commercial manufacturing.

Key Responsibilities
Conduct packaging material trials and support the development of primary and secondary packaging for pharmaceutical products.
Operate, monitor, and maintain laboratory-scale and pilot packaging equipment (e.g., blister, strip, and carton machines).
Support packaging scale-up and technology transfer from development to commercial production.
Document all packaging design evaluations, test results, and observations in compliance with GMP and data integrity standards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including QA, QC, Production, and Regulatory Affairs to ensure packaging suitability and compliance.
Contribute to process improvements and product performance optimization.

Qualifications
Bachelor (S1) in Pharmacy or Pharmacist.
Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Packaging development Specialist in the pharmaceutical industry.
Experienced in packaging development processes, covering primary packaging (blistering, stripping) through to secondary packaging operations, including serialization and integration with production machinery.
Experienced in packaging development processes, covering primary packaging (blistering, stripping) through to secondary packaging operations, including serialization and integration with production machinery.
Thorough understanding of critical quality attributes (CQAs) for packaging materials and pharmaceutical finished products in compliance with GMP and regulatory standards.
Innovative, detail-oriented, and strong problem-solving abilities.
Willing to be based in Jakarta Barat.

About the job
Responsible of MES (Manufacture Execution System), configure required changes on system derived from changes to the process, monitor and responsible for daily support, and assist MES users. Working closely with our customers to deliver solutions, maintain, troubleshoot, and improve MES functionalities.

YOU ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE C# & JAVA PROGRAMMING EXPERIENCE.

Job Description:
Responsible for MES applications development and maintenance using C# with .NET framework, Java with Springboot and SQL/Oracle/Tibero database.
Responsible for Process Automation and MES Control, supporting production and quality control operations.
Ensure process automation and control system solutions meet all safety, quality, and reliability of MES operations.
Collaborate with other divisions like (Maintenance, Production, Quality Control) to support automation & integration into MES plant floor.
Ensures Process Automation and MES system software and hardware at appropriate revision levels.
Responsible for software change management and version control of production instance.
Maintains site-specific systems and solution documentation.
Owns process control systems disaster recovery planning, ensuring that business continuity plans are in place.
Facilitates productive working relationships with process control integrators and other key automation vendors.
Always providing outstanding yet simple customer oriented solution idea, able to turn the idea into a plan, and the most important is to be able executing the plan into realization then deploy it in the production instance.

Job Requirements:
Education
Bachelor degree in Computer Science Engineering, Engineering, or other closely related major.
Advanced English level (FLUENT both oral and written).

Work Experience
Minimum 4 years' experience
Have a Project and/or improvement in coding and can explain the business process flow of the project/improvement

Skill and Knowledge
Customer orientation ("Client is the next process").
Programming Languages: C# .NET (MUST); Java, JSP, Spring Boot (MUST), C / C++ background will be an advantage.
Has knowledge/experience about CI/CD, Docker, Kubernates or similar concept
Database: SQL, ORACLE, TIBERO.
Have knowledge of MES.
Experience working in the car manufacturing industry using support systems and manufacturing implementation systems will be preferred
Willingness to do more and willingness to learn.
Target and detail oriented.
Able to communicate IDEA, and have good communication skills.
Highly motivated, highly initiative, high curiosity, and self-driven.
Has excellent logic and critical & structural thinking.

About the job
Location: Remote
Reports to: Head of Engineering

The Role
We're looking for a Machine Learning Quality Specialist to own the quality and performance of Tapi's AI-powered invoice extraction system. You'll create, test, and maintain the prompts that enable our AI to accurately extract critical information from invoices, ensuring our customers get reliable data every time.
This role sits at the intersection of AI operations, quality assurance, and customer success. You'll combine analytical thinking with strong communication skills, working closely with our AI engineering team to optimise extraction accuracy and with customer success to resolve issues quickly.
You'll be part of our platform team, directly impacting the quality and reliability of a core product feature that thousands of customers depend on daily.

About Tapi
Tapi is an AI-native SaaS platform reimagining how property maintenance is done. We bring property managers, tenants, and trades into one seamless experience, using AI to reduce admin, speed up workflows, and create better outcomes for everyone.
We already support more than 450,000 properties across New Zealand and Australia, and we're just getting started. With global expansion ahead of us and an ambitious roadmap in front, this is a pivotal time to join.

What You'll Do
Create and refine AI prompts for new invoice types and data extraction requirements across different suppliers and formats.
Test prompt variations against real invoices to validate accuracy and identify edge cases before deployment.
Monitor extraction quality through dashboards, identifying patterns in errors and opportunities for improvement.
Maintain and update existing prompts, responding to customer issues and changing invoice formats.
Triage customer issues related to invoice extraction, determining whether they require prompt updates, data fixes, or engineering support.
Be available to work between 14:00 and 22:00 NZDT.
Build and maintain monitoring dashboards that track extraction accuracy, error rates, and system performance.
Use data analysis tools to investigate extraction issues and measure the impact of prompt changes.
Document prompt changes, test results, and quality metrics to inform continuous improvement.

What You'll Bring
Excellent command of written English with strong attention to detail and nuance.
Analytical mindset with the ability to spot patterns, diagnose issues, and test hypotheses.
Natural curiosity and eagerness to learn emergent AI technologies and best practices.
Strong organisational skills with ability to manage multiple priorities and customer issues simultaneously.
Clear communicator who can explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Comfortable working with data and metrics to drive decisions.
Experience with SQL for data analysis (highly desirable but not required).
Familiarity with observability and monitoring tools (highly desirable but not required).

What Great Looks Like
Focus Area
Measure of Success
Extraction Quality - High accuracy rates maintained across all invoice types and suppliers
Issue Resolution - Customer extraction issues resolved within agreed timeframes
Proactive Monitoring - Issues identified and addressed before customers report them
Prompt Performance - Regular testing and optimisation showing measurable improvements
System Reliability - Dashboards and monitors maintained, alerts configured and responsive
Knowledge Growth - Demonstrable upskilling in AI/ML technologies and prompt engineering techniques

A 10/10 Candidate Will
Take full ownership of extraction quality, treating every inaccuracy as an opportunity to improve.
Be naturally curious, staying ahead of AI developments and bringing new ideas to the team.
Think like a detective, methodically investigating issues and testing solutions.
Communicate clearly with engineering and customer success, keeping everyone informed.
Balance speed and quality, knowing when to iterate quickly and when to test thoroughly.
Champion the customer experience, understanding that extraction accuracy directly impacts their workflows.

Why Join Tapi
Be part of a SaaS company reinventing property maintenance.
Work with a talented, supportive team that moves fast and values ownership.
Work remotely with flexibility and autonomy.
Make a real impact by ensuring the quality of AI features that thousands of customers rely on daily.

About the job

About the job
The Senior Advisor is the primary responsible executive for the success of the Alliance to End Plastic Waste (AEPW) program in-country. This role is accountable for delivering the full scope of the country program in alignment with AEPW Strategy 2030, ensuring that projects are designed and executed as part of a system-change agenda rather than isolated interventions. The Senior Advisor manages all in-country stakeholders‚Äîincluding government entities, DFIs, industry partners, and implementing organizations‚Äîand oversees AEPW staff, consultants, and contractors to ensure programs are delivered safely, efficiently, compliantly, and with measurable impact.

The Senior Advisor is both a strategic representative of AEPW to external stakeholders and an operational manager ensuring contract compliance, impact reporting, and staff performance.

Key Responsibilities

1. Program Strategy & Alignment
Develop, maintain, and execute a comprehensive country strategy aligned with AEPW‚Äôs global Strategy 2030.
Ensure that 80‚Äì90% of projects drive system-level transformation (e.g., integrated waste infrastructure, EPR alignment, circular economy enablers) with the remaining 10‚Äì20% focused on pilots for learning, impact generation, or stakeholder engagement.
Identify opportunities for replication and scaling across the country and region.
Anticipate regulatory, political, and market shifts that may affect the program; adapt strategy proactively

2. Stakeholder Engagement & Representation
Work very closely with AEPW Members, and facilitate all PAG, pre-PAG, and Member engagement relative to the Country Program Implementation.
Serve as AEPW‚Äôs senior representative in-country, maintaining strong relationships with: a) Local and national government ministries, regulators, and municipalities; b) DFIs and co-funding partners active in waste and circular economy infrastructure; c) Industry stakeholders including brands, recyclers, and waste operators; and d) Civil society groups, NGOs, and academic institutions.
Represent AEPW in policy dialogues, conferences, and industry roundtables, ensuring the organization is seen as a co-creator of solutions.
Work with the Central PA team to ensure alignment of government relations.
Act as primary escalation point for all stakeholder issues arising within the program.

3. Project Development & Execution Oversight
Guide development of new projects to ensure alignment with program objectives and system-change principles.
Review and approve project proposals prior to submission to the Portfolio Management Committee / Governing Council.
Oversee in-country execution teams and implementing partners to ensure adherence to AEPW‚Äôs global standards.
Ensure strict compliance with AEPW‚Äôs E2E Program Implementation process, safeguard requirements, and contractual obligations.
Conduct regular site visits, milestone reviews, and partner performance evaluations.
Collaborate with Circular Solutions Centre to ensure technical due diligence and innovation pilots are rigorously assessed.

4. Contract Compliance & Risk Management
Ensure all projects adhere to the terms of their contracts, including milestones, disbursement conditions, reporting obligations, and safeguard actions.
Work closely with Central Legal / Contracts to enforce compliance and resolve disputes.
Maintain a country-level risk register and escalate risks (financial, operational, reputational, HSE) to the Central Risk team.
Ensure world-class HSE standards are embedded in all project activities, in line with AEPW expectations and international best practices.

5. Financial Structuring & Oversight
Collaborate with Impact Finance to co-structure deals with DFIs, private investors, and corporate co-funders.
Monitor financial performance of all projects (grants, loans, blended finance) including repayment obligations.
Ensure transparent and timely financial reporting for donors, DFIs, and AEPW central finance.

6. Impact Measurement & Reporting
Ensure all projects deliver on AEPW‚Äôs impact metrics: plastic waste collected, sorted, and valorized; access to waste management; jobs created; safety performance, etc..
Work with Global Support to provide accurate and timely reporting for impact metrics, Portfolio Management Committee / Governing council, donor, and member communications.
Facilitate external audits, evaluations, and lessons-learned reviews.

7. People Leadership & Team Development
Lead, mentor, and manage all AEPW employees and consultants in-country.
Ensure teams operate safely, efficiently, and productively with clear accountability.
Foster a culture of compliance, transparency, and impact delivery.
Build local capacity by coaching and developing staff and ensuring knowledge transfer across teams.
Ensure strong collaboration across functions (Execution, CSC, Support, Finance, Legal, PA and Strategy/Planning).

Requirements / Qualifications
Advanced degree in business, engineering, public policy, or a related field.
Minimum 20+ years‚Äô experience in senior leadership roles within infrastructure, development, or circular economy sectors.
Proven experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder programs with government, DFIs, corporates, and NGOs.
Strong contract management, compliance, and risk oversight skills.
Demonstrated financial acumen in structuring and monitoring large-scale projects.
Experience working in international development, public-private partnerships, or donor-funded projects highly preferred.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and diplomatic skills.
High integrity, resilience under pressure, and ability to balance strategic leadership with hands-on operational management.

job_title: Business Analyst (Supply Analytics, Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity: 

As a Business Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:

Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‚Äòright questions‚Äô, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business.
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply.
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence.
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

At least 2-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) 
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement.
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources.

It‚Äôs Great if you Have: 

MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience.
Asian market experience.
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience.

About the job
At TalentPop App, we empower fast-growing brands by providing world-class administrative and operational support ‚Äî and we‚Äôre expanding our team! We‚Äôre looking for a resourceful and detail-oriented E-Commerce Administrative Assistant with strong online experience. This role blends administrative coordination, inventory management, data reporting, and community engagement, perfect for someone who‚Äôs highly organized, technically skilled, and thrives in a remote environment.

What You'll Do

Support account managers with administrative coordination tasks
Track inventory levels, coordinate restocks, and handle purchase order (PO) processes
Perform data analysis and reporting using Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP)
Manage email inboxes, scheduling, and administrative priorities
Engage with customers and community members via forums, comments, and DMs
Extract and organize marketing and ad performance data (Facebook Ads, Google Ads, etc.)
Assist with operational and hands-on tasks requiring strong technical skills
Maintain accuracy and attention to detail when working with reports and tracking systems

What We're Looking For

At least 1 year of online/remote work experience (required)
Proficient/advanced in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, data organization)
Experience with Zendesk, Shopify, RLM, Qlik, ClickUp, Asana, and Google Analytics not required but preferred
Excellent written communication skills and strong organizational abilities
Ability to manage multiple priorities effectively in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable working with inventory, order management systems, and data reporting platforms
Bonus points if you have technical experience supporting operational processes or product-based businesses

Technical Requirements

A laptop or desktop with at least an i5 processor (or Mac equivalent)
A reliable internet connection with at least 15 Mbps download/upload speed
A quiet, dedicated workspace

What We Offer

100% remote work ‚Äî work from anywhere
Performance reviews and growth opportunities within our team
Health and dental insurance coverage or a health stipend to support your health and well-being.
Paid time off to support your work-life balance
Access to learning tools and regular feedback to fuel your career development
A collaborative and supportive work environment where your contributions truly matter

Important: To be considered for this position, please make sure to include the following application code in your submission: ADAS25. This code helps us quickly identify applicants for the e-Commerce Administrative Assistant role. Applications submitted without this code may experience delays in processing. Be sure to highlight it clearly when you apply so our recruitment team knows you‚Äôve carefully read the job posting.

If you‚Äôre an experienced online professional who‚Äôs ready to help high-growth brands stay organized and scale smarter ‚Äî we‚Äôd love to meet you.

Apply now and join a team that values your skills, drive, and ambition!

job_title: Customer Development Executive Surabaya HD Branch Jawa Timur
job_description:
About the job
Rentokil Initial is an international business services company employing over 35,000 colleagues across 70 countries. We strive to protect people and enhance lives by controlling pests, improving hygiene, and improving interior spaces with plants and scenting. We are experts in the field we operate in, investing in training, science, innovation, and technology. Listening and acting on feedback is part of our culture to support colleagues and customers. Rentokil Initial regards equality and fairness as fundamental rights of all of its colleagues. We live our values of service, Relationships, and Teamwork which our colleagues across the world identified.

Our family of businesses

Rentokil Pest Control is the world's leading commercial pest control company, operating in 70 countries and ranked in the top 3 in 65 countries. Ranking in the top 3 in 38 of the 44 countries we operate in, Initial Hygiene is the market leader that provides quality, diligent and friendly services to all customers. In France, Initial Workwear specialists in the supply and laundering of workwear, garments, and protective uniforms and equipment: focusing on top-quality products and services. Our plant business, Ambisius is seen as the expert in interior and exterior `landscaping"; operating across the US, Europe, Asia & Pacific. Steritech Branch Protection by Rentokil Initial is an industry leader and pioneer, providing innovative solutions that help customers to mitigate risks and drive business growth. We also have specialist businesses such as Medical Services, Specialist Hygiene and Property Care, which lead their respective fields. Across all of our operations globally, we have a positive reputation among our customers for our knowledge and integrity. We have central support functions of Human Resources, IT, Finance, Legal, Marketing & Innovation in the Rentokil Initial Head Office locations and in the Country. You would support all of our businesses within our function departments.

Job Description

Achieve the sales target
Looking for and identifying prospective customers and the potential market
Making daily, weekly, and monthly program and sales pipeline
Do presentation and sales about service pest control to customer commercial
Survey new or existing customer commercial
Making proposal for customer
Negotiation with customer
Making agreement contract and service agreement to customer
Build good relationship with customer

Requirements

Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree, Marketing or equivalent.
Have 1 year experience in the related field
Required skill(s): marketing, communication, negotiation, MS Office.
Ready to handling customer complain and Result Oriented
Have driving license A or C. Having driving license A is good.
Willing to be placed in East Java

Benefits

 Attractive monthly base salary
 Performance Incentive
 Training & Development

About the job
As F&B Manager at Jimbaran Puri, A Belmond Hotel, you will play a key role in shaping our guests' culinary journey. If you are a driven professional seeking to refine your skills and contribute to the future of luxury hospitality, we invite you to explore this exceptional opportunity.

Reporting to the General Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to optimize the performance of our restaurants and bar, ensuring an exceptional guest experience. This includes conceptualizing and executing innovative concepts aligned with the property's positioning, and developing action plans to maximize both guest satisfaction and financial returns for each outlet.

Primary responsible includes:

Lead and execute all Food & Beverage (F&B) operations to meet or exceed hotel targets for guest satisfaction, quality assurance, and financial performance. This includes developing and implementing short-term and long-term F&B strategic plans
Manage all daily F&B operations within budgetary parameters and according to the highest standards of quality and efficiency
Cultivate and maintain exceptional levels of internal and external customer service
Conceptualize and implement innovative and exceptional restaurant concepts, overseeing procurement and continuous improvement initiatives
Proactively identify and address customer needs and concerns, ensuring a positive guest experience
Recruit, train, develop, and evaluate a high-performing F&B team
Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), operational schedules, policies, and procedures
Implement all F&B-related projects and global programs
Cultivate and maintain positive customer relationships, including addressing and resolving customer complaints
Identify opportunities and develop solutions to enhance performance across all F&B operational aspects, including Leading Quality Assurance (LQA) standards and guest experience
Train and guide department heads and line staff in efficient service delivery, ensuring adherence to the highest standards of guest service
Monitor and ensure compliance with all food safety and hygiene regulations
Plan and execute all events and banquets
Manage restaurant reservations and related correspondence
Develop, implement, and enforce restaurant policies, targets, and key performance indicators (KPIs)
Lead by example, serving as a role model and consistently demonstrating the highest levels of professionalism in all management practices

Requirements

What you bring:

Dynamic, curious and that exhibits a passion for excellence
5 years' work experience in similar role in the luxury hospitality business
International experience in F&B will be considered a plus
Strong knowledge of F&B trends and best practice in the luxury F&B business 
Strong customer service skills
Excellence written and verbal in English
Excellent communication and leadership skills
Emotional intelligence, interpersonal and influencing skills
Organization skills 
Indonesian citizen only

Benefits

What we offer:

At Jimbaran Puri, we pride ourselves on fostering a culture built on kindness, active listening, and genuine connections with our colleagues and guests. We offer a comprehensive range of compensation and benefits including:

Competitive basic salary and benefits
Loyalty and recognition rewards programs
Employee assistance and wellbeing programs
Enhanced pension scheme
Comprehensive Medical insurance Complimentary and preferred rate experiences at our iconic destinations
Friendly and Family environment

We strive to create an environment where our employees can thrive both personally and professionally. With a commitment to your ongoing development, you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow. Join us and be part of creating unforgettable moments for our guests, communities, and each other.

This is your moment.

Apply today!

About Us

Jimbaran Puri, is located in the heart of a small fisherman's enclave, offering a taste of unspoiled Bali, a slice of paradise barely touched by tourism and regarded as one of the island's most serene hotels.

Jimbaran Puri means "Royal House in Jimbaran area"

To arrive at Jimbaran Puri is to enter another world. The perfect combination of tradition, culture and nature are the soul and charm of the resort which creates a serene authentic Balinese beach hideaway.

Jimbaran Puri is an ode to Bali's tranquil atmosphere and authentic Balinese hospitality, offering a peaceful and spiritual setting where time seems to have stood still.

The Belmond & LVMH Family

Jimbaran Puri, A Belmond Hotel, Bali, Indonesia, is proud to be part of LVMH, and the Belmond global collection of iconic hotels, trains and river cruises, all creating exceptional experiences worldwide. When you join one of our properties, you join a global family of history-rich hotels and breathtaking destinations, where our employees are the heart of the Belmond experience.

About the job
About the Role
We‚Äôre looking for a Frontend Engineer to build fast, reliable, and maintainable applications used daily in our electric mobility and battery-swap ecosystem. About the job
Apply now ¬ª

Date: 5 Nov 2025

Location: Jakarta, Indonesia

Company:  Plan International

Background

Plan International is an independent development and humanitarian organization that advances children‚Äôs rights and equality for girls. Plan International has operated in Indonesia since 1969, and in 2017, Yayasan Plan International Indonesia (YPII) was established as a national entity of Plan International in Indonesia. YPII is currently implementing its Country Strategy 5 (CS 5) covering the fiscal year 2023 to 2027, where the country‚Äôs purpose is in line with the global Plan International‚Äôs Purpose ‚Äúto advance children‚Äôs rights and equality for girls‚Äù. Our ambition is to enable at least 1 million girls and young women to learn (gain skills for work), lead (empower to take action on issues that matter to them), decide (have control over their own lives and bodies), and thrive (grow healthy and protected from violence). It means that we will take action to identify and facilitate the removal of obstacles that prevent children, especially girls, and young women from enjoying their rights and participating fully in Indonesian society. This goal will be achieved by implementing quality programmes and projects and influencing decision-makers and key stakeholders to make the required changes.

The Opportunity

To amplify our mission and deepen stakeholder engagement, Plan Indonesia recognises the critical role of strategic communications. The Outreach and External Communications Manager will lead efforts to elevate our brand visibility, strengthen media relations, and ensure our flagship campaigns and stories reach the right audiences‚Äîlocally, regionally, and globally.

Dimension of Role

Reporting to the Resource Mobilisation and External Relations Director, the Outreach and External Communications Manager is responsible for developing and executing external communication strategies that enhance Plan Indonesia‚Äôs visibility, credibility, and accountability to stakeholders. This role ensures that all communication activities accurately reflect the organisation‚Äôs mission, values, and measurable impact on children, young people, and communities.

The Manager will lead a dynamic team of communication professionals and serve as the primary liaison to regional and global communications hubs. They will oversee media relations, flagship campaigns, social media engagement, website content, and the production of impactful and ethical communication materials.

As a strategic leader, the Manager will ensure that all external communication upholds transparency, ethical storytelling, and safeguarding standards. The role also involves ensuring effective resource management, budget oversight, and evidence-based reporting that demonstrates accountability and results to donors, partners, and the communities Plan Indonesia serves.

Key Responsibility

Strategic Leadership and Delivery 
Strengthen and expand Plan Indonesia‚Äôs brand presence across media and digital platforms, ensuring that visibility efforts consistently reflect the organisation‚Äôs values and impact.
Lead the development and execution of Plan Indonesia‚Äôs External Communications Strategy, ensuring alignment with the organisation‚Äôs mission, brand values, and accountability standards.
Supervise and mentor the communications team to uphold professional accountability, foster learning, and ensure the timely delivery of high-quality outputs.
Lead the planning and execution of flagship campaigns and organisational events that demonstrate measurable impact on children, young people, and communities, while maintaining ethical storytelling standards.
Transparency and Ethical Communication 
Develop and implement the External Communications Strategy aligned with organisational goals and accountability principles, ensuring all communication upholds transparency, ethical standards, and impact orientation.
Oversee the creation of communication products, including stories, videos, and digital content, that authentically portray program impact and amplify the voices of children and communities.
Ensure all external communication reflects Plan Indonesia‚Äôs commitment to transparency, accuracy, and ethical storytelling‚Äîparticularly in portraying children, young people, and communities with dignity, respect, and consent.
Ensure that stories and communication materials effectively demonstrate the tangible impact of Plan Indonesia‚Äôs work on children, young people, and communities, highlighting voices from the ground and promoting evidence-based narratives.
Lead the development and execution of crisis communication protocols to protect the organisation‚Äôs reputation through transparent, timely, and responsible responses.
Accountability to Stakeholders
Ensure that communication activities are responsive to the needs and expectations of key stakeholders, including donors, partners, media, and program participants. Regularly report communication outcomes and impacts to internal management and relevant partners.
Coordinate communication strategies during humanitarian emergencies, ensuring accurate, sensitive, and ethical messaging aligned with Plan Indonesia‚Äôs response efforts.
Actively participate in internal and external communication networks, fostering mutual accountability and collaboration with partners and stakeholders.
Build and maintain strategic partnerships with media outlets and journalists to amplify Plan Indonesia‚Äôs voice, ensuring transparency, factual accuracy, and sensitivity in public narratives.
Performance Monitoring and Learning
Manage social media content and engagement strategies that promote inclusive participation, ethical communication, and data-driven insights for audience growth.
Ensure timely updates, content relevance, and accountability in the representation of Plan Indonesia‚Äôs programs and results on the organisation‚Äôs website.
Develop and monitor communication performance metrics (reach, engagement, sentiment, visibility, and reputation indicators), and use evidence-based insights to improve communication strategies and practices continuously.
Budget and Resource Stewardship

Manage the communications budget responsibly, ensuring cost-effectiveness, compliance with financial policies, and transparency in procurement and vendor management.

Representation and Coordination
Represent Plan Indonesia in regional and global communication forums, promoting consistent messaging and accountability in collaboration with Plan International‚Äôs global communication network.
As a member of the Country Management Team, actively engage in strategic and organisational-level discussions and provide input in decision-making
Serve as the main focal point for regional and global communications coordination, ensuring alignment with global accountability frameworks and communication standards.
Safeguarding Children and Program Participant and Preventing Sexual Harassment, Exploitation, and Abuse (PSHEA)
Ensures that YPII policies for Safeguarding & PSHEA for Children and Program participants and Gender Equality and Inclusion are fully embedded under the principles and requirements of the policy, including relevant Implementation Standards and Guidelines as applicable to their area of responsibility. 
Ensuring staff and associates are aware of and understand their duties under these policies and Plan International's Code of Conduct (CoC), the relevance of these to their area of work, and that concerns are reported and managed in accordance with the appropriate procedures.
Ensure youth protection and safeguarding policies are integrated into all program stages, including building mechanisms for youth to report issues or concerns safely and confidentially.

Essential

Requirements for The Role:

University degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, or related field.
Minimum 10 years of experience in external communications, media relations, or public affairs, preferably with experience working at an NGO.
Proven leadership and team management experience.
Strong strategic thinking and project management skills.
Excellent writing and storytelling abilities in Bahasa Indonesia and English.
Proficiency in digital communication tools and platforms.

Personal Attributes

Having a broad vision aligned with a keen strategic mind
Have a strong entrepreneurial spirit: willingness to experiment, take measured risks and try unconventional methods to achieve impacts/goals
Have a strong interest in data and data analysis: able to detect patterns and shifts in the market
Driven and focused to achieve targets 
Resilient and can adapt to changing environments and competing priorities
Communication skills: being persuasive and convincing; ability to negotiate, persuade and influence
Interpersonal skills: showing understanding of others, building rapport and managing emotions effectively
Demonstrated skills in timely problem-solving and decision-making
Affinity to work with and for children and young people. 
Willingness to travel in remote areas and overseas (if the opportunity arises)

Please follow the link to the full role profile: JD_Outreach & External Comms Manager.pdf

Location: Typical office environment in Jakarta, with frequent travels to the field and some travel to project areas. It is important to note that YPII currently applies a mix of working from Home and working from Office arrangements.

Reports to: straight line to Resource Mobilisations and External Relations Director

Closing Date: November 21st, 2025

How To Apply

All information will be treated in the strictest confidence, as we pride ourselves on our professional service. We will contact you as soon as we have reviewed your application.

Only short-listed candidates will be notified and invited for interviews. Please submit your letter of application and detailed curriculum vitae in English by applying now not later than November 21st, 2025 to this link

A range of pre-employment checks will be undertaken in conformity with Plan International‚Äôs Safeguarding Children and Young People policy (PSHEA).

As an international child-centred community development organisation, Yayasan Plan International Indonesia is fully committed to promoting the realisation of children‚Äôs rights including their right to protection from violence and abuse.

We will provide equality of opportunity and will not tolerate discrimination on any grounds. We foster an organisational culture that embraces and exemplifies our commitment to gender equality, girls‚Äô rights and inclusion while supporting staff to adopt good practices, positive attitudes and principles of gender equality and inclusion.

Please note that Plan International will never send unsolicited emails requesting payment from candidates.

About the job
Company Description
YOUR! (formerly Yourpay) is a neobank focused on empowering and transforming the lives of underbanked mothers and families in rural areas of Indonesia. Our goal is to provide secure, affordable, and user-friendly financial services to Indonesian migrant workers around the world. We offer a comprehensive platform for payments, transfers, lending, and savings, allowing users to access five pillars of financial transactions: payment, lending, insurance, investment, and saving. To date, we have served over 2 million transactions for more than 60,000 active users in Indonesia, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, and soon Malaysia and Saudi Arabia. Join us in revolutionizing financial inclusion and making a positive impact on communities.

Role Description
We are seeking an Infrastructure Engineer to join our team in Jakarta, Indonesia. This is a full-time on-site role where you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our cloud and on-premise infrastructure. You will be responsible for ensuring high availability, scalability, and security of our systems. This role requires expertise in cloud platforms, automation, networking, and infrastructure monitoring to support our development and production environments efficiently.

Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure for web and mobile applications.
Manage cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Alibaba) and on-premise environments.
Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation.
Automate system deployments, updates, and scaling using CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, etc.).
Monitor and optimize system performance, network security, and server uptime.
Configure and maintain Kubernetes, Docker, and containerized applications.
Ensure disaster recovery and backup strategies are in place and regularly tested.
Collaborate with backend engineers to optimize deployment and operational workflows.
Implement logging, monitoring, and alerting using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, or Datadog.
Enhance network security by managing firewalls, VPNs, and access control policies.

Requirements
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent experience).
Experience: 3+ years of experience in infrastructure engineering, DevOps, or system administration.
Experience with cloud providers like AWS, GCP, Alibaba, or Azure.
Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix system administration.
Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) (Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation).
Familiarity with container orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience in monitoring and logging (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, Datadog).
Proficiency in scripting and automation (Python, Bash, or Go).
Strong understanding of networking, security, and system scalability.
Knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, ArgoCD).

job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose - Bridging the World Through Travel 

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work)

Get to Know our Team:

As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda‚Äôs unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity: 

As a BI Developer, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda.

In this Role, you‚Äôll get to:

Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‚Äòright questions‚Äô, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders.
Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business.
Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply.
Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence.
Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

At least 2-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) 
Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite.
Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
A hacker‚Äôs mindset ‚Äì the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping.
Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.
Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement.
Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources.

It‚Äôs Great if you Have: 

MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance).
Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience.
Asian market experience.
Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience.
