job_title: Payment Growth and Marketing Strategy Lead- Global Payment
job_description:
About the job
Responsibilities
The Global Payment team of ByteDance provides payment solutions - including payment acquisitions, disbursements, transaction monitoring, payment method management, foreign exchange conversion, accounting, reconciliations, and so on to ensure that our users have a smooth and secure payment experience on ByteDance platforms including TikTok.

Responsibilities:
Growth & Solution
- Manage P&L and actively identify opportunities and build strategy for optimization. 
- Drive discussions with cross-functional teams to execute initiatives and projects to drive overall country performance
- Setting up targets and monitoring achievement of new initiatives and improvements to achieve goals, including course-corrective actions, if necessary
- Coordinate with internal teams and stakeholders, including product, tech, marketing, legal, finance and customer support, and also other businesses within the group to ensure seamless project management. 
- Manage the COD feature and strategy

Marketing 
- Develop and execute customized payment marketing campaign plans in collaboration with all ByteDance businesses such as eCommerce, Live Streaming, Advertisement etc. These campaigns will be tailored for each partner to enhance engagement and accelerate transaction growth.
- Utilize 360 marketing channels including website, email marketing, social media, events, and content marketing, and collaborate closely with the User Growth team 
- Manage the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and partnership activities, leveraging insights to optimize future strategies and communicate ROI to stakeholders
- Continuously monitor market trends and the competitive landscape to pinpoint opportunities for new or expanded partnerships
- Foster strong, collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of campaigns and initiatives

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Good knowledge of payment processing, banking regulations, and e-commerce industry trends.
-Proven ability to gather and analyze data, generate insights, test hypotheses, identify root causes, and develop actionable plans.
- Strong research, critical thinking, and problem-solving abilities, with proficiency in measurement, performance, and optimization tools.
- Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities and tight deadlines.

About Us
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Lemon8, CapCut and Pico as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.


Why Join ByteDance
Inspiring creativity is at the core of ByteDance's mission. Our innovative products are built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we work towards every day.
As ByteDancers, we strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our Company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.
Diversity & Inclusion
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About the job
Do you enjoy being part of a successful team?

Are you a Field Specialist looking for a new direction?

Join our Oilfield Services Team

We are the leader in well construction and production. Our innovative physical and digital solutions improve efficiency, production and maximize reservoir value. Our Field Services team works onsite with our customers to support the on-site installation, maintenance and planning of our industry-leading products.

Partner with the best

As a Field Supervisor I - Wellbore Intervention, you will play a vital role supporting our field operations under broad direction in the assigned district. You will be a key player to run most wellbore intervention application.

As a Field Supervisor I - Wellbore Intervention, you will be responsible for:


Running Wellbore Intervention applications in assigned district ensuring supplied equipment compatible with all equipment used for job
Applying expertise to include applications of increasing complexity and/or risk in Wellbore Intervention and other product groups

Fuel your passion

Have a good understanding of mechanical and application proficiency with Wellbore Intervention products or other product groups

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone.

This role has various rotation based working patterns. Please talk to us about the specific working patterns available when you apply or will be supervised directly by the role manager.

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits


About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward ‚Äì making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let‚Äôs come together and take energy forward.

About the job
Job Introduction

Main Responsibilities

The Primary duties of the post will be to carry out maintenance and project work on switchgear and plant at 132 and 33kV substations.

You must be able to work on your own initiative as part of a small team, making on the spot decisions as required and working to tight deadlines. A flexible attitude is essential as you may be asked to undertake other duties to assist the team in meeting its objectives. In addition, you will need to be mobile throughout the area as you may be required to undertake standby duties.

Candidate Requirements

The candidate will ideally have relevant practical experience of working on 132kV / EHV substation sites including electrical / mechanical fitting or wiring experience.

Consideration will be given to an appointment, on a designate basis, to applicants that do not possess all the skills required to undertake the role at present but have the confidence and ability to reach the necessary standards with appropriate training.

job_location: Kecamatan Cikarang Selatan, West Java, Indonesia
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires the candidate to work in Cikarang, Jawa Barat, Indonesia.

Client Overview

Our client is a global leader in materials science and innovative self-adhesive solutions for consumer products and labels, with a focus on apparel, footwear, and retail industries. Established in 1935, the company pioneered pressure-sensitive stickers and has since expanded to operate in over 50 countries across six continents, delivering creative and sustainable solutions including graphic tickets, tags, labels, embellishments, and packaging solutions.

In Indonesia, the company serves a wide range of customers in apparel, footwear, home textiles, and sports goods sectors. Its manufacturing sites act as strategic hubs to support exporters across the country, ensuring high-quality products and efficient production to meet both domestic and international demand.

Job Role

The client is looking for a senior, customer-focused, and data-driven Sales Manager to lead business development and account management with a major global fashion retail brand, its regional buying office, and supply chain partners. This role requires building long-term partnerships, positioning the company as a trusted provider of labels, packaging, embellishments, and RFID solutions, and driving profitable growth through account strategy, negotiation, and market expansion.

As part of the senior leadership team, the Sales Manager will combine hands-on client management with strategic influence, representing Indonesia in regional and global forums, aligning with international strategies, mentoring Key Account Executives, managing complex stakeholder relationships, and delivering measurable results in revenue, margin, and market share.

Key Responsibilities

Account Ownership & Growth: Lead a major global retail client, develop and execute long-term account strategies for revenue, margin, and market growth.
Stakeholder Management: Build senior-level client relationships, coordinate with factories, agents, and internal teams for smooth execution.
Business Planning & Performance: Manage sales pipeline, forecast accurately, conduct business reviews, and identify opportunities to expand solutions across client value chain.
Regional & Global Collaboration: Align strategies with regional/global teams, represent Indonesia in global forums, and share market insights.
Team Leadership & Development: Coach and mentor account executives, foster collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.

Candidate Requirements

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, or related field.
Experience: 7‚Äì10 years in sales or account management, with at least 3 years in a managerial role; proven success managing a high-value global retail or fashion client.
Industry Background: Experience in apparel, fashion retail, packaging, or consumer-related industries in a multinational setting.
Language: Professional English (written and spoken) for global communication.
Technical Skills: Strategic account planning, relationship-building, negotiation, connecting commercial and operational elements, CRM and forecasting tools proficiency.
Professional Skills: Lead complex negotiations, manage and develop high-potential team members.
Personal Qualities: Client-focused, professional, adaptable, analytical, results-oriented.
Mobility: Willing to travel frequently within Indonesia, regionally, or overseas.

Job Code: #337

Desired Skills and Experience
Sales Strategy, Business Development, Key Account Management, Performance Management, Team Management

About the job
Senior DevOps Engineer position has just become available in a fast-growing and innovative digital automotive company in Jakarta, Indonesia. Backed by one of the country's largest business groups, this company is transforming the mobility ecosystem through cutting-edge platforms and technology-driven solutions.

Senior DevOps Engineer

Salary: Competitive and based on experience
Location: Indonesia
Keywords: collaborative, infrastructure as code, automation, observability, application performance, production readiness, supportive team, continuous improvement, cross-functional teamwork, problem-solving
An exciting opportunity awaits with Indonesia's leading digital automotive platform, where they are searching for a Senior DevOps Engineer to ignite transformation in the way people buy, own, and enjoy vehicles. This is your chance to join a vibrant organisation that fuses the security of an established market leader with the thrill and creativity of a technology-driven powerhouse. As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you'll be at the centre of innovation-ensuring seamless application performance, building robust infrastructure, and championing continuous delivery. You'll thrive in a culture that celebrates collaboration, encourages fresh ideas, and values your expertise every step of the way. With flexible working options, generous training programmes, and a truly supportive environment, this is the perfect place to accelerate your career while making a real impact.
Become part of a thriving digital business backed by one of Indonesia's most respected groups-enjoying both stability and the excitement of rapid technological progress.
Take advantage of flexible working opportunities and comprehensive training designed to help you expand your skills and advance your career within a nurturing, growth-focused environment.
Experience a collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing, mutual support, and inclusive decision-making are woven into every project and initiative.
What you'll do:
Step into the role of Senior DevOps Engineer and immerse yourself in an energetic environment where your passion for connecting teams and streamlining processes will shine. Every day brings new opportunities to collaborate with talented colleagues from across departments-ensuring that every layer of the technology stack runs smoothly. Your expertise will drive initiatives that automate manual processes, build resilient systems ready for scale, and keep everyone informed through effective monitoring solutions. You'll play a vital part in incident management-leading investigations alongside developers and implementing strategies that prevent future disruptions. Your enthusiasm for continuous improvement will empower you to make meaningful contributions that elevate user experience and operational excellence throughout the organisation.
Bridge communication and technical gaps between Core Infrastructure, Security, Quality Assurance, and Development Teams to ensure smooth project delivery.
Take ownership of end-to-end availability and performance for critical applications and their supporting infrastructure, proactively identifying areas for improvement.
Provide comprehensive 24/7 support for both infrastructure and applications, responding promptly to incidents and minimising downtime for users.
Automate development workflows and release processes to enhance efficiency, reliability, and repeatability across the software lifecycle.
Design, implement, manage, and maintain scalable infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles to ensure consistency and traceability.
Lead onboarding efforts for new applications by conducting thorough production readiness reviews in collaboration with stakeholders.
Work closely with developers to gain deep insights into application architecture, identifying potential bottlenecks or vulnerabilities before they impact operations.
Identify gaps in observability within both applications and infrastructure; work with relevant teams to address these using appropriate monitoring tools.
Manage outages effectively by coordinating response efforts, performing detailed root cause analysis (RCA), and collaborating on long-term solutions to prevent recurrence.
Continuously seek opportunities to automate repetitive tasks (toil), freeing up time for higher-value engineering work.
What you bring:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer here, your blend of technical know-how and interpersonal skills will set you apart. You'll bring hands-on experience with cloud technologies and automation frameworks that power today's most successful DevOps teams. Your solid grasp of networking concepts ensures you can help build secure infrastructures capable of supporting complex applications. You're adept at implementing monitoring solutions that deliver actionable insights into system health-and you respond quickly when it matters most. Your analytical approach helps you dig deep into issues alongside others to develop lasting solutions. Most importantly, your willingness to share knowledge and support colleagues creates an atmosphere where everyone can succeed together.
  Demonstrated collaborative spirit with proven ability to work across multiple disciplines including infrastructure, security, QA, and development teams.
Comprehensive understanding of computer science fundamentals as well as modern software development methodologies.
In-depth knowledge of networking principles essential for designing secure and reliable systems.
Hands-on experience automating development pipelines using industry-standard tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or similar platforms.
Proficiency in managing cloud-based infrastructure through Infrastructure as Code frameworks like Terraform or CloudFormation.
Strong background in monitoring application performance using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK Stack.
Experience providing 24/7 support for mission-critical systems with a focus on minimising downtime through effective incident response practices.
Ability to conduct detailed root cause analysis (RCA) following outages or incidents in partnership with development teams.
Track record of successfully onboarding new applications into production environments through structured review processes.
Commitment to automating repetitive tasks (toil) in order to improve overall team productivity.
What sets this company apart:
This digital automotive platform is truly unique-combining the legacy of one of Indonesia's largest conglomerates with the energy of a tech start-up. Here you'll find unmatched job security paired with the freedom to experiment boldly in an agile setting. The company is passionate about fostering an inclusive environment where every voice counts-encouraging open communication at all levels. Flexible working arrangements let you balance life's demands without holding back your career ambitions. With generous investment in training and professional growth opportunities at every turn, you'll always be ahead in your field. Join not just a workplace but a community dedicated to making car ownership simpler-and more enjoyable-for millions across Indonesia.
What's next:
Ready to energise your career while shaping how technology transforms everyday experiences? Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity!
 Apply today by clicking on the link provided-take your next big step towards joining an inspiring team where your contributions are celebrated.
Due to the high volume of applications we are experiencing, our team will only be in touch with you if your application is shortlisted.

job_title: Campaign Management Specialist - Electronics & Automotive (TikTok Shop By Tokopedia) Indonesia
job_description:
About the job
Responsibilities
About the Team
The Campaign Team at TikTok Shop & Tokopedia leads strategic and operational efforts to drive key initiatives across both platforms. We work at the core of platform-wide and category-specific campaigns, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to grow sellers, engage users, and optimize campaign performance.

We‚Äôre currently expanding our team to support the Electronics & Automotive category one of the most exciting and high-potential verticals. Whether it‚Äôs through day-to-day operations, or data-driven projects, you‚Äôll play an important role in shaping the future of this space. If you're passionate about e-commerce, love solving problems, and enjoy working with both data and people, this is the team for you.

Roles & Responsibilities
As part of the Campaign Team for Electronics & Automotive, your role will focus on end-to-end campaign management, operational excellence, and data-driven execution across both TikTok Shop and Tokopedia. You‚Äôll work closely with category managers, central team, and other internal teams to bring impactful projects to life.

Campaign & Project Management
- Support and/or lead planning and execution of related key campaigns (Mega Campaigns, IP Campaigns, Campaign Project and always-on initiatives).
- Coordinate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure smooth and timely execution.
- Collaborate with category and central teams to align campaign strategies with business goals.
- Maintain clear documentation, timelines, and reporting for each campaign/project.

Operational Excellence
- Monitor campaign operations and resolve any issues related to execution, product readiness, seller participation, or system flows.
- Work with internal teams (e.g. monetization, IMC, product ops) to optimize processes.
- Ensure all assets, offers, and content are submitted and implemented accurately.

Data & Performance Tracking
- Track and analyze key campaign metrics (e.g. traffic, conversion, GMV, seller performance).
- Prepare regular reports and insights to evaluate campaign effectiveness.
- Identify opportunities for improvement and optimization based on data.
- Support category team with insights to drive growth strategies.

Stakeholder Collaboration
- Act as a bridge between category, marketing, product, creator, and operations teams.
- Communicate updates, blockers, and learnings clearly and proactively.
- Help ensure a consistent and aligned campaign experience for each platforms.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualification(s)
- Minimum 2 years of experience in e-commerce, marketing, operations, or related project roles.
- Comfortable working with data (e.g. Excel, dashboards) and drawing insights.
- Ability to manage timelines, prioritize tasks, and work with multiple stakeholders.
- A self-starter attitude with attention to detail.
- Willingness to adapt in a fast-moving, constantly evolving environment.

Preferred Qualification(s)
- Experience in Electronics and/or Automotive categories.
- Prior exposure to platforms like TikTok Shop, Tokopedia, or similar marketplaces.
- A track record of running campaigns or cross-functional projects.
- A data-first mindset with ability to turn insights into action.
- Enthusiastic about testing, learning, and iterating fast.

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About the job
Do you enjoy motivating others to deliver successful solutions for business and customers?

Are you passionate in scientific and engineering methodologies?

Join our growing team

Our Oilfield Services business provides intelligent, connected technologies to monitor and control our energy extraction assets and supporting facilities. Our team arranging technical expertise to meet our client expectation. We provide customers with the peace of mind needed to reliably and efficiently improve their operations.

As a Geothermal Geophysicist, you‚Äôll involve in using physical measurements to understand Earth's heat and potential for renewable energy. This include collecting and analyzing geophysical data, interpreting subsurface heat flow, modelling geothermal reservoirs, conducting field surveys in various conditions, collaborating with engineers and geologists, and reporting findings to support sustainable energy development.

As a Geothermal Geophysicist, you will be responsible for:


Conducting field surveys to collect geophysical data, such as MT resistivity, seismic waves, gravity, and other applied earth physics techniques. 
Processing the collected data to be ready for interpretation, namely 1D, 2D, 3D modeling, and etc.
Interpreting the data and integrate the data with other disciplines, namely geology, geophysics, geochemistry, and reservoir engineering.
Working with geologists, engineers, and other scientists to design experiments and integrate geophysical findings into subsurface characterization, resource delineation, resource estimate, reservoir processes, and others. 
Utilizing advanced software for data processing, interpretation, and 3D subsurface modeling to better understand geothermal reservoirs. 
Preparing detailed reports and presentations on findings and recommendations for stakeholders, contributing to scientific publications. 


Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:


Have bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Geology, Geophysics, Earth Sciences, Physics, or Geological Engineering.
Have at least 10 years‚Äô experience in Geophysics /Geology experience in a wide variety of reservoir types
Have great foundation in physics, mathematics, and earth sciences. 
Have experience with geophysical instrumentation and data analysis software. 
Have proven ability to interpret seismic data, magnetic fields, and other geophysical measurements. 
Have ability to work in remote locations, handle specialized equipment, and ensure data accuracy. 
Have excellent verbal and written communication to convey complex technical information to diverse audiences. 


Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:


Please discuss your suitable schedule during your discussion with respective recruiter.


Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we must push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:


Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits


About Us:

We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward ‚Äì making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let‚Äôs come together and take energy forward.

About the job
Job Description

Freelance Biology - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)

RemoteAuditor ‚Ä∫ Biology

 United States
 Part-time

Description

This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $50/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

Generative AI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. The QA role involves evaluating complex question-answer pairs written by our experts and create scoring criteria (rubrics) to evaluate and grade the quality of responses.

This role includes the following responsibilities:

Content Creation & Refinement: Create and refine content to ensure accuracy and relevance across a variety of topics in Biology, while also developing references and examples of tasks.
Experts Acquisition: Assess qualification tests of experts, ensuring their competency.
Chat Moderation: Provide support by addressing project-related questions from other experts in Discord chats, especially those related to project guidelines.
Auditing Work: Review and evaluate tasks completed by AI Trainers, ensuring they align with project guidelines. Provide constructive feedback, verify expertise-related information, and edit content as necessary to improve quality.

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you‚Äôll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

You have a Master‚Äôs or PhD Degree in Biology or a related field.
You have at least 6 years of professional experience.
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
You have experience in writing or evaluating complex LLM prompts.
You have experience in Teaching/Lecturing/Consulting in your domain.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge.

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $55/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs.
Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise.

About the job
About Finetiks
Finetiks is a licensed fintech company regulated by the Financial Services Authority of Indonesia (OJK). We partner with trusted banks to offer market-leading financial products that help Indonesians build great financial habits and live financially well.
Our flagship product, Finetiks VIP Save, is a digital savings account offering a market-leading up to 6.25% p.a. interest, with no fees, backed by Bank Victoria International ‚Äî a reputable commercial bank with over 30 years of experience and nearly 40 branches across Indonesia.

Role Overview
We are looking for a proven relationship-driven sales professional with a strong background in selling savings, deposits, insurance, or wealth management products to high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs).
The ideal candidate already has a trusted personal network of premium clients and can leverage these relationships to grow the savings under management (SUM) at Finetiks.
You will play a key role in driving Finetiks VIP Save‚Äôs deposit growth by acquiring affluent customers, deepening relationships, and developing referral and partnership channels.

Key Responsibilities
Sales & Growth
Develop and execute a clear strategy to increase savings and deposits held in Finetiks VIP Save.
Achieve and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets aligned with company growth goals.
Identify, approach, and convert high-value customers through your existing client network.
Relationship Management
Build and maintain long-term relationships with VIP and high-net-worth clients.
Provide tailored financial solutions that meet clients‚Äô savings and wealth management needs.
Deliver an exceptional customer experience that builds trust and advocacy.
Partnership & Networking
Cultivate partnerships with businesses, financial advisors, and community networks to expand customer acquisition channels.
Actively represent Finetiks at industry events, private client gatherings, and networking forums.
Performance & Reporting

Provide actionable insights to optimize customer acquisition and retention strategies.

Qualifications & Experience

Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience in sales within banking, insurance, or wealth management.
Proven track record of selling savings, deposits, insurance, or investment products to affluent or high-net-worth clients.
Strong personal client base and professional network that can be leveraged for customer growth.
Deep understanding of financial products, compliance, and customer relationship management.
Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Fluent in Bahasa Indonesia and English.

Why Join Us?

Work with a passionate team dedicated to financial inclusion and innovation.
Competitive salary, bonuses, and growth opportunities.
How to Apply:
If you are passionate about fintech, deeply understand financial products, and enjoy working with premium customers, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Apply now by sending your CV and a cover letter to people@finetiks.com

Apply Today!

job_title: TikTok Shop - Moderation Quality Assurance Program Manager
job_description:
About the job
Responsibilities
About the Team
Global E-Commerce's Governance and Experience (GNE) is a global team responsible for ensuring a safe and trustworthy marketplace for not only our buyers, but also our sellers and creators. Global Moderation is part of the GNE organization. Our mission is to create the most trustworthy E-commerce platform with a delightful service experience. Global Moderation is looking for a Moderation Quality Assurance Program Manager to build, lean and sharpen our team's operation processes and make recommendations to improve our overall moderation quality. 

To be successful as an Moderation Quality Assurance Program Manager, you should be able to understand complex data sets, identify shortcomings or opportunities, multi-tasking and participate in different projects. Most importantly, you should be able to build and optimise our current operational procedures, using advanced lean process methodology to standardise and improve our QA functions in order to improve overall e-commerce moderation quality. Meanwhile, work very closely with management and/or XFN team to get the project done before deadlines.

Responsibilities
- Overall responsible for building and optimising our current operational procedures, using advanced lean process methodology to improve our QA functions in order to improve overall e-commerce moderation quality.
- Overall responsible for standardizing, leaning and sharpening current workflows (including offline/online QA activities, RCA analysis or other regular QA analytics), producing and documenting all workflows/SOPs and cascading to different QA teams globally.
- Responsible for evaluating the priority of different projects and promoting projects as the process-professional.
- Follow up the Quality Assurance operational works, support the operation effect and give optimization suggestions through process improvements.
- Working closely with the training team and QA team leaders, gathering issues/blockers and resolving them through advanced process methodology.
- Participate in different projects, brainstorming, identify shortcomings or opportunities, give certain suggestions from a process-pro point of view.

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
- BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
- 3+ years of related experience in quality assurance, content operations.
- Possessing Knowledge of Six Sigma / Lean processes & continuous improvement methodologies. 
- Demonstrates eagerness to learn, initiative-taking abilities, and strong problem-solving skills.
- Possesses excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.
 
Preferred Qualifications
- Experience in eCommerce platforms and content moderation experience.
- People-oriented, self-motivated and able to thrive in ambiguity and in a matrix environment.

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.

Diversity & Inclusion
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

job_title: Sales Training Manager (Consumer Finance) - Chinese Speaker
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires the candidate to work in Jakarta, Indonesia. 

Client Overview

Our client is a registered multifinance company operating under its own legal entity, focused on expanding financial inclusion through accessible and practical financing solutions. The company provides a range of financial products and services designed to make it easier for individuals to meet their everyday needs, particularly in the areas of consumer electronics and household goods.

Specializing in consumer financing and retail partnerships, the company serves customers who may have limited access to traditional banking or credit facilities. Its offerings are tailored to young adults and families seeking convenient financing options to enhance their quality of life, reflecting the company‚Äôs commitment to affordability, accessibility, and customer empowerment in the financial services sector.

Job Role

The Training Manager will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing training programs for the consumer finance sector, with the goal of enhancing employees‚Äô professional knowledge, sales capabilities, and business skills.

This role will also lead a training team, collaborate with cross-functional departments, and ensure that training initiatives are aligned with the company‚Äôs strategic goals. The Training Manager will report to senior management and be based in Jakarta, with regular business travel to branches and customer sites.

Key Responsibilities

Course Development & Design
Design, develop, and update high-quality training materials tailored to business needs and industry trends.
Create engaging training formats (lectures, case studies, role plays, digital learning tools).
Training Delivery & Evaluation
Organize and conduct both online and offline training programs.

Team Leadership & Collaboration

Cross-Department Communication & Reporting

Candidate Requirements

Mobility:

About the job
Indonesia

Provincial Finance Officer - Papua

Organization

DT Global

Posted 5 Nov 2025 Closing date 17 Nov 2025

Location: Papua Region (Jayapura)

Program Background

Responsibilities

The SKALA Program is a significant Australian investment designed to help Indonesia address regional disparities in development. SKALA will contribute to this objective by strengthening selected elements of Indonesia‚Äôs large and complex decentralised government system responsible for the delivery of basic services (Layanan Dasar). The SKALA Program‚Äôs core approach is to facilitate better collaboration (Kolaborasi) between Indonesian government stakeholders, at national and subnational levels, to help realise synergies (Sinergi) that will trigger improved service delivery. Moreover, SKALA will build on, and take to scale, the successes and learning from Australia‚Äôs previous 19 years of support to Indonesia‚Äôs decentralised government system. The SKALA Program is to be implemented through the following three pillars:

Pillar 1: Stronger national level enabling environment for sub-national service delivery.

Pillar 2: Better sub-national governance for service delivery.

Pillar 3: Greater participation, representation and influence for women, people with disabilities and vulnerable groups.

SKALA is implemented at the national level with an office in Jakarta and at the subnational level with offices in Aceh, Nusa Tenggara Barat, Nusa Tenggara Timur, Maluku, Gorontalo, Kalimantan Utara, Tanah Papua. In addition to the 3 pillars, SKALA works across 4 general themes of Public Financial Management, Minimum Service Standards, Data and Analysis and GEDSI.

About DT Global Asia Pacific

At DT Global Asia Pacific, we aim to positively impact people‚Äôs lives through delivery excellence. As a leading implementing partner across Asia and the Pacific, we co-create locally led solutions in partnership with governments, communities, and stakeholders. We bring together talented teams and deep regional expertise to deliver initiatives that promote inclusive economic growth, essential services, and resilient, secure communities. With over 1,500 staff, experts in 22+ countries and more than 60 years of development experience, we tackle complex community, national and transnational challenges ‚Äî from governance and justice systems to climate resilience, infrastructure and social equity ‚Äî with innovative thinking and a commitment to long-term impact.

For more information, please see www.dt-global.com

The Role

The Provincial Finance Officer ‚Äì Papua provides day-to-day financial and administrative support to ensure transparent, accurate, and compliant financial management for SKALA‚Äôs Papua Provincial Office. The position reports to the Provincial Lead ‚Äì Papua and receives daily supervision from the Provincial Finance Coordinator ‚Äì Papua, and works closely with the Jakarta-based Finance and Compliance team.

Click on the link or copy paste it to access the full Terms of Reference for this position:

https://tinyurl.com/2nrwkdab

About You

Specific Responsibilities

Financial Operations

Prepare and process payment requests and ensure completeness and compliance with SKALA Finance Manual.
Maintain petty cash for Papua office, record transactions, and prepare monthly reconciliation reports.
Support advance requests, acquittals, and monitor staff and consultant advances.
Assist in reviewing workshop and travel financial documentation and verifying supporting evidence.
Ensure timely and accurate filing of all financial records (both hard copy and digital).
Assist in the preparation of monthly financial reports for submission to the Finance Coordinator and Jakarta Finance Team.

Compliance and Monitoring

Ensure all provincial financial transactions comply with DT Global, DFAT, and SKALA financial policies.
Verify payment supporting documents, coding accuracy, and adherence to budget allocations.
Support internal audits, finance quality checks, and assist in implementing audit recommendations.
Monitor outstanding advances and ensure timely settlement.
Identify and report potential risks, irregularities, or fraud indicators to the Provincial Finance Coordinator and Province Lead ‚Äì Papua Region.

Coordination and Support

Liaise with Jakarta Finance Team for monthly closing, funds transfer, and other reporting requirements.
Provide support and advice to provincial staff on financial procedures and documentation.
Support activity budgeting and financial forecasts for events and fieldwork.
Coordinate with respective Papua‚Äôs Administration Officer and Operations and Procurement teams for payments and vendor documentation.

Other Duties

Comply with DFAT, DT Global and SKALA policies on gender, disability, fraud and anticorruption, child protection, PSEAH and the environment.
Ensure compliance and adherence to various operational policies, guidelines and manuals issued by DT Global and SKALA.
Proactively identify and manage risks within level of accountability.
Undertake other finance-related tasks as required by the program

Job Requirements

Work environment involves only infrequent exposure to disagreeable elements and minor physical exertion and/or strain.
Work may require long, and flexible hours as needed. Travel is based on need.

Relationship Management

The Provincial Finance Officer ‚Äì Papua reports to the Provincial Lead ‚Äì Papua and receives daily supervision from the Provincial Finance Coordinator ‚Äì Papua. The role works closely with the Provincial Operations Team, the Jakarta-based Finance and Compliance Unit, and external service providers including vendors, banks, and auditors.

Selection Criteria

Essential

Diploma or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting/Finance.
Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
Strong organizational and document management skills.
Familiarity with accounting systems and financial reporting.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
High attention to detail, reliability, and integrity.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage competing priorities.
Strong teamwork, adaptability, and time management skills.

Preferred

Experience in donor-funded programs, particularly DFAT.
Knowledge of local tax and compliance requirements.
Previous experience working in the Papua region.
Ability to work independently while maintaining accountability and collaboration with colleagues.
Good English capability will be an advantage.
Ability to work effectively with local government counterparts and community-based partners.
Experience using digital finance or ERP systems.

How to apply

Click the link to apply: Position Description

Please submit

 Your CV
 A cover letter addressing the selection criteria

APPLICATIONS CLOSE Monday, 17 November 2025, Max 5 PM Jakarta Time

job_title: Associate Manager, Sales Account Management (GKAM HYSU)
job_description:
About the job
SC JOHNSON IS A FIFTH-GENERATION FAMILY COMPANY BUILT ON THE SPIRIT OF OUR PEOPLE. We have been leading with purpose for over 130 years, building iconic brands that win the hearts and minds of consumers ‚Äì such as Raid¬Æ, Glade¬Æ, Ziploc¬Æ and more, in virtually every country around the world. Together, we are creating a better future ‚Äì for the planet, for future generations and for every SCJ team member. Join our winning team of Wave Makers and Go Getters and help us write the next chapter in the SCJ story.

As the Associate Manager, Sales Account Management (Hypermarket Supermarket), you will develop and manage SC Johnson (SCJ) business in the assigned group of accounts and achieving annual objectives of volume, profit and growth for the accounts within provided budget. You will build identify, recruit, develop and supervise team within the account responsibility.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Develop yearly account planning, account profile and measurements such as sales volume, budgeting, shared growth, space management, promotion activity, strategy execution and timeline
Conduct quarterly business review meetings and arrange yearly top to top meetings with the accounts to update on the status of the business and identify opportunities and necessary action steps
Develop strategic partnerships and build a good relationship with assigned customers that result in a comprehensive understanding of the customer's position in the marketplace, business objectives
Positively resolve the conflicting demands and situations that may occur between SCJ‚Äôs goal and the customer's objectives
Sell volume and distribution by ensuring the assigned accounts carries all SCJ brands and SKUs as well as effectively manage the accounts inventory levels by establishing minimum stock levels and selling enough volume to prevent stock-outs
Develop category or brands performance and make account specific plans with marketing and customer marketing teams to maintain and improve the market share
Support and enhance tools and processes used to manage and govern SCJ technology portfolio

Required Skills / Experience / Competencies

Bachelor‚Äôs in Business, Economics or related field
Minimum 5 to 7 years of experience in managing Key Account
Minimum 3 years of experience in leadership and people management
Experience in Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry will be an added advantage

Job Requirements

Permanent ‚Äì full time job
No relocation egilibility

Inclusion & Diversity

We‚Äôre a global business, with people from every culture, ethnicity, race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age and ability. We recognize the breadth of human experience, and we work to celebrate it. It is our goal to build a diverse, inclusive and supportive work environment where all people can thrive.

We‚Äôre committed to ongoing efforts that help us attract, hire, and retain diverse talent who want to build a positive, inclusive environment. Read more about our ongoing initiatives at https://jobs.scjohnson.com/inclusion.

About the job
Business Controlling Manager ‚Äì Switzerland (m/w/x)
 Role Description & Qualifications
As a Business Controlling Manager in Switzerland, you will act as a strategic partner to senior management, providing financial insights, analysis, and guidance that support sound decision-making and sustainable business growth. This role focuses on aligning financial performance with strategic objectives, optimizing operational efficiency, and ensuring transparent, data-driven management reporting.
The Business Controlling Manager bridges finance and operations, translating complex financial data into actionable strategies. You will lead budgeting and forecasting processes, monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and provide recommendations that enhance profitability and cost efficiency. This position requires both technical expertise and strategic acumen, as well as the ability to communicate effectively across different business functions.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead and coordinate budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial planning processes.
Analyze financial performance, identify trends and variances, and develop actionable recommendations.
Prepare and present management reports, dashboards, and performance reviews for decision-makers.
Partner with business units to ensure alignment between operational initiatives and financial goals.
Conduct cost analysis, margin optimization, and scenario planning to improve business outcomes.
Ensure compliance with Swiss accounting standards, IFRS, and internal corporate policies.
Drive process improvements and enhance financial reporting accuracy and efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support investment cases, business reviews, and strategic projects.
Provide leadership, mentoring, and support to controlling and finance team members.
Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or Economics; professional certifications (CPA, ACCA, CMA) are a plus.
Strong expertise in financial controlling, management reporting, budgeting, and performance analysis.
Proficiency in ERP and business intelligence systems (e.g., SAP, Power BI, Hyperion) and advanced Excel skills.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual thinking abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate across all levels of the organization.
Deep understanding of Swiss GAAP, IFRS, and local financial regulations.
Strategic mindset with attention to detail and a proactive, solution-oriented approach.
Fluency in English is required; German and/or French language skills are highly valued.
This position is ideal for professionals who combine analytical precision with strategic thinking. As a Business Controlling Manager in Switzerland, you will play a central role in shaping financial strategy, improving business performance, and driving long-term success in a dynamic international environment.

About the job
Recruitment: Digital Account Manager (Part-time, Remote)
 American Giant
About American Giant
American Giant was founded on a simple yet powerful belief: great products start with great values. Quality craftsmanship, responsible production, and genuine care for people have always been at the heart of who we are.
We are committed to building enduring customer relationships by delivering exceptional experiences both online and offline. Our growth is fueled not by shortcuts, but by integrity, thoughtful innovation, and a deep respect for the communities we serve.
As we continue to expand our digital presence, we are seeking a dedicated and proactive Digital Account Manager who shares our values and is ready to help us deliver meaningful engagement, attentive service, and world-class digital experience for every customer.
Why This Role Matters
The Digital Account Manager plays a vital role in strengthening trust and loyalty between American Giant and our customers.
You will serve as the bridge between brand, digital strategy, and the customer journey ‚Äî ensuring that communication is clear, needs are understood, and expectations are exceeded.
Your work will directly influence customer satisfaction, retention, and long-term brand growth. This role is ideal for someone who approaches service with empathy, treats relationships with care, and thrives in an environment where quality and integrity guide every decision.
Key Responsibilities
Manage day-to-day digital communication with customers and partners
Maintain strong relationships by understanding needs and providing timely, thoughtful support
Coordinate with internal teams to ensure smooth execution of digital initiatives
Monitor and analyze account performance, identifying improvement opportunities

Required Skills & Qualifications
Strong communication skills, written and verbal
Customer-first mindset with genuine empathy and professionalism
Organized, detail-oriented, and disciplined with time management

Self-driven, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote setting
Preferred Experience (Not Required)

Past work in consumer goods or lifestyle brands
Familiarity with CRM systems or customer experience tools
Understanding of brand-driven storytelling and community-focused marketing
We welcome applications from candidates who may be early in their career but have strong motivation, work ethic, and commitment to growth.
Benefits & Work Culture
Part-time remote role with flexible schedule
Collaborative and supportive working environment
Exposure to a purpose-driven American heritage brand
Opportunities to learn and develop long-term digital and client-management skills
Room for career growth based on performance and dedication
Culture built on transparency, responsibility, and mutual respect
We take pride in creating a culture where people are trusted, valued, and empowered to do their best work.
Our Values
Customer obsession, practiced through care and attentiveness
Thoughtful, honest communication
Respect for time, quality, and craft
Quiet discipline and consistent improvement
Long-term partnership and ethical conduct
We believe the right individuals bring both skill and character ‚Äî and grow alongside us with pride and purpose.

job_description:
About the job
Additional Information

Job Number25178233

Job CategoryHuman Resources

Position Summary

Assist and support management and the leadership team with handling and resolving Human Resources issues. Assist employees with internal and external transfer requests and procedures. Monitor and assist managers/supervisors with hiring processes and issues. Coordinate and conduct applicant drug screens, reference checks, background checks, motor vehicle checks, and social security number verification. Maintain applicant flow, drug screen, orientation and transfer request logs. Create and maintain new hire and personnel files and enter them into Human Resources Information Systems. Assist with orientation of new employees. Monitor all hiring and recruitment processes for compliance with all local, state, and federal laws and company policies and standards. Ensure accurate maintenance of all employee records and files (e.g., interview documents, I-9's). Support processing and maintenance of payroll records in accordance with policies and procedures, as necessary. Inform Human Resources management of issues related to employee relations within the division or property. Create and maintain filing systems. Generate Human Resources data reports as necessary Answer phone calls and record messages. Create and type office correspondence using computer. Serve as Human Resources subject matter expert and participate on project teams. Train new hires on Human Resources processes, programs, policies, information systems, etc.

Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

Preferred Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or G.E.D. equivalent.

Related Work Experience: At least 1 year of related work experience.

Supervisory Experience: No supervisory experience.

License or Certification: None

At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated.‚ÄØOur greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.

At more than 100 award-winning properties worldwide, The Ritz-Carlton Ladies and Gentlemen create experiences so exceptional that long after a guest stays with us, the experience stays with them. Attracting the world‚Äôs top hospitality professionals who curate lifelong memories, we believe that everyone succeeds when they are empowered to be creative, thoughtful and compassionate.

Every day, we set the standard for rare and special luxury service the world over and pride ourselves on delivering excellence in the care and comfort of our guests.

The Gold Standards are the foundation of The Ritz-Carlton and are what guides us each day to be better than the next. It is this foundation and our belief that our culture drives success by which The Ritz Carlton has earned the reputation as a global brand leader in luxury hospitality. As part of our team, you will learn and exemplify the Gold Standards, such as our Employee Promise, Credo and our Service Values. And our promise to you is that we offer the chance to be proud of the work you do and who you work with.

In joining The Ritz-Carlton, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

About the job
Job Title: Investment Banking - AI Trainer

Job Type: Contractual

Location: Remote

Job Summary:
Join our customer's team as an Investment Banking - AI Trainer, where you will shape the future of finance by training advanced AI models with your in-depth banking expertise. Leverage your knowledge in core investment banking functions to teach and refine an AI system that supports cutting-edge financial solutions. This is a unique opportunity to bridge human intelligence with artificial intelligence in a dynamic, remote setting.

Key Responsibilities:
Design and deliver comprehensive training datasets and scenarios for AI models focused on investment banking workflows.
Leverage hands-on experience in financial modeling, valuation, and deal structuring to inform AI training content.
Collaborate with AI engineering teams to ensure accuracy and relevance of financial data interpretation.
Develop educational materials covering M&A, capital raising, due diligence, and strategic financial analysis.
Utilize advanced Excel, Power BI/Tableau, and financial databases to create real-world case studies for machine learning training.
Evaluate AI outputs for accuracy in pitchbook preparation, market research, and client presentations.
Document training processes, deal feedback, and best practices for continual AI improvement.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Proven experience in investment banking, including financial modeling, valuation, and transaction execution.
Advanced proficiency in Excel for scenario analysis, sensitivity tables, and financial automation.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly.
Hands-on expertise with Bloomberg Terminal, Capital IQ, Refinitiv, PitchBook, and other financial research tools.
Familiarity with M&A advisory, capital raising, due diligence, and corporate finance strategy.
Experience preparing investor presentations, pitch decks, and investment memoranda.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in remote, cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications:
Practical experience with Python or VBA for financial automation and data analysis.
Proficiency with Power BI or Tableau for data visualization and reporting.
Background in training, mentoring, or upskilling teams in financial services or technology-driven environments.

About the job
Partnership Sales Manager

External Title: Partnership Sales Director

Internal Title: Partnership Sales Manager

Are you ready to lead the charge and be at the forefront of our ambitious global expansion? Is hunting, pitching and prospecting second nature to you? Can you confidently agree high-value commercial deals with building owners? Is business development in your blood? And are you relentless in your pursuit of delivering results, with the determination and resilience to change the world of work?

If yes, we need to talk.

What We Can Do For You

You‚Äôre reading the right ad if you‚Äôre looking for:

The most exciting growth opportunity in the world, where you‚Äôll be challenged every day
Excellent training, development and promotion opportunities
A fantastic incentive scheme which can see you earn great commission and prizes.


We know we can only succeed if we give all our people every opportunity to shine. It‚Äôs why so many of our most senior leaders started their careers in our centres. And it‚Äôs what made IWG the dominant global leader in the flexible-workspace industry.

About IWG

IWG is the world‚Äôs leading flexible workspace provider - with the world‚Äôs most ambitious growth programme to open 30,000+ new centres over the next decade to complement our international network of 4,000+ tech-enabled, sustainable and inspiring flexible work centres. Across our multiple brands, including Regus, Spaces, HQ and Signature, we‚Äôre provide world-beating workplace solutions to over 80% of Fortune 500 companies, including Netflix, EY, Amazon and Uber, as well as to local small start-ups, entrepreneurs and emerging businesses.

About You

You‚Äôll need to be passionate about working in a high-growth sector and ready to play a leading role in disrupting the commercial real-estate industry. You‚Äôll excel at growing your network rapidly and taking our proposition to them. And you‚Äôll thrive on initiating and closing multiple high-value deals at pace driven by your tenacity and expertise.

Whether pursuing your own leads or following up on centrally-driven enquiries, you‚Äôll highlight what makes an IWG partnership so special. By ensuring prospective partners fully understand the value of our proposition, you‚Äôll be doing much more than simply meeting sales targets. And thanks to your outstanding communications skills - primarily in your local language but also with a good level of English - you‚Äôll be able to present a truly compelling narrative to large and small audiences alike.

Most importantly though, you‚Äôll have the right, can-do mindset: passion, curiosity, pride, drive and ownership. We‚Äôll look after the rest.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Join our team of over 200 Partnerships Sales Leaders and you‚Äôll get to harness your entrepreneurial mindset, strong business and financial acumen, and commitment to achieving outstanding business development results as we add to the over 1,000 deals in 50+ countries closed in the past year alone.

From one day to the next, you‚Äôll get the chance to:

Agree high-value deals to deliver inspiring new partner locations, leveraging your expertise to expand the IWG network in every town and city
Hunt out exciting opportunities in commercial buildings of all types across your region, pitch for new partnership opportunities, convince partners to invest anywhere from ¬£250k to ¬£1m+ to develop a new IWG branded centre and close out deals quickly & effectively
Showcase the value of the IWG partnership proposition to your network of B2B connections
Source ambitious partners who match our growth goals and can help drive our rapid growth through building conversions, new development locations or competitor conversions
Employ a dynamic and versatile approach to business development, tailoring it to our partners‚Äô varying commercial needs and requirements
Actively manage your pipeline of opportunities to drive each opportunity from initial contact, through detailed commercial negotiations, all the way to a signed commercial agreement.


Carbon Neutral Workplaces

IWG‚Äôs purpose is to help everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet. We are proud to supply all our customers with carbon-neutral workplaces, and have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.

Leading Employer Award

IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in 2022, 2023 and 2024. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.

Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

Tractebel Introduction

Tractebel is a global engineering and consulting company delivering integrated solutions for sustainable energy and built environment projects. Our expertise is trusted worldwide across multiple markets like nuclear, renewables, power & gas, electrical grids, hydropower & dams, water resources & supply, desalination, complex & high-tech buildings, transport infrastructures, and ports & waterways.

By connecting strategy, design, engineering, social & environmental studies, project management and in-house digital application, we partner with companies and public authorities to create a positive impact on people and planet.

Backed by more than 150 years of experience, today Tractebel is a community of over 5,500 passionate experts across the globe, committed to ethical business and the fight against climate change. Tractebel is part of the ENGIE Group, a global reference in low-carbon energy and services.

Tractebel in the Asia Pacific (APAC) has offered high-quality services in engineering, consulting solutions, and project management in Energy & Water market for several years. With about 150 employees, Tractebel APAC has developed strong local expertise and continue to grow.

 Work Environment 

We are seeking an experienced Business Development Specialist to support the growth of our energy business in Indonesia. The role focuses on identifying new opportunities, building strategic partnerships, and supporting proposal development for renewable energy, power generation, transmission & distribution, and energy advisory projects.

You will be integrated in Tractebel Energy community, a worldwide network of Energy specialists keen on sharing their knowledge.

All your missions have to be performed with the highest standards of Quality / Safety / Legal / Ethics.

 Missions

 Support the preparation of proposals, bids, and presentations in coordination with technical and commercial teams.

 Collaborate with regional and global teams to leverage Tractebel‚Äôs international expertise and references. 

 Profile 

We are looking for talented and motivated people to create the future of energy. Join a rewarding and flexible work environment that encourages innovation and creativity and help us meet the energy challenges of today and tomorrow.

At Tractebel Indonesia, we have built a culture based on trust and respect to welcome all gender. We encourage woman candidate to apply even if you don't fulfil 100% of the requirements set out in the description. We believe our approach set us apart and better prepare our company to answer today's environmental and societal challenges. Make sure your voice is heard. Join us today and let's grow together!

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires the candidate to work in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Client Overview

The client is a rapidly growing fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company specializing in frozen and chilled food products. Since launching operations in Indonesia, it has established itself as a key player in the dairy and dessert segments, supported by a strong national distribution network and expanding presence in Southeast Asia. With multiple production facilities across the country, the company ensures consistent product quality and large-scale output through a robust cold chain infrastructure.

Its portfolio includes popular and fast-selling products that require careful handling and quick turnover, such as ice cream, yogurt, and other perishable goods, making it a trusted partner among distributors and retailers. Backed by international collaboration, the company continues to expand across regions and channels to meet increasing demand. At the core of its strategy lies a commitment to brand relevance, supply chain excellence, and continuous talent development, positioning it as a leading player in the highly competitive FMCG industry.

Job Role

The Finance and Accounting Coordinator manages daily financial and accounting operations within the New Business Development Division, focusing on sales transactions, distributor payments, channel accounts, and sales team reimbursements. The role ensures accurate financial reporting, cost and budget monitoring, and supports commercial decision-making through financial analysis. Strong communication and coordination skills are required, including proficiency in Mandarin for daily operations with expatriate management.

Key Responsibilities

Manage daily finance and accounting operations for sales and commercial activities, including distributor payments and sales reimbursements.
Prepare and analyze financial reports (balance sheets, P&L, cost vs budget, profit margin).
Monitor financial performance, operational costs, and budget allocation.
Coordinate with Head Office Finance for report consolidation, cash flow, and payments.
Supervise a small finance team (3‚Äì4 members) to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Handle tax matters in coordination with the corporate tax team.
Review contracts to identify and mitigate financial risks.
Participate in budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning.
Provide financial insights to support strategic and commercial initiatives.
Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and regulations.

Candidate Requirements

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field.
Experience: Minimum 5 years in finance, accounting, or budgeting roles, with at least 2 years in supervisory positions; experience supporting commercial operations in FMCG is preferred.
Technical Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Excel; familiarity with OA-NCC system is an advantage.
Language Skills: Fluent in English (oral and written) and Mandarin (spoken) for daily communication with expatriate management.
Professional Skills: Strong knowledge of financial reporting, budgeting, costing, and tax regulations; excellent analytical, numerical, and problem-solving abilities; ability to prepare and interpret financial statements and variance analyses.
Personal Attributes: Effective interpersonal and communication skills for cross-functional collaboration; high integrity, accountability, and ability to work under pressure and tight deadlines.

Job Code : #463

Desired Skills and Experience
Financial Statements, Accounting, Financial Analysis, Budget Management, Financial Planning
