Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

About the job
Company Description

Turner & Townsend is a global professional services company with over 22,000 people in more than 60 countries.

Working with our clients across real estate, infrastructure, energy and natural resources, we transform together delivering outcomes that improve people‚Äôs lives. Working in partnership makes it possible to deliver the world‚Äôs most impactful projects and programmes as we turn challenge into opportunity and complexity into success.

Our capabilities include programme, project, cost, asset and commercial management, controls and performance, procurement and supply chain, net zero and digital solutions.

We are majority-owned by CBRE Group, Inc., the world‚Äôs largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with our partners holding a significant minority interest. Turner & Townsend and CBRE work together to provide clients with the premier programme, project and cost management offering in markets around the world.

Please visit our website: www.turnerandtownsend.com

Job Description

To be responsible for overall project management in ensuring the quality, cost, statutory, safety and environment issues and project scheduling requirements are met
To be responsible for overall co-ordination and management of construction projects including progress, logistics, quality, cost and client relations
To coordinate between client, architects and consultants
To monitor the use of site labour, materials and plant resources in accordance with the project cost budget
To manage the implementation of the master programme, manpower, materials & plant schedules
To ensure all short-term programmes are properly reviewed and communicated to all parties concerned
To ensure proper safety conduct and standards of all site operations
To provide effective and efficient site administration, meetings and reporting
To plan and organize various statutory inspections
To act as client representative, managing the daily running of the project
To facilitate progress meetings and produce project reports
To update the master programme
To facilitate site meetings and inspections to report on quality and progress 
To manage other consultants and the professional team
To assist with the procurement and appointment of other consultants as needed

Qualifications

Experience in Data Center project (min 3 projects). Oil and Gas project can be included.
Min 10 years experience as HSE personnel
Strong leadership and good communication skill.
Experience in managing and coordinating teams.
Strong understanding of Safety compliances
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in public health/HSE, civil engineering, mechanical engineering, or electrical engineering
Proficient in written and spoken English

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance. 

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:

Twitter

Instagram

LinkedIn

It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time. 

Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.

About the job
About The Role

 As part of Next Level footprint strategy and supply network optimization, it is predicted that BC will build new Greenfield sites and fit-for-purpose Brownfield projects. BC's ambition is to kick off all these new initiatives fully compliant with the BCOS program, both in terms of organization design and ways of working. The BCOS GF Leader will be responsible for guiding the project team and developing with the local management team the new organization, technical capabilities and deployment of the BCOS work process. 
 The critical delivery of the role is on the creation high-performance and fully capable SC organization that achieves Vertical Start-Up (VSU) status and equally drives continuous improvement eliminating losses across the whole value chain, in line with site targets and objectives 

Key Responsibilities Include 

 It is expected that the incumbent has extensive experience in implementing lean/TPM programs at blue chip companies and has also experienced initiatives start-ups applying TPM Early Management methodology. 
 The incumbent will provide guidance on setting up a project team that has as its end goal the delivery of VSU with assets designed and operated at Autonomous Maintenance Step 3/Progressive Maintenance Step 4 as per BCOS pillar structure. Responsible, with the support of the Plant Manager and Project Team, for producing the project and starting up a master plan with respective start-up targets/objectives, covering SC balanced scorecards across Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost, People and Environment. 
 In principle fully allocated to GF Site support, but expected to travel for global meetings and site support ‚Äì 10 to 30% 
 Typical deliverables for Brownfield projects and Greenfield start-ups are:
 zero LTA and compliance process safety/people safety standards 
 zero quality defects and Cpk (process capability) above 1 
 OEE +85% 
 compliance to schedule +90% 
 Net productivity +4% YOY 
 engagement survey +90% 
 energy/CO2 reduction 2 to 4% YOY 
About You

 Bachelor/Master degree required, preferably in Engineering 
 Advanced level of English 
 Clear ability to understand business needs, and develop and deploy a strategy to reach business goals 
 In-depth expertise in Continuous Improvement methodologies, such as TPS, TPM, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma and High-Performance Organization 
 Ability to work with ambiguity, breakthrough thinking, keep people accountable and direct others 
 Vast experience in the practical implementation of TPM, including the application of the Early Management Pillar 
 Experience in senior operations roles ‚Äì Site Engineer, Plant Management - is seen as a differential for this role 
 Places as highest priority the Safety of people, process and product 
 Demonstrated ability to influence and facilitate change across the whole organization 
 Strong working knowledge of Cultural and Management of Changes 
 Extensive software capability including Google Environment, Excel, Word, Minitab (or other statistical software) and MS Projects. Knowledge and experience in the use of SAP ERP systems are seen as desirable skills. 
 Exceptional coaching, communication, interpersonal & leadership skills 
 Minimum of 5 years of experience in Cultural and Management Changes, practitioner of Continuous Improvement methodology such as TPM, Lean Manufacturing essential (Six Sigma seen as a plus) 
 Experience in project management and governance systems 
 Strong influencing skills, and ability to direct the BCOS program without formal authority over organization leaders. 
 Experience in leading areas of Supply Chain, such as Manufacturing Operations, Planning, Logistic/Distribution and Procurement 
 Being capable of supporting make-or-buy studies and analysis for the construction of business cases (brownfield and/or greenfield) 

At Barry Callebaut, we are committed to Diversity & Inclusion. United by our strong values, we thrive on the diversity of who we are, where we come from, what we‚Äôve experienced and how we think. We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment where people can truly be themselves, grow to their full potential and feel they belong. #oneBC - Diverse People, Sustainable Growth.

job_title: Senior Executive, Consumer Insights (Senior Research Executive)
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Project & Client Management

Lead and manage end-to-end research projects, ensuring timely and accurate delivery
Develop comprehensive, insightful, and client-ready reports that meet high standards of quality
Uphold and enhance Customized Research methodologies in line with evolving client expectations and market dynamics
Drive client satisfaction by delivering actionable insights and strategic recommendations during project execution
Identify opportunities for new or enhanced services that address client business challenges
Translate client needs into tailored product solutions and strategic initiatives
Ensure all deliverables meet client specifications and NielsenIQ‚Äôs quality standards
Participate in client planning meetings, aligning NielsenIQ offerings with client objectives

Functional & Technical Expertise

Maintain up-to-date knowledge of research techniques, tools, and industry applications
Provide value-added analyses and respond to ad-hoc client requests with agility
Oversee and resolve data quality issues, managing the data inquiry process effectively

Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Business, Economics, or a related field
Minimum 3 years of experience in Market Research or Data Analysis with experience in BHT & U&A research
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and other relevant technologies
Fluent in English (spoken and written) 
Have experience in Marketing Research Agency is preferred
Highly detail-oriented with strong initiative and project management capabilities
Able to work effectively under pressure, manage time independently, and adapt to extended working hours when needed

Additional Information

Our Benefits

Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

job_title: Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Senior Executive
job_description:
About the job
Job Description

This position is for PaxOcean Group a Shipyard Company based in Batam, a company under Kuok Group Singapore.

Analyse the trends of key performance indicators (KPIs), especially relating to financial metrics such as revenue, expenses, and profit margin.
Monitor KPIs and identify the cause of any unexpected variances.
Develop and continually improve budgeting, financial projections, and operating forecasts.
Present the monthly financial reports of various business segment and departments.
Support the management team and department leaders with data-driven analysis.
Develop financial models and analyse them to support strategic initiatives.
Implement a business intelligence tool and dashboard reports.
Review finance peer's work for completeness and compliance with accounting standard.
Assist annual statutory audit, inventory count & liaise with external auditors on all audit matters.
Assist in tax audit, CITR review, document collection for audit, etc.
Assist in review of the finance standard operating procedure, internal accounting policy and internal control processes.
Ad-hoc business performance reporting.

Job Requirements

5+ years of experience and have general knowledge of accounting/financial/operational principles.
Proficient in English both written and spoken.
Strong Excel skills + SAP skills.
Interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact with various management levels.
High level of commitment to quality work product and organizational ethics, integrity, and compliance.
Comfortable navigating through grey areas without clear solutions.
Superior attention to detail and ability to successfully manage multiple competing priorities while
maintaining a view of the big picture.
Detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
Self-starter with good time management skills when urgent deadlines need to be met.

About the job
We are hiring for an innovative crypto wallet and payment network startup who are looking for a KOL Manager to help them with driving their influencer partnerships and elevate their brand through powerful voices across Twitter, YouTube, TikTok, Telegram, and beyond.

In This Role, You Will

Identify, initiate, and develop strategic partnerships with KOLs and influencers in the Web2 and Web3 industries.
Negotiate and secure collaboration agreements that align with the company‚Äôs strategic objectives and drive mutual growth.
Manage and nurture these partnerships to maximize their impact and ensure long-term success.
Develop and execute business development strategies to identify and capitalize on new opportunities within the Web2 and Web3 markets.
Build and maintain strong, trusted relationships with industry KOLs, influencers, and key stakeholders.
Leverage your network to promote the company‚Äôs products, services, and initiatives.
Facilitate introductions and connections between the company and potential business partners.
Work closely with the marketing, sales, and product teams to align business development efforts with overall company strategy.
Contribute to the development of marketing campaigns and promotional materials.
Provide feedback and insights to the product team to inform product development and improvement.

You Might Thrive In This Role If You Have

Proven experience in business development or a related role within the Web2 and Web3 industries.
Strong network of connections with KOLs and influencers in the Web2 and Web3 spaces.
Demonstrated success in developing and managing strategic partnerships.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
In-depth understanding of blockchain, cryptocurrency, and related technologies.
Strategic thinker with a proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (preferred).

About the job
ELVTR is a premier online education platform specializing in live courses led by industry experts from global companies such as Nike, Netflix, Google, and more. Since our establishment in 2020, we have grown from a small team to 140 talented members, delivering education to over 17,000 students worldwide. We are currently expanding our team in South Africa to support our growing presence and impact.

Position Overview:

ELVTR is on the hunt for a sharp, results-oriented Business Development Representative to help convert highly engaged leads into enthusiastic customers. You won't need to chase cold leads‚Äîyour job is to close warm prospects who've already scheduled their calls. If you're passionate about high-ticket sales and want to earn what you're worth, this role is for you.

This is a full-time, fully remote position open to candidates based in Indonesia.

This job is for you if you are:

A born closer who thrives under pressure and doesn't just meet targets‚Äîyou crush them
Strategic in your approach, with a deep understanding of buyer psychology
Self-directed and disciplined in a remote work setup
A collaborator who brings value to your team while owning your individual results

Responsibilities:

Convert warm, pre-qualified leads into enrolled students for our premium courses
Build rapport with prospects and identify how our programs align with their goals
Track your metrics and iterate fast to exceed conversion benchmarks
Maintain clean and detailed records in our CRM
Communicate customer insights to marketing and product teams for continuous improvement
Coordinate with internal departments to ensure a seamless customer journey

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field
Fluent, professional English communication skills
Strong grasp of CRM tools and digital sales platforms
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced environment and retain product knowledge quickly
Confidence, curiosity, and excellent listening skills
A history of high performance in quota-carrying roles is a strong plus

Benefits

High earning potential with competitive base pay + uncapped commissions and bonuses
Mental health coverage, fitness reimbursements, generous vacation policy, and access to all ELVTR courses
A performance-driven, supportive culture that celebrates wins and encourages growth. 

Why You Should Join ELVTR:

 You'll be part of something bigger. We're not just selling courses‚Äîwe're building a movement to raise the standard of online education. Every enrollment you drive helps someone take real steps toward career transformation
 We move fast, and you grow faster. ELVTR is scaling quickly, and we promote from within. If you bring results, you'll earn trust, autonomy, and opportunities‚Äîfast. You won't have to wait years to make your mark
 Work with sharp, driven people‚Äîevery single day. Our team is high-performing, tight-knit, and serious about impact. You'll never be the smartest person in the room, and that's a good thing

Join Us:

Do you have the drive and skill set to excel in a high-ticket sales environment? Are you ready to be part of a team as committed to closing deals as they are to transforming the landscape of online education? If so, apply now and elevate your career with ELVTR.

Due to the high volume of applications, we will only be able to respond to candidates with whom we are interested in moving forward. We appreciate your understanding and look forward to reviewing your application.

ELVTR is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.

About the job
A Legal and Permit Officer in the healthcare business plays a crucial role in ensuring that the organization complies with all legal and regulatory requirements. Here‚Äôs a detailed job description for this position:

Responsibilities:
1.Legal Compliance:
Ensure the organization adheres to all relevant laws, regulations, and standards.
Monitor changes in healthcare laws and regulations and update policies accordingly.
Provide legal advice and support on various matters, including contracts, compliance, and regulatory issues.

2.Permit Management:
Oversee the application, renewal, and compliance of all necessary permits and licenses.
Liaise with regulatory bodies to ensure timely submission and approval of permits.
Maintain accurate records of all permits and licenses.

3.Contract Management:
Draft, review, and negotiate contracts and agreements, including vendor contracts, client agreements, and partnership agreements
Ensure all contracts comply with legal and regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Law
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a legal or compliance role
Strong understanding of laws and regulations.
Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.

job_title: Travel Coordinator - Develop New Travel Package across Indonesia for our partner
job_description:
About the job
Work in office onsite in Surabaya - create Travel package (hotel, guide, place to visit & budgeting) for partners across the world.

Role Description
This full-time, on-site role based in Surabaya, Indonesia, focuses on developing and coordinating travel packages across Indonesia. The Travel Coordinator will be responsible for designing unique travel itineraries, arranging travel logistics, liaising with customers to ensure satisfaction, and managing relationships with various travel stakeholders. The role involves staying updated on market trends and consistently improving travel offerings to deliver exceptional experiences to clients.

Qualifications
Expertise in Travel Coordination, Travel Arrangements, and Travel Management
Strong skills in Customer Service and Communication
Ability to develop creative and diverse travel packages
Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities
Proficiency in relevant software or tools for travel planning
Familiarity with the Indonesian tourism industry is a strong advantage
A bachelor's degree in Tourism, Hospitality, Business, or a related field is preferred

Company Description
DMS Group operates across Europe, Oceania, and Southeast Asia, with a focus on diverse business ventures and investments aligned with its core operations. As of 2025, the company's Head Office has been relocated to Surabaya, Indonesia. DMS Group is dedicated to fostering innovation, global collaboration, and sustainable growth within its industries. Joining the team means becoming a part of a dynamic and connected global organization.

company_name: mGanik Group - PT Mganik Grup Mitra Indonesia
job_description:
About the job
Are you passionate about wellness, nutrition, and helping others live their healthiest lives? Do you love engaging with people and have a flair for educating others in a fun, approachable way? If yes, then lets talk.

We're on the lookout for a Nutritionist someone who's not just great with nutrition knowledge, but also great with people. This is a hybrid role: part educator, part product ambassador. Think of it as a Nutrition Consultant meets Sales Promotion Specialist.

What You'll Do:

About the job
Pustakawan bertugas mengelola koleksi dan fasilitas perpustakaan, mendukung literasi serta penelitian siswa, serta berkolaborasi dengan guru untuk menyediakan sumber belajar yang relevan dan menarik.
Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab Utama
1. Pemahaman Kurikulum dan Koleksi
Memahami filosofi dan kerangka kurikulum IB (PYP & MYP), termasuk Profil Pelajar, ATL, Tema Transdisipliner, dan Global Contexts.
Menyediakan dan mengelola koleksi literatur yang inklusif, multikultural, dan mendukung international-mindedness.
Memahami strategi penelitian dan konsep lintas disiplin untuk mendukung pembelajaran siswa.
2. Pengelolaan Perpustakaan
Menata dan memelihara koleksi buku, sumber daya, dan fasilitas perpustakaan agar ramah, menarik, dan mendukung kegiatan membaca serta penelitian.
Mengatur operasional harian, termasuk pencatatan peminjaman, pengembalian, dan penataan ruang.
Memantau kondisi fasilitas, melaporkan kebutuhan perbaikan, dan menjaga keselamatan lingkungan perpustakaan.
3. Dukungan Pembelajaran dan Literasi
Berkolaborasi dengan guru dan ICT Officer untuk menyediakan sumber daya sesuai kebutuhan unit pembelajaran.
Mengembangkan strategi untuk membantu siswa dalam literasi dan penelitian, termasuk intervensi atau pengayaan.
Membimbing siswa menemukan buku atau sumber daya yang tepat, memberikan dukungan penelitian, dan membacakan buku pada sesi perpustakaan.
4. Promosi dan Keterlibatan
Mempromosikan penggunaan perpustakaan melalui acara, dekorasi tematik, dan informasi koleksi baru.
Mengikuti tren literasi, mengidentifikasi materi pemenang penghargaan, dan mengembangkan program untuk meningkatkan minat baca.
Berpartisipasi dalam rapat perencanaan tim untuk mendukung unit inkuiri yang akan datang.
Kualifikasi, Pengalaman, dan Keterampilan :
S1 Ilmu Perpustakaan atau S1 Ilmu Informasi dan Perpustakaan
Lebih disukai jika memiliki pengalaman bekerja;
Memiliki pemahaman tentang Kurikulum IB dan Kurikulum Nasional;
Memiliki pengalaman sebagai Teacher Librarian di jenjang PYP dan MYP dan guru;
Memiliki pengetahuan tentang sistem klasifikasi dan katalogisasi buku;
Memiliki pengetahuan tentang sitasi dan plagiarism;
Memiliki pengetahuan tentang literasi informasi (information literacy) dan literasi media digital;
Mampu berkomunikasi dan berkolaborasi dengan baik dalam lingkungan sekolah;
Memiliki kemampuan Bahasa Inggris lebih disukai.

job_title: Partner Sales Manager - Lark, Indonesia - APAC
job_description:
About the job
Responsibilities
About the Team
We are the driving force behind Lark's expansion in the APAC market. Our focus is on helping businesses embrace digital transformation through our collaboration solutions, and we're dedicated to identifying and seizing market opportunities while acquiring new customers to foster growth.

As a Partner Sales Manager under our Sales team in Lark APAC, you will help to acquire and enable new partners, construct business plans, ensure partner success and foster mutually beneficial relationships in alignment with Lark APAC's business strategy.

Join us if you're ready to be a part of this exciting journey and to make a tangible impact on business growth!

- You will work on strategy planning with your partners. You will need to closely collaborate with your partners to develop and enhance their strategy in alignment with Lark's GTM approach. Ensuring they focus on the appropriate target audience and employ the correct methodology.
- You will collaborate with acquired partners to construct business plans that align with Lark's overall business strategy and objectives, while ensuring that partner plans contribute to mutual growth and success.
- You will be involved in enablement and monitoring the partners' sales: You will work closely with the partner enablement manager to monitor the progress of partners' sales and pitching capabilities, and determine if any actions or interventions are needed.
- You will be responsible for sourcing, outreaching, and qualifying potential partners in target markets from time to time, ensuring a robust pipeline of partners. You will also execute strategies to acquire partners that align with Lark's business objectives.
- You will act as a main point of contact for partner-related operational matters; supporting partner operations by addressing partner inquiries, providing necessary information, and ensuring smooth collaboration.
- You will act as the primary interface between Lark and Partners' marketing teams, fostering collaboration and alignment of marketing strategies. Work jointly on marketing initiatives that enhance the visibility and success of both parties.
- You will strive to grow partners' pipelines by actively monitoring pipeline performance and identifying areas of improvement

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- You fully understand how partners operate in a SaaS model. Your track record includes proven experience in channel partner management, business development, or sales, preferably in the technology industry.
- You are a strategic thinker. You possess the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and develop actionable insights to drive business growth.
- You are a results-driven achiever. You exhibit a results-oriented mindset with a track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and KPIs.
- You have a customer-focused mindset. You demonstrate strong commitment to customer satisfaction and partner success, with a focus on delivering value and driving long-term relationships. You have the ability to build rapport, negotiate effectively, and influence stakeholders at all levels.
- You thrive in a startup environment. You excel in the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
- Ideally, you come with some proven experience in successfully sourcing, reaching out to, and acquiring strategic partners in the APAC region.
- You have prior startup experience, showcasing your adaptability and an entrepreneurial mindset.
- You embrace willingness to travel as needed to meet with partners, attend industry events, and support business activities.

About Lark
Lark is the next-generation collaborative tools that boost organizations' efficiency, creativity, and engagement by integrating Messenger, Docs, Calendar, Video calls, Emails, and more into one easy-to-use app.


Why Join ByteDance
Inspiring creativity is at the core of ByteDance's mission. Our innovative products are built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect ‚Äì and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we work towards every day.
As ByteDancers, we strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our Company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.
Diversity & Inclusion
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About The Role

As a Data Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines and systems that support large-scale data processing. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement robust data architecture and ensure the integrity, efficiency, and scalability of our data solutions.

Job Descriptions

Develop and maintain efficient data pipelines and workflows to support data ingestion, transformation, and delivery.
Work closely with analysts, data scientists, and stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Design and implement scalable data solutions and architectures, especially within data warehouse environments.
Optimize SQL queries and develop Python-based scripts for robust data processing.
Contribute to data modeling efforts for analytics and business intelligence.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve the performance of data pipelines.
Support integration with cloud-based platforms such as Alicloud, GCP, or AWS.

Requirements

A Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
Must have at least 2 years of experience in Data Engineering or a related role.
Strong understanding of Data Engineering principles and data architecture.
Hands-on experience in implementing data solutions in data pipeline and/or data warehouse architectures, including data ingestion and workflow scheduling.
Proficient in SQL and Python for data processing tasks.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business needs into scalable solutions.
Knowledge of data modeling in Data Warehouses is highly preferred.
Prior experience with cloud platforms such as Alicloud, GCP, or AWS is a plus.
Familiarity with Machine Learning Engineering is a nice-to-have.

job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires the candidate to work in Jakarta, Indonesia. 

Client Overview

Our client is a registered multifinance company operating under its own legal entity, focused on expanding financial inclusion through accessible and practical financing solutions. The company provides a range of financial products and services designed to make it easier for individuals to meet their everyday needs, particularly in the areas of consumer electronics and household goods.

Specializing in consumer financing and retail partnerships, the company serves customers who may have limited access to traditional banking or credit facilities. Its offerings are tailored to young adults and families seeking convenient financing options to enhance their quality of life, reflecting the company‚Äôs commitment to affordability, accessibility, and customer empowerment in the financial services sector.

Job Role

The Training Manager will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing training programs for the consumer finance sector, with the goal of enhancing employees‚Äô professional knowledge, sales capabilities, and business skills.

This role will also lead a training team, collaborate with cross-functional departments, and ensure that training initiatives are aligned with the company‚Äôs strategic goals. The Training Manager will report to senior management and be based in Jakarta, with regular business travel to branches and customer sites.

Key Responsibilities

Course Development & Design

Strong communication, coordination, and presentation skills.
Logical thinker with problem-solving abilities, capable of designing targeted training programs.

Mobility:
Based in Jakarta with frequent travel to branches or client sites.
Flexible to work overtime or travel according to project schedules.

Training, Leadership Training, Communication Skills, Teaching

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering with at least 10 years of experience in Engineering and EHS within a manufacturing environment. 
Strong knowledge of GMP and EH&S compliance, including incident management and environmental controls. 
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships across the organization. Ability to influence and negotiate at senior leadership levels. 
Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire teams towards achieving strategic goals. 
Skills in developing direct reports, fostering growth and development within the team. 
Experience in financial performance management, including budgeting and cost control. 
Expertise in developing and implementing strategic business plans. 
Exceptional problem-solving skills and ability to address complex challenges. 
Ability to drive operational excellence and functional improvements across the organization. 

Bonus Points If You Have (Preferred Requirements)

A Master‚Äôs degree with relevant pharmaceutical experience
Experience in fostering an inclusive and collaborative work environment. 
Strategic thinking and ability to anticipate and address emerging business issues. 
Expertise in leveraging technology for business transformation. 
Experience in strategic advisory roles, providing insights and guidance on key initiatives.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. About the job
Are you an experienced Yoruba language professional eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple chatbots into powerful engines of learning, communication, and cultural understanding. With high-quality training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can deliver more natural, accurate, and contextually rich Yoruba experiences across education, accessibility, and global communication. That training data begins with you‚Äîyour expertise will help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled Yoruba language specialist who can bring linguistic depth, cultural context, and precision to training data. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine Yoruba text outputs, and provide expert feedback on grammar, syntax, semantics, style, and cultural appropriateness to strengthen model performance.

On a typical day, you will review and annotate Yoruba content, assess AI-generated outputs for accuracy and fluency, identify and document error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and linguistic guidelines.

Fluency in Yoruba is required, along with demonstrated experience in translation, linguistics, language teaching, editing, or related professional work. Experience in training, coaching, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Clear communication skills, cultural knowledge, and attention to detail are essential.

Ready to channel your Yoruba expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help shape the model that will support millions of Yoruba speakers worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

About the job
At OPIS, a leading international Clinical Research Organization (CRO), we are seeking a "hungry for success" Business Development Associate who will help expand our global client network across the life sciences sector focusing on APAC region.

High school diploma or a degree
1 - 3 years of experience in sales (BDR, SDR, recruitment, etc.).
Native/fluent Chinese and/or Japanese and English with strong communication skills.
Excellent organizational and planning abilities.
Proactive, team-oriented, and results-driven mindset.
Eagerness to grow.

Who we are:
 OPIS is an International CRO with over 25 years of experience in conducting Phase I-IV, non-interventional and medical devices studies on an international level. We always offer state-of-the-art information technology solutions and innovative approaches to the increasing complexity and variety of projects.

job_title: IP Datacom Product Manager - ICT Company
job_description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires candidate to work in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Client Overview

Our client is a leading global provider of ICT infrastructure and smart devices, the world's largest supplier of telecommunications network equipment, and the second-biggest maker of smartphones, established in 1987, and headquartered in China. It has grown to become the world‚Äôs largest supplier of telecommunications equipment and a major innovator in 5G, cloud computing, AI, and consumer electronics, with over 207,000 employees worldwide, and operates in more than 170 countries and regions. In Indonesia, it is playing a pivotal role in the country‚Äôs digital transformation through partnerships with governments, telcos, enterprises, education institutions, and other industry segments.

Job Role

The IP Datacom Product Manager leads the promotion and pre-sales support of the company's enterprise networking and IP solutions for carrier customers in Indonesia. This role acts as the bridge between sales and technical teams, helping design tailored solutions that match customer needs while actively supporting lead generation and deal closure.

The Product Manager is responsible for presenting the company's routers, switches, firewalls, and SD-WAN offerings, engaging directly with operators and channel partners, and providing competitive insight and solution strategy. The role also involves analyzing customer networks, crafting proposals, and tracking market and competitor trends to enhance the company's positioning. Success in this role requires strong technical knowledge of IP networking, experience in customer-facing solution selling, and the ability to drive both technical and commercial discussions to win strategic network infrastructure projects.

Key Responsibilities

Pre Sales and Customer Engagement
Promote the Datacom solutions (routers, switches, firewalls, SD-WAN) to carrier customers in Indonesia.
Conduct technical product presentations and support sales engagements to increase customer awareness and solution adoption.
Build and maintain strong client relationships across technical and business teams, including direct coordination with customer planning and network departments.
Sales and Revenue Contribution
Actively engage customers and generate leads, not relying solely on sales teams for account entry.
Share revenue and sales target responsibilities with the commercial team, supporting deal structuring, pricing strategy, and opportunity closure.
Provide input for commercial and project planning based on solution fit, competition, and partner dynamics.
Strategic Market Development
Define and develop the market direction, tactics, and growth roadmap for the IP Datacom business over a 2‚Äì3 year horizon.
Specify resource and investment needs (e.g., manpower, partner enablement, marketing) to support business goals.
Support branding efforts, attend industry forums, and promote the presence in the IP networking space.
Market Insight & Competitive Positioning
Track and analyze competitor offerings (e.g., Cisco, Juniper, Nokia) and develop differentiated solution strategies to position the advantageously in bids and projects.
Tailor solutions to project scenarios, industry needs, and customer architecture with customized and scenario-based approaches.
Internal Collaboration
Provide knowledge transfer and product training to internal sales teams and partners to enhance field readiness.
Work with technical departments to align on solution feasibility, design implementation, and project support.

Candidate Requirements

Education: At least a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or other ICT-related disciplines.
Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in product management, solution sales, or pre-sales roles within the ICT or telecommunication industry, particularly in the Network Infrastructure or Data Communication, including routers, switches, firewalls, SD-WAN.
Industry Expertise: Strong understanding of carrier network architecture and enterprise network deployments.
Product and Customer Expertise:
Proven experience in selling or supporting routers, switches, firewalls, and SD-WAN solutions.
Familiar with key network protocols (IGP, BGP, MPLS, SR/SRv6, L2VPN, L3VPN) and carrier-grade networking environments.
Knowledge of customer network compositions and preferences, with an understanding of competitors‚Äô strengths and weaknesses (e.g., Cisco, Juniper, Nokia).
Technical Expertise:
Strong capability in solution design, opportunity strategy, and project operation.
Skilled in lead generation, opportunity conversion, and managing full sales and implementation cycles.
Language: Fluency in English, both written and spoken. Mandarin proficiency is a plus.
Professional Qualities:
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Self-motivated, adaptable, results-driven, and confident working across cultures and technical teams.

Job Code: #371

Desired Skills and Experience
Sales Strategy, English Language, Sales and Marketing, Pre-Sales Consultation, Product Development, Product Analysis, Product Design, Business Strategy, Solution Architecture

About the job
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

Procurement Governance & Intelligence (G&I) at Grab plays a crucial role in Procurement as they are responsible for Procurement policy, Procurement processes and procurement platform at Grab globally. The Procurement G&I team work on different projects and deliverables, some of which are short-term, medium-term, and long-term. These projects aim to simplify processes, improve reporting,maintaining the policy and process design and improvements, authoring SOPs, platform enhancement, and new systems assessment and testing.

Get to Know the Role

The Manager, Governance Strategy & Risk is a strategic enabler within the Procurement Governance & Intelligence (G&I) team, focused on shaping and embedding the Source to Contract governance, risk, and ESG agenda across Grab's Procurement function. You will translate Procurement strategy into workable standards, policies, and playbooks, and ensures that risk and sustainability considerations are integrated into day-to-day procurement operations.

You will report to and work with the Head of Procurement G&I to design frameworks, process, oversee supplier risk management, and act as a deputy on governance matters. You will complement the Procurement Business Process & Systems PIC by focusing on policy and risk content while ensuring these are operationalized in Oracle Procurement and third party risk management workflows.

This role is onsite, with regional scope across all Grab entities.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

Policy & Playbook Development: Lead creation and updates of procurement policies, playbooks, and decision frameworks to support Category strategies.
System Integration: Co-design rule sets in Oracle tools (Sourcing, TPRM, Contracting) to align with procurement policies.
Risk & ESG Frameworks: Develop supplier segmentation and risk models, ESG onboarding requirements, and standard contract clauses with Legal and Sustainability.
Governance & Compliance Monitoring: Manage governance dashboards and serve as the primary contact for policy queries and exception handling.
Change Management & Training: Drive training, content refresh, and stakeholder enablement for new policies, systems, and processes.
Performance Insights & Communication: Publish governance updates, adoption surveys, and performance insights to improve compliance and cycle times.
Strategic & Leadership Support: Act as deputy to the Head of Pro

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

At least 10 years of Procurement experience, with strong exposure to policy design, governance, supplier risk management, or ESG integration.
Proven experience in authoring procurement SOPs/policies/playbooks within multinational or matrixed organizations.
Fluency in procurement systems (Oracle or equivalents) and ability to co-design workflows that embed governance rules.
Experience engaging with AI tools and emerging technologies to enhance productivity, improve workflows, and contribute new ideas.
Strong stakeholder management skills, able to advise senior business leaders, auditors, and external stakeholders with confidence.
Analytical mindset with ability to interpret data and create actionable insights from dashboards and compliance reports.
Team player who can collaborate across Procurement G&I, Category Heads, Finance, Legal, and Audit teams.
Prior experience as a Strategic Sourcing or Procurement Category Manager practitioner or in Procurement Transformation & Change Management are big advantage

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:

We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
Balance personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that provides equal opportunity for Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. We consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, race, religion, age, gender, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

Solid knowledge of the crypto/financial markets, with familiarity in derivatives (futures, options), market making, and API trading models.
Strong negotiation, communication, and relationship management skills, with a collaborative and client-first approach.
Fluency in English for professional use. Additional languages such as Japanese, Korean, or Russian are an advantage.
Target-driven, resilient, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Preferred Qualifications

Successful track record in acquiring or managing top-tier market makers, funds, or brokerages.
Familiarity with institutional trading solutions such as sub-accounts, preferential fee structures, and dedicated account managers.
International background or overseas work experience.

What‚Äôs Offered

Competitive compensation package with performance bonuses.
Access to leading industry resources and direct exposure to top institutional clients.
Clear career progression and professional growth opportunities.
Flexible and international work environment.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. job_title: STEM Specialist (Fluent in Vietnamese) - AI Trainer
job_description:
About the job
Are you an experienced STEM professional fluent in Vietnamese and eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple chatbots into powerful engines of research, education, and applied problem-solving. With high-quality training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can provide more accurate, practical, and innovative solutions across science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. That training data begins with you‚Äîyour expertise will help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled STEM specialist fluent in Vietnamese who can bring subject matter expertise, linguistic precision, and cultural context to training data. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine outputs, and provide expert feedback on complex STEM concepts, problem-solving approaches, and terminology in both English and Vietnamese to strengthen model performance.

On a typical day, you will review and annotate AI-generated content, assess responses for technical accuracy and clarity, identify and document error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and domain-specific guidelines.

Fluency in Vietnamese is required, along with demonstrated expertise in a STEM field (science, technology, engineering, or mathematics) through teaching, research, or applied practice. Experience in translation, bilingual education, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Strong communication skills, analytical ability, and attention to detail are essential.

Ready to channel your STEM and Vietnamese expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help train the model that will support learners and professionals worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

Job title: STEM Specialist (Fluent in Vietnamese) ‚Äì AI Trainer

Employment type: Contract

Workplace type: Remote

Seniority level: Mid-Senior

About the job
Company Description

Raffles Hotels & Resorts

The Birthplace of stories and legends since 1887, Raffles is a legendary brand, steeped in history and loved by generations past, present and future.

Representing the pinnacle of ultra-luxury hospitality within Accor Group, Raffles is currently going through exciting phases of rebirth and expansion.

Raffles, at distinguished landmark addresses around the world, is the vibrant heart of its destination, curating experiences that are culturally enriching, intellectually stimulating and always respectful of local communities, heritage and the environment. Its timeless elegance, refined manners and spirit of generosity ensure that every visitor arrives as a guest, leaves as a friend and returns as family.

Raffles is progressively shaping the future of luxury hospitality, focusing on employee journey and growth.

Job Description

You will embody the essence of luxury hospitality. Your dynamic and hands-on approach is fueled by a deep passion for developing people and fostering an entrepreneurial spirit. A true brand and guest ambassador, you will challenge conventions, consistently seek solutions, and infuse innovation into every facet of the hotel experience and every function of the business.

Your seasoned leadership style will blend diplomacy with relationship-building prowess, cultivating strong connections with both internal and external stakeholders, including Owners and the Community. Your ability to engage with ownership and strategize revenue enhancements will be coupled with an innate talent for envisioning the hotel's long-term trajectory.

A refined sense of finance and business acumen will be at the core of your decision-making, grounded in an unwavering commitment to delivering a world-class product and service. By seamlessly weaving local heritage and culture into our offerings, you will not only create an authentic guest experience but also drive excellence across all dimensions of our operations.

In your role as a catalyst for exceptional service, you will uphold the highest standards, infusing every interaction with the kind of genuine care that leaves an indelible mark on our guests. Nurturing an environment of continuous growth and skill development, you will inspire our colleagues to consistently exceed expectations, turning moments into memories for every visitor.

As a visionary leader, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our strategic direction. Your involvement in goal setting and objective communication will propel business growth and solidify the hotel‚Äôs reputation as a distinguished luxury destination. Your ability to foster positive relationships with ownership will ensure a harmonious partnership that aligns with our overarching strategy while enhancing the hotel's performance and prestige.

Your leadership will be synonymous with setting industry benchmarks and redefining luxury hospitality. Your commitment to excellence, coupled with your innovative approach, will leave an enduring mark on our iconic brand and create a legacy of unparalleled guest memories.

Key Behaviours And Responsibilities

Act with an open mindset:

Embrace innovative ideas, adapt to change, and encourage a culture of innovation and continuous learning.

Demonstrate explicit knowledge and awareness of company standards as an integral role model.

Build quality relationships with the management team.

Create an environment that encourages innovation, challenges traditional thinking, and fosters a "speak-up" culture.

Create positive impact working with others:

Foster an inclusive and collaborative work environment, empowering colleagues to contribute their best and building strong relationships based on trust and respect.

Create a collaborative and inclusive environment where all colleagues are encouraged to provide input.

Actively listen to team members' ideas, concerns, and feedback and incorporate their input into decision-making processes.

Recognize and appreciate the contributions and well-being of colleagues.

Strive for guest/client satisfaction:

Exhibits a deep understanding of the luxury hospitality landscape and guest expectations, ensuring that the guest experience consistently exceeds industry standards.

Maintain product and service quality standards by conducting ongoing evaluations.

Handle VIP Guests and understand international protocols for government officials and royalty.

Monitor guest/client feedback, address concerns promptly, and implement improvements to optimize satisfaction.

 Consistently deliver excellence:

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of ownership group's investment objectives and formulates strategic business plans that align with those objectives; ensuring preservation and maximization of the hotel‚Äôs assets.

Set high performance standards, lead by example, and drive a culture of continuous improvement and quality across all the hotel.

Exhibits expertise in sales, marketing, and revenue management, driving the hotel's performance in the luxury hospitality market.

Maximize financial performance, control costs, and execute marketing and operational activities that produce results meeting or exceeding the hotel's business plan.

Recognize and reward outstanding performance and celebrate achievements within the organization.

 Enable team success:

Support the professional growth and development of colleagues through coaching, mentoring, and providing opportunities for learning.

Encourage individuals to take on challenging assignments and stretch their capabilities.

Provide regular feedback and guidance, recognizing achievements and offering constructive suggestions for improvement.

Create a safe and empowering environment where individuals feel comfortable taking risks, expressing their ideas, and learning from failures.

As applicable, brings experience in working with labor unions, maintaining constructive relationships and ensuring harmonious teamwork.

 Create clarity:

About the job
Are you an experienced Zulu language professional eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple chatbots into powerful engines of learning, communication, and cultural understanding. With high-quality training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can deliver more natural, accurate, and contextually rich Zulu experiences across education, accessibility, and global communication. That training data begins with you‚Äîyour expertise will help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled Zulu language specialist who can bring linguistic depth, cultural context, and precision to training data. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine Zulu text outputs, and provide expert feedback on grammar, syntax, semantics, style, and cultural appropriateness to strengthen model performance.

On a typical day, you will review and annotate Zulu content, assess AI-generated outputs for accuracy and fluency, identify and document error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and linguistic guidelines.

Fluency in Zulu is required, along with demonstrated experience in translation, linguistics, language teaching, editing, or related professional work. Experience in training, coaching, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Clear communication skills, cultural knowledge, and attention to detail are essential.

Ready to channel your Zulu expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help shape the model that will support millions of Zulu speakers worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

Client Overview

Our client is a growing sports and lifestyle brand dedicated to promoting the fast-rising sport of padel in Indonesia. Located in the vibrant neighborhood of Kemang, South Jakarta, King Padel provides premium padel courts and an engaging community atmosphere for both seasoned athletes and newcomers alike. Established in 2017, this location represents one of the first dedicated padel clubs in Indonesia.

With a vision to establish itself as a hub for padel enthusiasts and lifestyle seekers, it blends high-quality facilities with social experiences, from member tournaments and coaching sessions to lifestyle events and partnerships with leading wellness and fitness brands. About the job
Company Description

About Grab and Our Workplace

Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.

Job Description

Get to Know the Team

Join the Grab ACE team, where we are committed to developing the most reliable and beloved food platform in Southeast Asia. As an engineer at Grab, you become a necessary part of our core. Our enthusiasm is rooted in our work, and we take pride in creating exceptional services and tools that cater to hundreds of millions of consumers, delivery partners, and fellow Grabbers. We focus on enhancing our delivery and dine-in platforms.

Get to Know the Role

You will report into the Software Engineering Manager and you will work on the Android passenger app that benefits millions of consumers every day. Awaiting you are exhilarating product ideas and engrossing engineering challenges, where you will be one of the first to experience your own work within the Grab app! This role is based in Beijing.

The Critical Tasks You Will Perform

As Senior Software Engineer, Android you are expected to work on both product development and engineering improvements.

Work with the product and design team to understand requirements, provide product feedback, own and implement the product from start to finish.
Create and participate in technical discussions with other engineering teams
Write code that is reusable, scalable and testable. Make sure products are delivered on time and with high quality.
Collaborate with QAs to make sure our app releases are always worthy of five star ratings.
Review code from other team members, provide constructive feedback and aim to raise the engineering bar.
Improve the codebase. Propose and set better engineering solutions for the team.
Be responsible and responsive during on-call duty. Debug and troubleshoot production issues.
Provide technical guidance, mentorship and knowledge sharing to peers.

Qualifications

What Essential Skills You Will Need

A degree in computer science, software engineering or related fields with 5+ years of working experience on mobile application development
Programming experience in Java or Kotlin, familiarity with design patterns, multi-threading, and good coding style and habits.
Understanding of the Android system and programming paradigm including OOP, TDD, reactive patterns, and dependency injection.
Working knowledge of several architectural approaches including clean architecture, MVP, and MVVM.
Experience in Android automated testing, familiarity with Android testing frameworks like Espresso, UI Automator, Mockito, Powermock, or Appium.
Fluent in English, with a conscientious, and teamwork, and a positive and optimistic outlook.

Additional Information

Life at Grab

We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours

What We Stand For At Grab

We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that provides equal opportunity for Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. We consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, race, religion, age, gender, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.

About the job
Are you an experienced Umbundu language professional eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple chatbots into powerful engines of learning, communication, and cultural understanding. With high-quality training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can deliver more natural, accurate, and contextually rich Umbundu experiences across education, accessibility, and global communication. That training data begins with you‚Äîyour expertise will help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled Umbundu language specialist who can bring linguistic depth, cultural context, and precision to training data. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine Umbundu text outputs, and provide expert feedback on grammar, syntax, semantics, style, and cultural appropriateness to strengthen model performance.

On a typical day, you will review and annotate Umbundu content, assess AI-generated outputs for accuracy and fluency, identify and document error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and linguistic guidelines.

Fluency in Umbundu is required, along with demonstrated experience in translation, linguistics, language teaching, editing, or related professional work. Experience in training, coaching, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Clear communication skills, cultural knowledge, and attention to detail are essential.

Ready to channel your Umbundu expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help shape the model that will support millions of Umbundu speakers worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

Job title: Umbundu Language Specialist ‚Äì AI Trainer

Employment type: Contract

Workplace type: Remote

Seniority level: Mid-Senior

Client Overview

Our client is a global leader in materials science and innovative self-adhesive solutions for consumer products and labels, with a focus on apparel, footwear, and retail industries. Established in 1935, the company pioneered pressure-sensitive stickers and has since expanded to operate in over 50 countries across six continents, delivering creative and sustainable solutions including graphic tickets, tags, labels, embellishments, and packaging solutions.

In Indonesia, the company serves a wide range of customers in apparel, footwear, home textiles, and sports goods sectors. Its manufacturing sites act as strategic hubs to support exporters across the country, ensuring high-quality products and efficient production to meet both domestic and international demand.

Job Role

The Production Manager will lead daily production operations while ensuring operational excellence, people development, and continuous improvement in a fast-paced, multinational manufacturing environment. Reporting to the Head of Operations, this role is responsible for driving productivity, efficiency, and safety across the production floor.

This position involves managing multi-shift teams, allocating resources effectively, and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to achieve production, cost, quality, and compliance targets. Success requires strong technical expertise combined with the ability to lead, influence, and align teams with organizational goals.

Key Responsibilities

Build, develop, and lead a high-performing production team, fostering accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Ensure operational excellence across multi-shift production: safety, quality, on-time delivery, and cost-effectiveness.
Set performance KPIs, monitor progress, and optimize workflow with planning, quality, and supply chain teams.
Drive process improvements using Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma, and efficiency frameworks; implement automation and standardization to improve productivity and reduce waste.
Oversee preventive and corrective maintenance programs for production machinery.
Enforce health, safety, and compliance standards across all production activities.
Provide strategic reporting and operational analysis to senior management for longterm planning and improvements.

Candidate Requirements

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Mechanical, Industrial, or related Engineering fields.
Experience: 7‚Äì10 years in manufacturing, including at least 5 years in production leadership roles in multinational or complex manufacturing environments.
Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with labels, packaging, adhesives, garment, or apparel manufacturing.
Technical Skills: Lean Manufacturing, Continuous Flow, TPM, OEE, Six Sigma, and continuous improvement frameworks; ability to link operational performance to financial outcomes.
Leadership & Management: Proven ability to lead large-scale production teams, drive cultural change, and influence both shop-floor operators and senior management.
Operational Excellence: Demonstrated success in delivering OEE, yield, lead time, cost efficiency, and strategic improvements like lean transformation, automation, and capability building.
Languages: Professional proficiency in English for communication with regional/global teams and leadership.
Personal Qualities: Strategic mindset with hands-on leadership, strong interpersonal, organizational, and project management skills; proactive, resilient, and results-oriented.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. About the job
Are you fluent in Bulgarian, English, and at least one additional language, and eager to apply your linguistic expertise to the future of AI? Large-scale language models are transforming how people communicate, learn, and access information across cultures. With high-quality multilingual training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can better serve global communities with accuracy, nuance, and inclusivity. That training data begins with you.

We‚Äôre looking for a Bulgarian Trilingual Language Specialist who can bring deep linguistic knowledge, cultural awareness, and multilingual proficiency to AI training. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools to evaluate, annotate, and refine model outputs in Bulgarian, English, and your third language, helping improve cross-lingual reasoning, translation quality, and naturalness.

On a typical day, you will review AI-generated text for grammatical accuracy, idiomatic expression, and cultural appropriateness; annotate and correct linguistic errors; assess multilingual translations for clarity and fidelity; and collaborate with our team to strengthen evaluation protocols and language-specific guidelines.

Fluency in Bulgarian and English, plus proficiency in at least one additional language, is required. Prior experience in translation, linguistics, content evaluation, or AI training is strongly preferred. Clear communication skills, attention to detail, and the ability to articulate linguistic nuances across languages are essential.

Ready to apply your multilingual expertise to shape the AI of tomorrow? Apply today and help build tools that will empower communication for people worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $6 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and reliable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

job_title: Cluster Project Design Mechanical Engineer, Fleet Remediation Engineering
job_description:
About the job
Description

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we‚Äôre the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain ‚Äî and we‚Äôre looking for talented people who want to help.

You‚Äôll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You‚Äôll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you‚Äôll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

We have an immediate opening for a Project Design Mechanical Engineer in Indonesia Cluster. If you meet these qualifications, exude passion, and enjoy the challenge of innovative projects at hyper-scale, this job is for you!

As An Amazon Fleet Remediation Project Design Mechanical Engineer, You Will Lead Design Projects In Operational Data Centers, That Remediate Issues, Upgrade Our Existing Infrastructure Or Add New Services. You Will Be The 'go To' Engineering Resource For These Projects And Will Provide Lifecycle Support From Design Through Implementation. You Will Use Your (mechanical Or Electrical) Expertise To

 Own the design for existing data center upgrades and design-solutions which add data center infrastructure, capacity, improve availability, and/or increase sustainability
 Perform design and equipment submittal review for Data Centers in your region
 Interface with internal and external data center design engineering team, server hardware team, environmental health and safety team, field engineering, and controls engineering to promote standards that maintain consistency and reliability in services delivered
 Work on concurrent projects, sometimes in multiple geographical regions
 Act as a technical subject matter expert for your given discipline during new remediation projects
 Support construction, commissioning, operations, and turnover

Key job responsibilities

Amazon's vision is to be the world's most customer-centric company, and this role is key to that vision. As a Fleet Remediation Project Design Mechanical Engineer, you will be leading projects to fit out our data centers to meet ever-evolving customer needs as we continue expanding our fleet to hyper-scale.

As An Ideal Candidate You

 Possess Strong Engineering Judgement and are able to provide design and recommendations despite uncertainty
 Are detail and data oriented with familiarity with design/construction processes
 Have experience managing engineering projects and engineering consultants.
 Build trust and relationships with different stakeholders (e.g., Operations, Commissioning, Construction and Design)
 Manage design and as built drawings and documents
 Prepare and present progress reports to all relevant stakeholders
 Be inclined to get into the field to see things up close

A day in the life

Each day you will interact with different teams responsible for all aspects of the data centers. You will prioritize your activities to support data center safety, remediation projects, capacity, and availability, focusing on the actions that are most impactful. You will have the opportunity to work on projects locally and globally.

About The Team

Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique.
