About the job
Your Role

As Assistant Manager ‚Äì Commercial Finance, you will be the finance lead for all DME (Direct Marketing Expense) processes and governance, ensuring budget efficiency, investment effectiveness, and full compliance. You will partner directly with Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain, Strategic Partner, and Others Finance teams to deliver insights, challenge assumptions, and enable smarter decisions through data. This role is more than managing numbers, you will lead the analysis behind marketing investments, ensure every spend delivers value, and help shape smarter decisions across the business. By connecting data, systems, and teams, your work will directly influence how we grow.

Key Accountabilities

Lead annual and rolling DME budgeting in Finance across system, including setup, monthly phasing, reclass, carryover, and reconciliation.
Manage DME closing cycles: accrual, realization, system alignment, and variance analysis.
Ensure consistent financial accuracy and visibility of DME by channel, sub-channel, and brand.
Drive Return on Marketing Investment analysis to evaluate campaign performance and advise commercial teams.
Provide forward-looking insights to optimize spending across Modern Trade and General Trade channels, and marketing support mix.
Oversee full DME lifecycle management including alignment with Finance, Marketing, Commercial and Others Strategic Partner teams.
Support New Product Development financial readiness: value chain calculation and setup, and system gate reviews.
Lead preparation for SOX compliance, Balance Sheet Reconciliation, external audits, and internal control validations.
Contribute to finance capability-building, including training material for project teams and internal learning forums.

Who You Are

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, or Business.
Minimum 4 years in Commercial Finance, or Marketing Finance roles‚Äîideally in FMCG or multinational environments.
Proven experience managing marketing budgets, financial systems, and analysis tools.
Strong business acumen with excellent stakeholder management skills.
High attention to detail, ownership mindset, and comfort operating under complexity.

About the job
Company Overview

 Nikkiso Clean Energy & Industrial Gases  is a leading provider of cryogenic pumps, heat exchangers, process systems, services, and solutions for the LNG and industrial gases industry. We are a subsidiary of Nikkiso Company Ltd, a leading industrial manufacturer headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, with over $1.5B in annual revenue, 8000 + employees worldwide, and publicly traded on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

Nikkiso Cryogenic Services (NCS) is an industry leader in the provision of services to the industrial gas and air separation industries, enhanced oil recovery operations, marine, clean energy, and alternative fuels markets. Boasting a vast portfolio of innovative solutions, cutting-edge technology, and expert services, the company stands tall as a go-to service provider for a wide range of clients. The company has carved a niche for itself in the market with its consistent delivery of top-tier services that are tailored to meet the specific needs of each industry. Our products have been instrumental in enabling customers to realize safer, greener, and more sustainable operations. From liquefied natural gas (LNG) systems to industrial gas equipment, every product is designed and manufactured with the utmost consideration for safety and environmental sustainability.

Nikkiso Cryogenic Services is not just a leading service provider to a range of industries, but also a champion of safer, greener operations. Its products and services are designed to meet the dual objectives of operational efficiency and sustainability, helping clients achieve their goals while minimizing environmental impact.

Job Overview

The objective of this position is to perform aftermarket sales for cryogenic pump and turbo expander aftersales solutions. We are looking for a self-driven, motivated sales engineer with multiple years of experience in aftersales for cryogenic applications. A combination of product knowledge and business knowledge will be required to execute this mission. The successful candidate will be part of a growth journey doubling our aftermarket business over the next few years and will have a significant influence on future aftermarket sales development

Responsibilities

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Follow up customers‚Äô inquiries and technical request, understand technical specification, and prepare commercial quotations. 
 Work with the Regional Sales Manager to create a business development plan. 
 Provide and achieve targets to grow the Service Business unit to maximize volume and profitability. 
 Promote and sell the NCS aftermarket products, including Service Agreements, Repairs, Field Services and Upgrades as offered to all existing and new customers. 
 Be responsible for the maintenance and growth of the Service Contract business for all product groups of the CEIG Group in the assigned sales territory. 
 Evaluate needs and negotiate contracts directly with key accounts or indirectly with 3rd Party Service Providers subject to designation of authority. 
 Develop existing and build new customer relationships ensuring Nikkiso is seen as a long-term business partner. 
 Aid prime equipment sales by maintaining and developing effective, working customer relationships via valued service products. 
 Develop proposal for aftermarket sales campaigns for specific service products and markets/customers and align campaigns with the BLM, PLM and Business Development Manager leadership before execution. 
 Monitor changes and developments within the industry and report to management. 
 Promote all NCEIG product portfolio, follow-up and share sales leads internally. 
 Document activities in our CRM program, Salesforce. 
 Other duties as assigned. 

Qualifications

 Competencies 

The successful candidate will possess a unique blend of educational qualifications, sales skills, leadership experience, and personal attributes that ensure the individual is well-equipped to understand the complexities of business development across different cultures and regions.

Sales Skills: Proficient in sales techniques, negotiation, and strategies. Ability to effectively close deals.
Leadership: Strong leadership abilities. Ability to set goals, delegate tasks, and evaluate performance.
Communication: Communicate effectively through exceptional written, verbal, and listening skills in order to interact with clients, team members, and senior management. Ability to deliver persuasive presentations and articulate sales strategies.
Relationship Building: Proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with clients, stakeholders, and business partners. Capable of networking to expand business opportunities.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities to assess market trends, competitor activities, and sales data to drive informed decision-making. Proficiency in using sales analytics tools and CRM systems.
Strategic Mindset: Ability to develop and execute tailored sales strategies and plans to achieve organizational goals. Capable of analyzing market opportunities, identifying target segments, and formulating effective plans.
Problem-Solving: Exceptional problem-solving abilities to address customer concerns, market challenges, and team dynamics. Capability to think critically and propose creative solutions.
Product Knowledge: In-depth knowledge of the company's products/services and ability to effectively communicate their features, benefits, and value propositions to customers.
Industry Knowledge: Broad knowledge of the industry, market trends, and competitor landscape. Ability to stay updated on industry news and changes that may impact sales strategies.
 Ability to speak read and write English multi-lingual ability desirable. 
 Ability to travel globally. 

 Work Environment 

Job will generally be performed in an office environment but may require extensive international travel to a client's office, production facility, or industrial/construction job site.
 Conditions will vary at each location, but the conditions listed above will generally apply. 

Education And Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, marketing, or a related field.
A master's degree in business administration is preferred but not essential.
At least 10 years of progressive sales experience in a similar industry or related field.
Proven track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
Experience in managing and leading a sales team.
Familiarity with various sales techniques and methodologies.

 Physical Demands 

Stand, walk, sit, talk, hear, type, and write.
Reach with hands and arms, bend, stand on a stool or climb, and use fingers and hands to feel objects, tools, or controls.
Use standard office equipment such as computers, smart phones, printers, photocopiers, etc.
Lift files and open desk drawers and filing cabinets.
Global travel.

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

About the job
Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world's most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunity to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting?

Then come in and join us as the Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Application Specialist to actively engage customers in the post-sales process as well as effectively coordinating and managing the customer experience throughout the lifecycle of their Siemens system. 

Your Role:

You will provide clinical support and guidance to radiologists and technologists on MRI system usage and workflow optimization.
You will conduct training sessions and create educational materials to ensure proficiency in MRI applications and protocols.
You will assist with system setup, protocol optimization, and troubleshooting to enhance image quality and efficiency.
You will serve as the primary customer liaison for MRI application inquiries and product feedback.
You will collaborate with sales, service, and R&D teams to support product deployment, clinical trials, and workflow improvements.
You will ensure MRI operations adhere to safety guidelines, institutional policies, and regulatory standards.
You will document training, support activities, and protocol changes, and communicate insights for product improvement.

To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/

Your Expertise:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Radiographer Technology, Medical Physicist, and Biomedical Engineering
Minimum 3 years of experiences in Radiology Imaging System
Fluent in English and additional foreign languages are an advantage
Willingness and ability to have high travel session to meet Siemens Healthineers‚Äô Customers
Good problem-solving analytical skills

Who we are: 

We are a team of more than 73,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

How we work: 

When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual‚Äôs potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world‚Äôs most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably. Check our Careers Site at https://jobs.siemens.com/careers

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals with disabilities.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. Please create a profile within our talent community and subscribe to personalized job alert that will keep you posted about new opportunities.

Siemens Healthineers' recruitment is internally managed, with external support permitted only when a qualified supplier has established a formal contract with us. Unsolicited candidate submissions and referrals, absent a current supplier contract, do not establish consent and are ineligible for fees. We delete and destroy unsolicited information, thus, would recommend you refrain from any such practices. Your adherence to our policies is appreciated.

About the job
Mekari is Indonesia's no. 1 Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) company. With our ecosystem of software solutions‚Äîincluding Mekari Jurnal, Mekari Talenta, Mekari Qontak, and Mekari Flex, we aim to facilitate entrepreneurs and leaders as they accelerate the digital transformation of their businesses.

In our 10+ years of journey we have reached over 1 Million platform users, and we're not planning to stop any time soon. We need more people like you: builders and owners with calculated ambition who are ready to #ElevateThroughImpact and raise Indonesia's software standard.

Job Description:

Lead a squad of 3-4 passionate engineers
Work closely with Product Manager and other business stakeholders to design solutions that delight our customers
Architect and develop high-quality software solutions
Work with Technical Program Manager to run development lifecycle (concept, design, test, release, support)
Work closely with DevOps to maintain the application in our infrastructure
Mentor junior developers to develop their skills
Manage knowledge within the team in form of written documentation surrounding technical requirements, deployments, and post-mortems


Requirements/Qualifications:

At least 6 months of experience in technically leading a software project. Experience as a people manager is a huge plus
At least 4 years of experience in developing a medium-scale web and/or backend service as a team
Solid understanding of modern software engineering practices such as TDD, continuous integration, code review, and microservices design patterns
Familiarity with software development methodologies and frameworks such as Agile, XP, and Scrum
Familiarity with containers and container orchestration
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with a focus on collaboration, understanding, and information sharing between team members and stakeholders
Willingness to learn the tech stack being used by the team, primarily Ruby on Rails and VueJs


What You Will Get:

 Competitive salary + daily allowance.
 Premium private health insurance (outpatient, inpatient, maternity, dental).
 Early access to salary + flex installment (employee loan) via Mekari Flex.
 Allowance for sports activities and glasses/contact lenses.
 Flexible working hours with a hybrid work culture.
 Annual and unpaid leaves from day 1 of join date + unlimited sick leave with doctor note.
 Notebook Ownership Program.
 Strategic office location, accessible by MRT.
 Friendly and dynamic work environment.
 Opportunity to build impactful solutions with Indonesia's no. 1 SaaS company.


Our team will review your application and will be in touch if your application is shortlisted to the next stage. If you do not hear from us in 30 days, we will keep your resume on file in case a relevant opportunity opens up.

Don't forget to check our Recruitment FAQ at bit.ly/RecruitmentFAQ-Mekari [ENG] or bit.ly/RekrutmenMekari-FAQ [INA] to find the answers to commonly-asked questions regarding our recruitment process.

We wish you the best. Hope to see you around soon!

About the job
About the Job
As a Post M&A Manager, you are responsible to manage and ensure the success of the integration process following a merger, acquisition, or divestment, with a focus on aligning strategy, culture, systems, and operations to ensure that the expected value and synergies from the transaction are fully realized, while helping the organization adapt effectively and sustainably to change.

Job Responsibilities:
Develop post-acquisition integration plans (people, process, system, culture) by involving all relevant units.
Ensure that the integration execution runs according to the defined timeline, milestones, and synergy targets.
Identify, measure, and monitor synergy achievements (revenue, cost efficiency, operational improvement).
Prepare synergy realization reports for senior management and stakeholders.
Manage organizational change processes, including internal communication, to ensure smooth integration.
Bridge cultural differences between the parent company and the acquired entity.
Identify integration risks (people, system, operational) and develop mitigation strategies.
Serve as the main contact point in resolving post-transaction issues.
Collaborate with various functions (HR, Finance, Legal, Operations, IT) to ensure alignment in integration implementation.
Maintain effective communication with the Board of Directors, shareholders, and strategic partners regarding integration progress.
Prepare integration progress reports, including KPI achievements, challenges, and solution recommendations.

Job Requirements:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Management, Finance, Economics, Industrial Engineering, or related field (MBA preferred).
5-8 years of experience in M&A, specifically in post-Merger Integration, Corporate Development, or Integration Management
Proven track record of managing integration projects for mid-to-large acquisitions.
Experience working in cross-functional environments and coordinating global teams.
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Excellent analytical, financial modeling, and problem-solving abilities.
Superior communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
Deep understanding of business operations and value drivers across functions.

About Kawan Lama Group
Established in 1955, Kawan Lama Group is a multi-sector group of companies who are constantly innovating for improving the quality of lives. About the job
Job Title:

Consultant Risk Advisory ‚Äì PROFIX Consulting Ltd

 Role Overview:

As a Consultant specializing in risk assessment and Internal Audit, you will play a pivotal role in evaluating our and client‚Äôs internal controls, financial systems, and operational processes to identify potential risks and provide strategic recommendations for their mitigation. You will ensure that our client‚Äôs business operations are aligned with best practices and regulatory requirements.

Main Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze financial data, internal controls, and operational processes to identify potential vulnerabilities and areas of improvement.
Develop and execute audit plans that prioritize high-risk areas and critical business processes.
Provide expertise in evaluating the effectiveness of risk management strategies and internal controls.
Collaborate with department heads and team leads to understand business processes and tailor audit procedures accordingly.
Prepare detailed audit reports that outline findings, recommendations, and action plans for improving processes and mitigating risks.
Advise senior management on strategic decisions based on audit findings and risk assessment outcomes.
Monitor the implementation of audit recommendations and track progress towards risk mitigation goals.
Stay updated on industry regulations, standards, and emerging best practices in risk assessment and advisory.

  Person Specification:

Essential

The successful applicant must:
Hold a relevant professional qualification (CPA, ACCA, CA, CMA etc.).

Strong understanding of risk frameworks, controls, and business processes
Proven experience maintaining long-term relationships with a broad network of stakeholders and clients, managing multiple projects simultaneously and prioritizing appropriately.
Proven experience in managing financial performance of the department i.e., revenue, invoicing, and collections.

Desirable

Previous experience in developing, implementing, or assessing Enterprise Risk Management Frameworks

Excellent report writing, presentation and analytical skills.
Previous experience in effectively managing a team of junior members.
Proven track record in delivering internal audit engagements in hospitality, construction, family businesses, and livestock industry.
Share CLEARR values - Collaboration, Leadership, Excellence, Agility, Respect & Responsibility
Independent thinkers who aren‚Äôt afraid to challenge or be challenged.
Always striving to grow yourself, you should be driven to succeed with the ability to see tasks through to the end and remain agile, even when things don‚Äôt go to plan and remain agile, even when things don‚Äôt go to plan.

Fuel your passion

Working on call-out basis as per advice by your supervisor.

We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities

About the job
Company Description

Arista Networks is an industry leader in data-driven, client-to-cloud networking for large data center, campus and routing environments. What sets us apart is our relentless pursuit of innovation. We leverage the latest advancements in cloud computing, artificial intelligence, and software-defined networking to provide our clients with a competitive edge in an increasingly interconnected world. Our solutions are designed to not only meet the current demands of the digital landscape but to also anticipate and adapt to future challenges.

At Arista we value the diversity of thought and perspectives that each employee brings to the table. We believe that fostering an inclusive environment, where individuals from various backgrounds and experiences feel welcome, is essential for driving creativity and innovation.

Our commitment to excellence has earned us several prestigious awards, such as Best Engineering Team, Best Company for Diversity, Compensation, and Work-Life Balance. At Arista, we take pride in our track record of success and strive to maintain the highest standards of quality and performance in everything we do.

Job Description

Who You'll Work With

When you join Arista as part of the Sales Engineering team, you're not just stepping into a role; you're becoming part of a team of industry experts and technical leaders. Typically reporting to the Regional Engineering Manager, you'll be working alongside some of the most skilled field engineers in the industry. Our team prides itself on not just understanding the technology but also the business impact and aligning our solutions with the larger goals of our clients. In collaboration with our Product Management and Software Development teams, you will play a pivotal role in steering product developments, offerings, and strategic direction to best serve our customers and prospects. Supported by the expertise of our world class Arista TAC, cutting-edge proof-of-concept resources, and support of the executive team, you are well-positioned to lead and innovate within the industry.

What You'll Do

As a critical member of the Arista Sales Engineering team , you will act as a trusted advisor to provide pre-sales technical systems engineering support for our customers.

You will partner with the Arista Account Managers to understand customer pain points and conduct white board network architectural reviews in addition to conducting Arista product presentations of Arista‚Äôs Open Networking Data Center and Cognitive Campus (including Wifi) networking solutions, CloudVision (Network Automation), Security (Network Detection), Endpoint Security and Real-time Fabric Monitoring solutions.
You will architect, design and propose Arista Data Center & Campus network solutions using leaf-spine architectures (VxLAN, EVPN) and network overlays to capture additional sales.
Perform hands-on tests to validate customer proof-of-concept setups, Data Center and/or Campus network designs, and network deployments using new products and features.
Put together design guidelines and recommend improvements to customers for the networks they support
Partner with Sales Team to respond to RFP/RFQs
Provide feedback to Product Management and Engineering
Represent Arista at SDN and Open Networking industry events and conferences
Keep up-to-date on competitive solutions, products, and services
Author white papers on technology and product

Qualifications

Requirements:

BS/CS/CE technical degree required
Network Industry certifications including Arista Cloud Engineer (ACE) level 4 - 7 desired.
You possess a minimum of 5+ of L2/L3 networking design and implementation experience with a focus on Data Center, Campus, and Wi-Fi solutions.
Expert level experience with routing and switching including L2/L3 protocols.
You possess recent experience in leaf-spine architecture design.
Demonstrated work experience as either a Sales Engineer, Solutions Architect, Pre-Sales SE or Network Consulting Engineer preferred
Expert knowledge in the following areas: Ethernet, RSTP/ MSTP, VLANs, IP Routing, TCP/IP, OSPF, BGP, eBGP, VxLAN, Multicast, Spanning Tree, QoS
Good understanding of the competitor technology landscape - Cisco, Juniper
Expert level knowledge of industry-standard CLI
Experience with SDN and Network Function Virtualization (NFV) highly desired.
Previous experience building network automation using Python and Ansible desired.
Knowledge of competitive products, solutions, and services
Ability to write white papers a plus

Additional Information

This position is offered as a 1-year fixed-term contract, with the possibility of annual renewal depending on individual performance and organizational requirements. The role provides an opportunity to contribute to Arista‚Äôs innovative networking solutions in Indonesia, with potential for continued professional growth within the company.

About the job

Large-scale language models are evolving rapidly, moving beyond simple chatbots into powerful engines of learning, communication, and cultural understanding. That training data begins with you‚Äîyour expertise will help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for a highly skilled Hausa language specialist who can bring linguistic depth, cultural context, and precision to training data. You‚Äôll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine Hausa text outputs, and provide expert feedback on grammar, syntax, semantics, style, and cultural appropriateness to strengthen model performance.

On a typical day, you will review and annotate Hausa content, assess AI-generated outputs for accuracy and fluency, identify and document error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and linguistic guidelines.

Fluency in Hausa is required, along with demonstrated experience in translation, linguistics, language teaching, editing, or related professional work. Experience in training, coaching, or linguistic annotation is a plus. Clear communication skills, cultural knowledge, and attention to detail are essential.

Ready to channel your Hausa expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help shape the model that will support millions of Hausa speakers worldwide.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. About the job
About Us

Intrepid Asia is a leading Ecommerce and Digital Solutions Provider in South East Asia. We offer end-to-end omni-channel ecommerce management, a wide range of Digital Marketing Services and advanced Market Intelligence, all powered by state of the art inhouse Technology to our client base of leading international brands across all key marketplaces and social platforms in all 6 SEA countries. Brands love our regional presence, our excellent data-driven and growth-focused services which are enabled by the strongest team in the industry, and our advanced marketing and tech capabilities.

We are growing rapidly and as the exclusive partner of Flywheel in SEA, we offer many exciting opportunities to work with leading brands across multiple categories and key industry players. By joining us, you will work on the cutting edge of digital commerce in SEA, and experience what it takes to drive a successful ecommerce business end to end.

The role:

We are seeking a charismatic and energetic Host for our Live Commerce team. The ideal candidate will be the face of our live streaming sessions, engaging with the audience, presenting products, and driving sales through interactive and compelling presentations. You will work closely with our production and marketing teams to create memorable and impactful live commerce experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Host live commerce sessions on various platforms (e.g., Shopee Live, Lazada Live, TikTok Shop).
Present and demonstrate products in an engaging, informative, and entertaining manner.
Interact with viewers in real-time, answering questions and encouraging purchases.
Collaborate with the marketing and production teams to develop content and themes for live sessions.
Stay informed about the products being showcased and the brand‚Äôs identity to accurately represent them.
Analyze viewer engagement and sales metrics to continuously improve performance.
Maintain a strong social media presence to drive viewership and brand loyalty.
Assist in setting up and preparing the live streaming environment.
Provide feedback on products and customer preferences to the marketing team.

Requirements:

Previous experience as a live host, presenter, or in a similar role.
Strong on-camera presence with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to think quickly and adapt to live situations.
A passion for sales and the ability to persuade and influence others.
Knowledge of eCommerce platforms and the live commerce industry is a plus.
Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as required by live sessions.
Familiarity with social media platforms and the ability to leverage them for audience engagement.
Proficient in both English and Indonesian languages.
A high level of professionalism and reliability.

What we offer:

Excellent and competitive compensation package 
Professional and open international working environment ‚Äì culturally integrating the best of all cultures to take the best of each and ensure we build an energetic, commercial, and fun working atmosphere. 
You are one of the pioneers of a new and cutting edge Intrepid product underpinned by strong tech. You have a key position in the Intrepid Insights team working on a unique product solving complex data challenges.
Ample opportunity for personal and professional development, both on the job and through regular training (Ecommerce topics, technical skills, soft skills and leadership training) made available on our proprietary learning platform Intrepid University
You will work with many brilliant co-workers who are movers and shakers of the industry, as well as with leading brand and ecosystem partners across all categories to shape their presence across all ecommerce platforms in the years to come, and will have a broad view on the latest developments in the South East Asian e-commerce ecosystem

Note: we will not be accepting any unsolicited resumes or CVs from headhunting or recruitment agencies at this point. Any CVs or profiles shared with us will not be entertained, and in the event of dispute, Intrepid will not be liable for any material compensation to third parties

job_title: Director Business Unit Water & Maritime APAC
job_description:
About the job
We‚Äôre seeking a complete, all‚Äëround business leader to head our Business Unit Water & Maritime APAC, accelerating growth while delivering measurable impact for communities, clients and our people. You will be fully responsible for the performance of this Unit and inspire a team of 500 employees to turn opportunities into sustainable value across APAC‚Äôs water and maritime markets.

What will you do as our Business Unit Director for Water & Maritime APAC

The W&M APAC business unit has advisory groups within Australia, Vietnam, Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore and New Zealand. As the Director Business Unit (DBU) for Water & Maritime APAC, you are directly working together with the directors of the advisory groups who report to you.

You will translate corporate and Business Line ambitions into clear plans, then mobilise the organisation to execute‚Äîcombining a‚ÄØstrong growth mindset‚ÄØwith a culture of inclusion, learning and innovation.

You will:

Set and deliver growth strategy for the Water & Maritime sector in APAC‚Äîprioritising markets, defining offers and pricing, and driving robust go to market plans that expand revenue, margin and market share.
Own BU performance with full accountability for commercial, operational and people outcomes‚Äîlinking strategy to P&L, pipeline health, utilisation and delivery excellence.
Significantly grow and scale teams: attracting, developing and retaining diverse talent; building high performing leadership benches; and aligning multi country teams behind shared goals.
Lead client engagement across APAC‚Äîstrengthening strategic accounts, partnerships and frameworks.
Champion culture and change‚Äîrole modelling an inclusive, safe and purpose led environment; communicating strategy clearly; and leading transformation with clarity and empathy.


Where you will work

At Haskoning, you will join an independent, employee-owned international consultancy that combines engineering, design, and consultancy services with software and technology. Our mission, "Enhancing Society Together," drives us to create a positive impact on the world.

We offer purpose-driven and challenging work in diverse international projects, leveraging our 140+ years of expertise. With over 6,800 employees in more than 25 countries, we work together to turn challenges into opportunities and make a real impact on society. We collaborate with leading clients in markets such as infrastructure, climate resilience, renewable energy, decarbonisation of industry, and sustainable mobility.

As our new Business Unit Director you will become part of the Water & Maritime Business line and part of our global Business Line Management Team. The Water & Maritime APAC Business Unit is building on a strong foundation to deliver integrated solutions across the entire water and maritime spectrum. We combine expertise strengthened by digital innovation and climate resilience strategies to ensure sustainable and future-ready outcomes for communities and industries across the Asia-Pacific region.

What You Bring

You are an inspiring and ambitious leader who can translate strategy into action and guide teams through change with clarity and confidence. You foster a culture of inclusion, engagement and accountability, while maintaining a strong focus on results. You communicate effectively, build trust quickly and thrive in complex, multi‚Äëstakeholder environments.

Your mindset is growth‚Äëoriented, and you are passionate about developing people and creating high‚Äëperforming teams. You combine strategic thinking with strong commercial acumen, ensuring sustainable growth and profitability.

Hard skills and experience:

Proven leadership of a business unit (or equivalent) of scale and complexity, with P&L accountability.
Growth track record‚Äîyou have scaled teams significantly, built robust pipelines, expanded accounts, and delivered step-change improvements in revenue, margin and cash.
Broad understanding of the water & environmental sector.
Extensive experience in the Water and/or Maritime sector across APAC ‚Äîcomfortable operating across cultures, navigating different regulatory environments and customer needs.
Excellent written and spoken English.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in related disciplines.
10+ years in the sector, including 5+ years leading at BU/region level or equivalent.
Flexibility to travel as required, mostly within Europe and Asia Pacific.


Location:

This exciting opportunity is open to both local and international applicants across the countries we operate in Asia-Pacific.

What We Offer You

At Haskoning, we believe that the well-being of our employees is essential to our shared success. That‚Äôs why we offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to support both your professional development and personal well-being.

What we offer:

A solid foundation: A competitive base salary with annual increases.
Leadership Autonomy: shape strategy, lead teams, and influence BU direction.
Board Exposure: Opportunities to engage with the board and senior stakeholders.
Impact and Legacy: Ability to drive transformation, innovation, or growth with measurable impact.
Purpose-Driven Mission: Alignment with ESG goals, sustainability, or social impact.
Inclusive Leadership: Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion at the director level.
Strong Governance: Transparent decision-making, ethical leadership, and stability.
Prioritisation of your well-being: by offering flexibility, support and a strong sense of community to ensure work and personal life go hand in hand.
Development opportunities: A wide range of training and development programs, including tailored learning paths, learning weeks, and various knowledge-sharing groups. 


Are you our new colleague?

Then we would like to meet you! Click on the apply button and upload your resume and motivation letter. Please include your home-base country/city location in your application.

After receiving your application, we will contact you as soon as possible.

The application process then consists of a minimum of 2 interviews and an assessment. Are we all enthusiastic after this? Then you will receive an offer from us, and we will be happy to welcome you on board!

Do you have any questions about the role or the process? You can always contact Carolyn Hulford, HR Business Partner at carolyn.hulford@haskoning.com

At Haskoning, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered. Our mission of "Enhancing Society Together" drives us to create an environment that embraces each individual‚Äôs unique background, identity, and perspective. Regardless of your experience, background, age, gender, or other personal characteristics‚Äîyou are welcome here. We believe that diversity makes us stronger and that an inclusive culture gives everyone the opportunity to grow and contribute. Read more about our ED&I initiatives on our dedicated webpage.

Due to the privacy law, please submit your application via the apply button and not via email. 

Haskoning does not require agency assistance and does not accept unsolicited introductions.

About the job
Your Role 

Reach Truck Operator is essential for the smooth and safe operation of a warehouse or distribution center. Operators use reach trucks, which are compact and agile, to handle goods in tight spaces and high-racking systems

Main Duties 

 Place the goods that they have been unloaded from containers or trucks to be placed in predetermined places in the warehouse based on the type of product, or special conditions of the goods following SAP warehouse management system.
 Ensure the goods to be storage in the right line and follow SOP. E.g. pallet usage; wrapping, quality check. Keep the storage area clean and tidy.
 Take the goods out to be delivered by suppliers (import or local) from the racking and place them into a predetermined area before being loaded into the vehicle (truck/car box) for delivery.
 Ensure the goods are in good condition by checking the material accordance to quality requirement before delivery / shipment to costumers.
 Perform forklift (reach truck) is maintained according to manual and so that it is always in a ready-to-use condition. Perform checklist and report to upline supervisor.
 To use a reach truck to safely load, unload, and move materials in narrow warehouse aisles or high-storage environments, ensuring efficient material handling and inventory management, safely.
 Carry out work in accordance with the procedures listed in ISO 9001: 2015, ISO 14001: 2015 and ISO 45001:2018.
 Follow QSHE regulation, standard and procedures including 5 golden roles and implement them that apply in the company.

Authorities

 Maintain the condition of the reach truck so that it is always in good working condition.

Job Requirement

 Education Senior High Scholl (SMA) or Equivalent
 Possess a valid Forklift Operator License (SIO).
 Proficient in operating Counterbalance Forklifts & Reach Trucks
 Understand safe Material Handling Equipment operation
 Minimum 2 years of experience
 Willing to work in shifts
 Able to work well with others
 Adhere strictly to all health, safety, and security regulations (OSHA standards).

About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
This role requires candidate to work in Jakarta, Indonesia.

Client Overview

Our client is a leading global provider of ICT infrastructure and smart devices, the world's largest supplier of telecommunications network equipment, and the second-biggest maker of smartphones, established in 1987, and headquartered in China. It has grown to become the world‚Äôs largest supplier of telecommunications equipment and a major innovator in 5G, cloud computing, AI, and consumer electronics, with over 207,000 employees worldwide, and operates in more than 170 countries and regions. In Indonesia, it is playing a pivotal role in the country‚Äôs digital transformation through partnerships with governments, telcos, enterprises, education institutions, and other industry segments.

Job Role

The Business Development Manager ‚Äì Cloud plays a pivotal role in driving the company's cloud business growth across Indonesia. This role focuses on identifying and capturing new cloud opportunities by implementing corporate business development strategies, engaging deeply with customers across diverse industries (including government, finance, enterprise, manufacturing, logistics, media, and digital-native sectors), and building strong, strategic partnerships.

The position manages end-to-end business development activities, from customer insight gathering and solution positioning to leading go-to-market (GTM) initiatives and driving joint success with ecosystem partners. By aligning customer requirements with the company's extensive cloud portfolio (public, private, hybrid clouds, SaaS, PaaS, IaaS), the manager ensures sustainable growth, customer success, and high satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities

Cloud Business Strategy & Opportunity Development
Implement the company's corporate cloud business development strategies and achieve defined sales and growth targets.
Identify and explore new cloud opportunities across priority sectors such as government, finance, manufacturing, logistics, e-commerce, fintech, media, and gaming.
Develop and execute detailed customer development plans based on deep insights into industry trends and customer needs.
End-to-End Customer & Partner Engagement
Manage customer relationships throughout the entire lifecycle, from initial opportunity discovery to contract closure and post-sales success.
Analyze customer requirements, key decision-making structures, and pain points to craft tailored value propositions.
Build and strengthen strategic partnerships with software vendors, system integrators, and other ecosystem players to co-create industry solutions.
Solution Positioning & Go-to-Market Execution
Match customer and market demands with the company's cloud solutions. Design and lead commercial and solution proposals, factoring in competition, profitability, and deliverability.
Collaborate closely with sales and technical teams to drive joint GTM initiatives and ensure effective execution of partner and customer programs.
Strategic Alignment & Ecosystem Enablement
Ensure cross-functional alignment, facilitating effective resource utilization to support partner and customer success.
Support partners through enablement programs, including training and certification, to strengthen joint capabilities and expand the company's ecosystem reach.
Project Operation and Customer Success
Monitor project operations and ensure timely delivery, high customer satisfaction, and achievement of revenue goals.
Actively gather market feedback to refine solutions and contribute to continuous improvement in the company's cloud offerings.

Candidate Requirements

Education: At least Bachelor Degree in preferably in Telecommunications, Computer Science, Informatics Engineering, or other IT-related disciplines.
Experience:
Minimum of 8 years of experience in business development roles within the cloud or ICT industry, with a strong track record in SaaS, PaaS, or public/private cloud solutions.
Proven experience in Business Development or related functions within the ICT industry, particularly with cloud products and services (public/private clouds, SaaS, PaaS, etc.).
Industry Expertise:
Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies and market ecosystems, with working knowledge of major platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and the company's competitive differentiators.
Established network and insights into key sectors such as government, education, manufacturing, logistics, finance, e-commerce, fintech, media, or gaming.
Language: English (professional fluency in spoken and written).
Technical Expertise:
Strong ability to understand customers‚Äô business, commercial, and strategic objectives, and to influence their planning and purchasing decisions.
Demonstrated skills in designing and executing business plans, leading project operations, and driving customer success from opportunity to delivery.
Professional Qualities:
Sales mindset with a passion for driving growth, highly self-motivated, and results-oriented.
Excellent team player with initiative, a quick learner with a strong sense of responsibility, and highly responsive to customer needs.
Outstanding presentation and project management skills, capable of engaging both internal and external stakeholders effectively.

Sales Strategy, English Language, Sales and Marketing, Business Development, Project Management, Business Growth Strategy, Account Management, Business Strategy

job_title: Sub Project Lead Construction ‚Äì Site Management Yard (Batam, Indonesia)
job_description:
About the job
At TenneT, we offer an exciting opportunity to contribute to the execution of our offshore grid connection systems. As a Sub Project Lead Construction in Batam, Indonesia, for our 2GW HVDC projects, you will ensure that the technical design, quality, and schedule for the construction are executed safely, efficiently, and in a controlled manner‚Äîwithin a culturally diverse and challenging environment. Ready to make an impact?

Your contribution to TenneT

As Sub Project Lead Construction ‚Äì Yard, you will lead the site team at the shipyard in Batam and oversee the delivery of the designed platform scope. You will be part of the 2GW Program within the Portfolio GE Seatrium, responsible for three HVDC offshore converter platforms built in Singapore and Batam, to be installed in the North Sea by 2028.

You will manage a team of 4 to 6 technical specialists (e.g. piping, HVAC, mechanical), who monitor contractor activities and ensure compliance with contractual requirements. You will also collaborate closely with colleagues in Singapore, the Netherlands, and the contractor.

Your Key Responsibilities Include

Monitoring the construction schedule, mitigating delays, and ensuring yard activities comply with design specifications.
Providing technical leadership to the specialist team in Batam.
Organizing and leading regular technical meetings with the contractor.
Coordinating contract processes, including handling deviations and change requests (RfC).
Safeguarding contractual aspects, including handling requests for acceptance (RfA).

Additional Responsibilities

Acting as a consultant and sparring partner for other project members.
Managing commissioning activities and interfaces.
Reporting progress and deviations to the Lead Construction.
Preparing decision proposals.

You will start with a period of approximately 2 months in the Netherlands, followed by a long-term assignment (approx. 4 years) in Batam, Indonesia.

Your profile and background

We are looking for a seasoned professional who brings both technical expertise and cultural sensitivity to this international role.

You Bring

An academic working and thinking level with a relevant university degree (or equivalent qualification).
At least 15 years of experience in platform or shipyard construction management.
IPMA Level C or B certification (due to project management responsibilities).
Strong communication and social skills, independence, decisiveness, and a proactive mindset.
Willingness to relocate to Batam, Indonesia for approximately 4 years.
EU nationality (required due to visa regulations).
Fluency in English (written and spoken).

Our recruiting process

In our online-application-form you can apply within only some minutes as long as this job is posted. Afterwards we screen your application and get back to you as soon as possible. Our selection process consists of two interviews and a VOG screening.

Our offer

We are family friendly and flexible

Flexible working hours without fixed times and home office options allow you to organize your work individually.

Health - your basis

Because we think it is important that you are healthy and feel good, we offer all kinds of great extras: we provide various opportunities to work out via our Always Energy program which offers a wide range of opportunities to indulge in sports (organised training for different sports, competitions and events). And you will receive a sports allowance if you are a member of a sports club, while in the Netherlands.

Modern working environment

Modern IT-tools
Ergonomic workstations
Very well equipped conference rooms and communication solutions that enable cross-location and cross-border collaboration

Attractive Remuneration And Social Benefits

We offer great benefits such as a salary based on our Collective Labor Agreement, an annual bonus and excellent pension scheme.

Personal development

Personal growth is something we actively stimulate within TenneT. For example we have our own TenneT Academy where you can explore and develop your own set of skills. More than that: you have the opportunity to work in an innovative company with an international network, to use your personal strengths and to shape the future together with us.

This will be our challenge

Large Projects Offshore is a key contributor to the energy transition. The Unit is responsible for the current and future development of the offshore grid as a whole and subsequently for the development and realization of the DC interconnectors and the Offshore Wind Farm grid connections in both the German and Dutch sectors of the North Sea.

Additional Information

TenneT offers you the opportunity to contribute to a sustainable energy future. You will work in an international environment where innovation, collaboration, and personal development are key.

We Offer

A Dutch employment contract with an expat policy during the assignment in Batam.
A gross monthly salary in scale 9 (‚Ç¨4,675 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨9,196), based on a 40-hour workweek.
43 holidays per year (full-time basis).
A permanent contract with a two-month probation period.
A solid pension scheme via ABP (70% employer contribution).

All mentioned employment conditions apply to a full-time position unless otherwise stated.

We value a good work-life balance and your personal development. Therefore, we offer flexible solutions such as:

Hybrid working options, including travel, internet, and home office allowances.(while in the Netherlands).
Vitality support, including contributions to sports memberships and health insurance, while in the Netherlands.
Learning opportunities via the TenneT Academy.

We encourage initiative and give you the space to bring new ideas. Together, we ensure that the Netherlands remains in motion and ready for the energy of tomorrow.

Apply Now!

Ready to make an impact? Apply today and become part of our team!

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Bianca Kreijger, Recruiter People & Talent Acquisition at Bianca.Kreijger@tennet.eu or +31 6 4216 3962.

Together, we build a sustainable energy future!

The position may gets unpublished earlier, so don't hesitate to apply!

About the job
Are you a Basque language expert eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving from clever chatbots into powerful engines of linguistic discovery. With high-quality training data, tomorrow‚Äôs AI can democratize world-class education, keep pace with cutting-edge research, and streamline communication for Basque speakers everywhere. That training data begins with you‚Äîwe need your expertise to help power the next generation of AI.

We‚Äôre looking for Basque language specialists who live and breathe Basque grammar, syntax, morphology, spelling, phonology, and pragmatics. You‚Äôll challenge advanced language models on topics like ergativity, verb conjugation, noun declension, sentence structure, dialectal variation, formal and informal speech, and the nuances of the Basque writing system‚Äîdocumenting every failure mode so we can harden model reasoning.

On a typical day, you will converse with the model on language scenarios, verify factual accuracy and logical soundness, capture reproducible error traces, and suggest improvements to our prompt engineering and evaluation metrics.

A master‚Äôs or PhD in Basque language, linguistics, or a closely related field is ideal; peer-reviewed publications, teaching experience, or hands-on linguistic analysis projects signal fit. Clear, metacognitive communication‚Äî‚Äúshowing your work‚Äù‚Äîis essential.

Ready to turn your Basque language expertise into the knowledge base for tomorrow‚Äôs AI? Apply today and start teaching the model that will teach the world.

We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor, you‚Äôll supply a secure computer and high-speed internet; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply.

Job title: Basque Language Specialist ‚Äì AI Trainer

Employment type: Contract

Workplace type: Remote

Seniority level: Mid-Senior Level

About the job
Overview

Overview: 

The Commercial Accounting Manager plays a key role in ensuring accurate financial reporting, effective Discount & Allowance (D&A) controls, and timely claim settlement. This role supports the Indonesian business unit through rigorous review, analysis, and compliance of Discount and Allowance (D&A) processes while collaborating with Commercial, Control, IBM (BPO), and other key stakeholders. The position acts as the center of expertise (COE) in D&A accounting and control, ensuring adherence to US and local GAAP as well as internal company policies.

Responsibilities

We will count on you to: 

Financial Accounting & Management Reporting

Coordinate the monthly closing and reporting process of D&A, ensuring timeliness and accuracy.
Lead the verification of accruals and SD-Rebate setup, including claim validation and settlement.
Conduct monthly and quarterly reviews of pending claims/accruals and ensure proper accounting treatment.
Analyze accruals and actual spending vs. plan/forecast, last month, and last year; provide insightful commentary to the planning and reporting teams.
Prepare D&A reports and input for Business Segment Review (BSR), monthly closing, and other finance reviews.
Monitor and support IBM BPO's day-to-day D&A transactional activities, reports, and issue resolution.
Drive continuous improvement of financial processes related to D&A.

 Compliance & Controls

Ensure compliance with US GAAP, local GAAP, and internal Marketplace and Revenue Recognition policies.
Review and reinforce GCS controls related to D&A, trade promotions, and rebate management.
Lead the development and implementation of robust financial controls for promotions, rebates, and customer claims across multiple platforms.
Ensure accurate documentation for statutory audits and external reporting.

 Business Partnering

Act as Finance‚Äôs point of contact for Customers and Distributors on D&A claims and reconciliation matters.
Coordinate with Commercial Key Account Managers to reconcile D&A bookings (e.g., rebates, discretionary promotions, contractual supports).
Educate Sales and Finance teams on relevant D&A policies, financial compliance, and claim procedures.
Collaborate cross-functionally to support business growth while ensuring D&A accountability.

 Process Optimization

Support the improvement and simplification of commercial processes (e.g., claim mechanism, operational flow, SAP integration).
Drive balance confirmation with customers and ensure timely resolution of discrepancies.
Assist in SAP implementation initiatives related to Sales to Collection and Trade Promotion Management.
Identify process bottlenecks and propose improvement initiatives.

 External & Statutory Compliance

Support statutory and government submissions in coordination with IBM Shared Service teams.
Assist the Control team in external audit processes, external reporting, and financial policy implementations.
Ensure proper document archiving for audit and compliance purposes.

Qualifications

What you need to have: 

5-7 years of experience in accounting / finance controls background in FMCG industry
Min. Bachelors degree in Accounting / Finance
Strong analytical thinking and financial acumen
Excellent stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills
High integrity, accountability, and resilience in managing compliance and control
Strong communication and business partnering skills
Proficiency in Excel, financial reporting tools, and SAP systems
